loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long O. is a villager in Sen Bon village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Pok Soka, is a construction worker. They do not earn much money live on. Therefore, Mrs. Long O. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to feed and to expand her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 26 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and expand her business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has been selling dresses and making clothes in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. Currently, she is able to earn a profit of approximately $50 each month. Salma is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more material and clothing to increase her output.

Salma is 20 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and materials to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Som Yaem Group Loan

texts.en:
Four members in Tumnob Leu village in Kampong Cham province form this loan group. Mrs. Som Y. is a group leader who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Mel Mil, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar or wine. However, he can no longer do this business because he does not have enough equipment, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy palm juice equipment in order to restart her husband's business. Mrs. Som Y. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school.

The husband of one other group member, Mrs. Yem S. A., is standing in for her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy palm juice equipment to restart a business

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Tha S., 34, earns about $1.25 per day as a grocery seller in her village in the Prasat Commune of the Kampong Thom province. She is married, with two children living at home. Her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Chhem, 29, is a motorcycle taxi driver in the Siem Reap province, which is a tourist area. He has been driving a taxi since 2004, and normally earns about $10 per day.  Because he has an old motorcycle, her husband's business does not attract as many customers, so his income is less and he often must pay for repairs. Tha needs a loan of $375 to purchase a new motorcycle to attract more customers to her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to attract customers to her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Theim Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng T. is the leader of a loan group of four who all live in Tumnob Leu village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Mrs. Seng T. is a 51-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan, so this member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Mrs. Khen C. is a villager in Sen Bon village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is a 46-year-old widow and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other three attend the local school. She does not earn enough money for a living. Therefore, Mrs. Khen C. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to feed, so as to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena sells charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. Charcoal is a common household item in Tanzania, as it is used by many women to cook and heat food. Few families own a stove or oven. Zuwena is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $50 each month.

She completed one prior loan with BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she may further increase her inventory of charcoal.

Zuwena is 46 years old, married, and has four children: ages 17, 15, 11, and 4-and-a-half.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Uy

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Uy K. has taken a loan in order to improve her living conditions. She now lives in Ponlai village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem on her land because of infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Uy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make it more productive. Mrs. Uy K. is a 56-year-old widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to restore her field

loans.name: Suk

texts.en:
Suk M., 40, is married and lives with his wife and five children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. Since 1999, he has been working growing rice and many kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make US$ 10 in revenue each day. His wife, Thoang Sokunthea is a garment factory worker, making about US$ 2.50 each day as well to support the family. This couple gets added support from one of their children who works in a garment factory like her mother. Four children are students.

Suk M. would like to take out a loan of US$ 600 to purchase fertilizer and seeds to use on his plantation. With the rest of the loan, he will raise ducks for eggs for additional profit to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertiliser and raise ducks

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros M. was born in 1953 and now lives in Sen Bon village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She and her husband, Mr. Jeth Hoo, are farmers. They are the parents of two children who are employed in a garment factory. However, they do not earn much money for a living. Therefore, Mrs. Ros M. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to feed, so as to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to expand her business

loans.name: Bich

texts.en: Mrs. Bich P. is a villager in Kraing Krachang village in Takeo province. She weaves silk for a living. She now has a lot of customers in this business, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave to meet her customers’ demand. Mrs. Bich P. is 55 years old and the mother of an 18-year-old child who helps her in the business.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem O. is a villager in Deum Pour village in Takeo province. She is a farmer, and her husband, Mr. Hang Meng, uses a boat to ferry people. Unfortunately, he now faces an obstacle because his boat is too old and uncomfortable, so his wife decided to ask for a loan and combine it with her savings to buy a new boat. Mrs. Khoem O. is 45 years old and the mother of two children who all attend the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new boat for a ferry service

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 10 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.  

Siti is 45 years old, married, and has seven children: ages 7, 10, 15, 20, 21, 23, and 27.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng K. is a villager in Thmei village in Kampong Cham province. She is a widow and the mother of five children, four of whom are fruit sellers while the other is a worker in a garment factory. She owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She faces an obstacle now, as her field's productivity has declined because of infertile soil and because she has no workers to help her work the land. Although Mrs. Eng K.’s family members all have businesses, they still do not earn much money for a living. Therefore, Mrs. Eng K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer with oxen to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a laborer

loans.name: Mrs. Mey Uok Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mey U. is the leader of a loan group with six members who all live in Pou Doh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Morn Ran, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. Mey U. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Mey U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others attend the local school. 

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan, so this member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Hul

texts.en: Hul N., 41, is married and lives with two young children and her husband in the Kandal, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been worked selling groceries in her village to earn a living and is able to make US$13 in revenue each day, while her husband, Vann Bros, 42, is a policeman. He makes US$6 each day. One of their children is a student, and the other one is too young to attend the school. Each month she spends around US$60 on foods, US$6 on utility, US$10 on her child's education, and US$50 on their transportation. Hul N. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase rice for sale. This will increase her daily profits. In the future, she plans to build rooms onto her home to rent out to the garment factory workers.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija has been selling shoes in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory and increase her sales.

Khadija is 22 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is 45 years old, married, and has 9 children: ages 6, 8, 15, 17, 18, 20, 22, 24, and 25. She has owned a small business in Zanzibar for ten years. She works daily from 8:00am to 9:00pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $45 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo A. est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant.  Pour gagner de l’argent il opère une boutique des pièces détachées à deux roues à Kpalimé au Togo. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter le stock de sa petite boutique pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients.  Spécifiquement, il veut acheter les pièces moto généralement importées du Nigeria pour revendre.  Avec l’amélioration de son activité, il peut mieux subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.
texts.en:
Kodzo A. is 28 years old, married, and the father of one child. To earn money, he has a shop selling spare parts for motorbikes in Kpalimé, Togo. With this loan, his second with FECECAV, he wishes to increase the inventory of his small shop to meet customer demands. Specifically, he wants to buy engine parts generally imported from Nigeria in order to resell them. With the improvement of his business, he can better support his child and thus help his community to develop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba O. has a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar.  She has taken out one prior loan from BRAC Tanzania and as a result, she is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is requesting her second loan so that she can further expand her business and increase her profit.  

Habiba is 45 years old, single, and has no chidlren.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is a tailor in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has received one prior loan from BRAC Tanzania which she paid back successfully and on time. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month. She is seeking her second loan for a larger amount than her first so that she can buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Ashura is 31 years old, married, and has four children.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Binasa

texts.en: Binasa Dugonjić was born in 1983. She is married and comes from Hadžići, a part of Sarajevo. Binasa`s husband is employed in a local company and earns obout 1200 KM. Binasa is mother of two children who are not school-aged. She is a housewife who has a garden, cows and sheep. But she was not able to prepare the food for her cattle for the winter, so she requests a loan in WWI in amount of 600 KM to purchase it. Her little business helps her to provide more income for her family and be able to pay their daily costs.

loans.use: To buy food for cattle

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla M. est un jeune homme de 30 ans et vit à Kpalimé avec ses deux enfants au Togo. Il a une expérience riche en informatique et  désire se lancer dans les affaires pour installer un cyber café ce qui est pour lui une véritable aventure car difficile de trouver les fonds. Par ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il désire réaliser son rêve et tirer rapidement profit de cet investissement. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla M. is a 30-year-old young man who lives in Kpalimé with his two children, in Togo. His experience with computers is rich, and he would like to get started in the business of an internet café, which is a bit of a gamble because of the difficulty of finding the funds. With this first FECECAV loan, he would like to realize his dream and to derive a quick profit from this investment. He intends to use this opportunity to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computers to install in an internet café

loans.name: Aweza

texts.en:
Aweza owns a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $110 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.

Aweza has three children, aged 2, 4, and 8.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Maida

texts.en: Maida Muratović is 23 years old, is married, and lives in Sarajevo.  Her husband works in a local factory and earns about 900 KM a month. Maida spends her time watching children to provide extra income for her family. She currently watches three children but would like to extend her business. She would like a first loan in WWI in amount of 1000 KM to buy more equipment for her job and additional wood for heating.

loans.use: To buy equipment and wood for heating

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Джаборова Мунаввар жительница города Турсунзаде. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 39 лет.Работает на рынке «Саховат» в городе Душанбе. Занимается торговлей уже пять лет. Торгует женской одеждой. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев. Ее муж не работает . Поэтому вся ответственность лежит на ней и ей просто необходимо увеличивать и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Munavar D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. She works at the Sahovat market in Dushanbe and has been in sales for five years. She sells women’s clothes. Her husband is unemployed; thus the responsibility of supporting the family and growing her business lies with Munavar. She plans to obtain the loan in order to increase goods turnover. She will be able to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Dame A. Justine est née vers 1963 à Cotonou. Elle est originaire de Ouidah.Veuve depuis 04 ans, elle a 04 enfants à sa charge. Après avoir abandonné les classes au CM2, dame A. Justine reçut une formation en  couture qu'elle a exercé pendant une dizaine d'année. Parallèlement, elle a initié la vente de divers articles à savoir conserves, pâtes alimentaires et savons. Finalement elle dût abandonner la couture au profit du commerce qui lui procure plus de revenus. Elle a sollicité ce deuxième prêt de 120000fcfa pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Justine A. was born around 1963 in Cotonou. She is originally from Ouidah. A widow for four years, she has four children in her care. After having dropped out of school in the fifth grade, she received training in sewing, which she put to use for a dozen years. Concurrently, she initiated selling various articles, namely canned foods, pasta, and soap. She finally had to abandon sewing in favor of commerce, which brings in more income for her. She is requesting this second loan amounting to 120,000 francs CFA to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three 50-kg sacks of rice, fifteen 5-kg sacks of rice, a 25-liter drum of oil

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Каримова Нигина  жительница города Турсунзаде. Работает на рынке «Саховат» , который находится в городе Душанбе. Занимается торговлей мужской одежды. Опыт в сфере бизнеса составляет уже 4 года. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы завезти сезонный товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 13 месяцев.Возраст 26 лет и она не замужем. Живет с родителями и помогает обеспечивать свою семью.
texts.en:
Nigina K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, married, lives with her parents and helps support her family. She works at the Sahovat market located in Dushanbe. She sells men’s clothes and has been in this business for 4 years. Nigina plans to obtain the loan in order to bring in seasonal goods. She will repay the loan within 13 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Inomdjon

texts.ru: Каримов Иномджон житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст 21 год, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Уже один год занимается такси. Имеет свой автомобиль , который использует в качестве транспорта. Ему необходим кредит для того , чтобы сделать ремонт автомобиля. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Inomdjon K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 21 years old, married and has a child. He has been in a taxi business for one year and owns a car. Inomdjon needs a loan in order to make repairs on his car. He will be able to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi M. est une commerçante honnête qui tient une boutique d’alimentation générale dans un quartier non loin du centre commercial de la ville de Kpalimé au Togo. Elle est âgée de32 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Madame Afi  veut gagner la  confiance de ses clients, de ses fournisseurs et de ses créanciers et souhaite par ce  crédit augmenter son fond de commerce pouvant lui permettre de renouveler dans la mesure du possible son stock de marchandises, réaliser plus de bénéfice et faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi M. is an honest tradeswoman who has a general food store in a district not far from the commercial center of Kpalimé in Togo. She is 32 years old and has four children. Mrs. M. wants to gain the trust of her customers, her suppliers and her creditors. With this loan, she wants to increase her business funds, allowing her to replenish her stock as much as she can, increase her profit and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods to resell

loans.name: Mohbiga

texts.ru: Каримова Мохбига проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем  и имеет троих детей.Имеет среднее образование  и занимается торговлей детской одежды.Занимается этим бизнесом уже шесть лет. Она планирует развивать бизнес , путем получения кредита . Кредит поможет ему завезти новый ассортимент и увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohbiga K. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. Mohbiga has a high school degree and has been selling children clothes for the last 6 years. She would like to expand her business and for this purpose has applied for the loan. This loan will allow Mohbiga to purchase new clothes for sale and increase her profits. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent payment

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Originaire de Ouidah, dame K. Antoinette est âgée de 42 ans . Placée très tôt auprès d'une tutrice, elle n'eut pas la chance d'aller à l'école mais fut initiée par cette dernière à la vente de nourriture. Après son mariage, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de divers articles, ce que d'ailleurs elle finit pas abandonner au profit  de la vente de nourriture. Aux dits de dame K. Antoinette, cette activité lui procure d'énormes revenus. C'est pour la renforcer qu'elle opte pour ce troisième prêt de 150000fcfa. Mariée à DOVONON Pascal, menuisier de profession, elle est mère de 08 enfants dont la dernière Yabo est en classe de CM2.
texts.en:
Originally from Ouidah, Benin, Mrs. Antoinette K. is 42 years old. Placed with a guardian at a very young age, she did not have an opportunity to go to school, but instead her guardian introduced her to selling food. After getting married, she became involved in selling various things, but she ended up abandoning these sales in favor of the profit to be gained from selling food. According to Mrs. K., this business generates a huge income. She is going for this third loan of 150,000 FCFA ($300) to improve her business. Married to Pascal Dovonon, a carpenter by profession, she is mother to eight children, the youngest of whom, Yabo, is in the 5th grade at school.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, two cans of vegetable oil, two cases of pasta and half a case of tinned tomatoes.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Махмадкулов Абубакр житель города Турсунзаде. Возраст 35 лет. Женат и имеет троих детей. Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Занимается  животноводством уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит в размере 600 долларов США. Погашать кредит планирует в течение  12 месяцев. Он купит бычка , и откормив его сможет продать по более выгодной цене , через три месяца. Это даст хороший доход для его семьи
texts.en:
Abubakr M. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. He is 35 years old, married and has three children. Abubakr has been raising cattle for a living for the last 10 years. He is hoping to take out a 600 US dollar loan and pay it back in the next 12 months. Abubakr wants to purchase an additional calf which he will raise and fatten then sell at a profitable price in the next three months. This will significantly supplement the income of his family.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra E. est âgé de 44 ans et mère de trois enfants. Elle est sage femme et propriétaire d’une clinique installée à Kpalimé au Togo. Elle prend toujours son affaire au sérieux et désire par cette chance de Kiva et ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV faire des approvisionnements en produits pharmaceutiques indispensable pour son activité et tirer rapidement. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire ses patients et de par conséquent gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Abra E. is 44 years old and mother to three children. She is a clever woman and owns a medical clinic in Kpalimé, Togo. She always takes her work seriously, and with this opportunity from Kiva and this second loan from Kiva Field Partner, FECECAV, she wants to quickly stock up with essential pharmaceutical products for her clinic. This will allow her to better serve her patients and therefore make more money to provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pharmaceutical supplies to better serve her patients.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Хакназарова Фотима проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет , замужем и   имеет четверых детей. Работает на рынке Дехкон. Имеет торговую точку , где торгует одеждой . Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Fotima H. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She works at the Dehkon market where she sells clothing at a market stall. To expand her inventory Fotima would like to apply for this loan which she is planning to pay back in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Урунова  Саодат жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 38 лет,разведенна, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Саодат занимается куплей продажей обуви и женской одежды.Она имеет  небольшую торговую точку на центральном рынке города.Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.На кредит клиентка хочет увеличить товарооборот.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saodat U. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. She is 38 years old, divorced and has three children. Saodat has a high school degree and makes a living selling shoes and women clothes. She manages a small market stall at the city's central market. This business is the sole source of income for her large family and Saodat is hoping to use this loan to expand her inventory and consequently improve sales. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Originaire d'Avrankou dans le département de l'Ouémé, dame K. Edith est veuve depuis 06 ans et a 03 enfants dont  les deux derniers sont encore à sa  charge. Après l'abandon des classes en 4ème, elle s'est mise à vendre des légumes puis ensuite du pétrole. Depuis 6 ans elle s'est spécialisée dans l'esthétique traditionnel qui consiste à faire les soins des ongles des pieds et des mains avec du vernis. En plus de cela, elle vend de la bouillie traditionnelle à base de maïs communément appelée "akpan". Elle est actuellement en rupture de stock de vernis  et surtout de maïs. C'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 120000fcfa  pour consolider son activité.
texts.en:
Coming from Avrankou in Ouémé Province, Mrs. Edith K. has been a widow for 6 years and has three children, of whom the younger two are still in her care. After she left off attending school in 8th grade, she began to sell vegetables and then gasoline. For the past 6 years, she has specialized in traditional body care, caring for nails, feet, and putting nail polish on hands. Moreover, she sells the traditional porridge made of corn (maize) commonly known as "akpan". Currently she is out of nail polish and especially out of corn. For that reason, she is asking for this, her third loan of 120,000 F CFA to consolidate her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a sack of corn (maize), a sack of granulated sugar, and a half-case of milk

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji is a wife of W. A.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, and has been living in it for the past 6 years. She is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Shagufta baji’s husband has a grocery shop in the community, a business he has run for the past 18 years. Shagufta baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes four other members. Husna baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils to resell. Anwar baji and Siddiqan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of M.. She has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of seven children: one son and six daughters. Her first two daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. The other children are free and don’t do anything.

Zubaida baji’s husband has a shoe-selling business. He has been selling shoes for the past 5 years. Zubaida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more shoes for her husband's business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes three other members. Samina baji and Shamim baji each want a loan to buy cooking oil and spices for their food businesses. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy candies to sell in shops.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Âgée de 30 ans, dame  N. Françoise est originaire de Porto-Novo et est née à Cotonou. Mariée à KOUHOUENOU Raymond elle a 03 enfants dont Lucie 10ans est en classe de CE2. Dès son jeune âge elle s'est mise à vendre de la nourriture qu'elle a hérité de sa défunte mère.Toujours dans le soucis de satisfaire ses clients qui ne cessent de s'accroître, elle sollicite ce sixième prêt de 120000fcfa pour augmenter son stock de riz.
texts.en:
Ms. Françoise N., age 30, is originally from Porto-Novo and was born in Cotonou. Married to Raymond KOUHOUENOU, she has three children, including Lucie, age 10 and in the 3rd grade. At a young age, she got started selling food, a business she inherited from her deceased mother. Always concerned with meeting customer expectations, which is continuously growing, she is requesting this sixth loan amounting to 120,000 francs CFA to increase her stock of rice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of rice

loans.name: Mukhtar's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtar baji is a wife of A. H.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, and has been living in it for the past 17 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is in 4th standard, her second son is in 3rd standard, and her youngest son is in 2nd standard. Her daughters are free and stay at home.

Mukhtar baji’s husband is a salesman who sells candies to wholesalers. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. Mukhtar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more candies to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes four other members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Azra baji wants a loan to buy candies to resell. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy vehicle engine oil to resell. Seema baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

loans.use: To buy candies to resell

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a wife of M. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 4 years. She has no children. Sugran baji’s husband is a tailor who has been sewing clothes for the past 10 years. Sugran baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy chickens in order to sell chicken meat. Sumera baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Pierre

texts.fr: Originaire d'Agonlin Covè dans le département du zou, monsieur W. Pierre est né vers 1962 à Sèhouè. Il est marié et est père de 04 enfants dont la benjamine Cathérine a 04 ans et est au Cours d'Initiation. Technicien en électronique de formation, le chômage l'a conduit à exercer le métier de meunier et ceci depuis 11 ans. Il sollicite ce premer prêt  de 100000fcfa pour changer le moteur de son moulin à maïs.
texts.en:
Originally from Agonlin Covè in Zou County, Mr. Pierre W. was born around 1962 in Sèhouè. He is married and the father of four children, of whom the youngest, Cathérine (age 4), is in kindergarten. An electronics technician by training, he was compelled by unemployment to work as a miller for eleven years. He is requesting this first loan of 100,000 francs CFA to change the motor of his corn milling machine.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor for a corn mill

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra Baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. They all are free and don’t do anything. Bushra Baji’s husband is a loader by profession. He loads different items (fruits, sugarcane and vegetables). He doesn’t have his own donkey cart. Bushra Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband so that he is able to take the whole amount of his load.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Taj Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Jamila Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Maryam Baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for loading

loans.name: Mwanakhamis

texts.en:
Mwanakhamis J. has been selling charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She works daily from 8:00am to 6:00pm and is able to earn a profit of approximately $70 each month. She is requesting her first loan through BRAC Tanzania to buy more charcoal to increase her sales and profit.

Mwanakhamis is 28 years old, married, and has 5 children. In addition to her children, she cares for five dependents.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of N. A.. She has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of two children: a two-year-old son and a six-year-old daughter. Razia baji’s husband has a food business in the community. He is a well-known person and everybody comes to him to buy Punjabi food (Nan Chana and Halwa Poudi). He has been in this business for the past 5 years. Razia baji is a housewife and helps her husband in cooking food. She is applying for a loan to buy cooking oil, lentils, and spices for her husband’s food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group includes several other members. Najeeba baji wants a loan to buy a mirror, chairs, and tools for her saloon. Rafiqan baji wants a loan to buy a grinding machine to use on marble floors. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, lentils, and spices for food business

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran baji is a wife of S. A.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she has lived for the past 19 years. She is the mother of three sons, all of whom are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Gulzaran baji’s husband has a grocery shop in the community, which he has run for the past five years.

Gulzaran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Gulzaran baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy beams and rope for her shuttering business. Sakeena baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wires and switch boards for her electric shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Bahati's Group

texts.en:
Bahati S. has been selling kanga and dresses in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. Kanga is a common local fabric that is decorated with any of a large variety of patterns and is often brightly colored. Kanga also contains a local adage in Swahili written at the bottom. The fabric is used for clothing, head wraps, baby slings, curtains, and many other household needs. A single kanga is sold for between $2.50 and $4.

Bahati works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she may expand her inventory and increase her sales.

Bahati is 26 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more kanga and dresses for her shop.

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Ramzan baji is a wife of M. and has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of one son, age 9, and one daughter, age 10. Ramzan baji’s husband has been in business sellling wood for the past 6 years. Ramzan baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more wood to expand her husband’s business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Ramzan baji's loan group includes four other members. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Naziran baji wants to buy bricks for her brick-selling business. Aneela baji wants to buy fruits for her fruit-selling business. Safia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

loans.use: To buy wood to resell

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada K. has been preparing and selling food in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan so she can buy more basic ingredients like sugar and flour, and produce a greater output of the foods she prepares and sells.

Saada is 26 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy  more sugar and flour for her food business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena baji is a wife of A. H. and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its sweetmeats and sacred places. Zareena baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.

Zareena baji’s husband has a grocery shop on the main road. He has been running this shop for the last 10 years. His monthly income is $100, and he has a good reputation in the neighboring area. Zareena baji is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura S. prepares and sells food in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and oil. These are two of the main ingredients in the snacks she prepares, so this loan will enable her to cook and sell more and increase her profit.

Zuhura is 26 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 1-and-a-half.

loans.use: To buy flour and oil for her food-selling business.

loans.name: Saida's Group

texts.en:
Saida has been selling charcoal in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She has taken out one previous loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting a second loan so that she can further increase her inventory of charcoal.

Saida is 39 years old, married, and has two children, aged 9 and 14. She also cares for two additional dependants. Saida will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Shemsa, who also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou A. est une femme dynamique de 30 ans qui achète et revend des articles scolaires dans un quartier populaire à Kpalimé au Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous à l’école. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock des fournitures et faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager.
texts.en:
Akou A. is a dynamic woman of 30 who buys and re-sells school supplies in a populous neighborhood in Kpalimé in Togo. She is married and the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. With the good fortune to be able to post on Kiva for her third FECECAV loan, she wants to stock up on school supplies so as to meet the demand of her clientele. She is grateful for this opportunity which will permit her to support her family better with the profit that she will make.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of office and school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has been selling charcoal and sugar in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $40 each month.  She is requesting her first loan so that she can buy more charcoal and sugar and increase her sales and profit.  
<p<
Amina is 29 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Shakooran's Group

texts.en:
Shakooran baji is a wife of B. A. and has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 30 years. She is the mother of one daughter and four sons. Her eldest son is a motor mechanic. Her second eldest son in 7th standard, her third son is in 5th standard, and her youngest son is free and doesn’t do anything. Her daughter reads in 3rd standard. Her husband belongs to the agriculture profession.

Shakooran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy tools for her son to use to repair vehicles.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group has three other members: Bahishtan baji, Parveen baji, and Haseena baji each want a loan to buy vegetables and wheat to resell.

loans.use: To buy tools for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab H. has been selling clothes and snacks in Zanzibar for 2 years. She works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM every day and earns a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell and more flour. She needs the flour because it is a main ingredient in the snacks that she sells outside of her shop.

Zainab is 24 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more flour and clothing

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran baji is a wife of L. and lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has lived for the past 35 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her eldest son makes embroidered clothes. The next eldest son has a grocery shop. The third oldest is in third standard, and her youngest son is just 12 years old. Manzooran baji’s husband has been a fruit seller for the past 5 years.

Manzooran baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

The loan group has four other members. Rani baji wants a loan to buy a photocopier. Sadia baji wants to buy chicken food for her poultry farm. Sonia baji wants to buy lentils, cooking oil, and spices for her food business. Seema baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor workshop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Hanifa's Group

texts.en:
Hanifa baji is the widow of G. N. and the mother of a 31-year-old son. After her husband died, she worked as a maid for four years in order to educate her son until the 8th standard. Now he is running his own business. For the past 28 years Hanifa baji has resided in Arifwala, Pakistan where she has a business selling wheat and vegetables. She is now applying for a loan to buy more wheat and vegetables to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Naseem baji wants a loan to buy chairs and a mirror for her saloon; Kaneez baji wants to buy cooking oil, sugar and dry fruits for her sweetmeat business; Iqra baji wants a loan to buy washing powder and bleach for her laundry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy vegetable and wheat to resell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa has owned a genge in Zanzibar for one year. A genge is a stand selling fruits and vegetables. It can be as small as a plank of wood on a quiet side street or as large as a well-stocked shop in a bustling city market. Hawa currently earns approximately $160 in profit each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes, onions, and other vegetables for her genge.

Hawa is 24 years old, married, and has one 3-month-old child.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her stand.

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 6 years. She is the mother of two daughters. Both of her daughters stay at home and do household work. Kosar baji’s husband has a lath work. He makes nuts of vehicles by lath machine. He has been in this business for the past 12 years. Kosar baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy another lath machine to make more parts for vehicles to sell in the market and earn more profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more businesses. Naziran baji and Arshan baji each want a loan to buy fruits for their fruit selling business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Another group member, Parveen baji, wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another lath machine to make parts for vehicles

loans.name: Anees Fatima M. Shabir Group

texts.en:
Anees Fatima Baji is a wife of M. Shabir and resides in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 20 years. Anees Baji completed her education till 5th standard. She has no kids. Anees Baji’s husband has a clothes selling business. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He buys clothes from different cities (Lahore and Faisal Abad). Anees Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Ameena Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Naseem Fatima Baji wants a loan to buy fruits for her fruit selling business. Sanam Baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Salma Baji wants a loan to buy corn oil to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerzas Group

texts.en:
La Union Hace La Fuerzas is a group of 15 women looking to receive their second small loans. All the women used their first loans to start very small businesses, and so far all member have tasted a little success. With their second loans, they all plan to grow their businesses and hope to increase their incomes.

Daphne D. is the leader of this group. She was chosen because of her work ethic, and everyone in the group trusts her leadership. She started a very small clothing business and is hoping to eventually earn enough to open her own small clothing store. Daphne is the proud mother of 5 children, and she dreams of being able to travel with them. She feels that these loans are the tools that will help her reach her dreams.

On behalf of Daphne, the group, and Esperanza International: Thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy used clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha Baji is the wife of A. D. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 6 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son is in 2nd standard. The others are free and don’t do anything. Ayesha Baji’s husband has a laundry business. He has been in this business for the past 4 years. Ayesha Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (washing powder and bleach) for her husband’s laundry business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Ghulam Fatima Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Manzooran Baji wants a loan to buy plumbing supplies (pipes and taps). Iqbal Baji wants a loan to buy a welding machine.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials for laundry business

loans.name: Rani M. Anwar Group

texts.en:
Rani Baji is the wife of M. Anwar and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 12 years. She has one son whose name is Salman Mohsin. He is two years old. Rani Baji’s husband has a clothes selling business and he has been selling clothes for the past 5 years. He buys clothes from Faisal Abad and sells in his own city, Arifwala. Rani Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rukhsana Baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Zubaida Baji and Zulaikhan Baji and Zainab Baji each want a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is in 4th standard. Her younger son is free and doesn’t do anything. Her daughter is in 3rd standard. Khadija baji’s husband has a clothes selling business. He has been selling clothes for the past 10 years. He buys clothes from Faisal Abad and sells in his own city Arifwala. Khadija baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and taking care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rani baji and Hanifa baji and Begum baji each want a loan to buy clothes to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy iron to make heater to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 23 años, vive con su esposo, el cual la ayuda con su negocio. Juntos le han dedicado ya 6 años a la tienda que tienen de venta de golosinas, actividad que realizan desde muy temprano en la mañana, hasta aproximadamente las 6 o 7 de la noche. A Roxana le gusta su trabajo ya que es propio y puede disponer de la administración del mismo, además al trabajar al lado de su esposo, hace que se sienta más fuerte y confiada de cumplir sus objetivos. Su propósito es consolidar una familia feliz, para brindarles lo mejor, a sus futuros hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará su negocio con más golosinas de variados tipos, para cubrir las necesidades de toda su clientela, para que en el futuro su tienda sea una de las más grandes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Roxana is 23 years old, lives with her husband, who helps her with her business. For 6 years they have worked together running a store where they sell snacks. They begin work very early in the morning and continue until about 6 or 7 at night. Roxana likes her job, since it is hers and she can take care of the administrative side and leave the rest of the work to her husband. This makes her feel strong and confident in accomplishing her objectives. Her goal is to have a happy family, and provide her children with the best possible future. With the loan she will supply her business with more products of various kinds to can meet the needs of her clients, so that in the future her store will be one of the largest in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her store with various products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 47 años, es viuda, vive con su hija Lizbeth de 20 años. Es una señora muy jovial y emprendedora, se dedica a la venta de chicharrones (plato a base de carne de cerdo) en su triciclo, negocio que realiza desde hace 25 años para poder mantener a su hija, la cual aún depende de ella económicamente. Doña Francisca es parte fundamental de la zona en la que vende sus ricos chicharrones, ya que si falta por un día, todos en la zona notan su ausencia, por el gran cariño que le tienen. A ella le gusta mucho trabajar de esta manera, ya que le permite conocer a nuevas personas y hacer nuevos amigos. Lo más difícil es tener que adquirir la carne de cerdo, ya que por los constantes incrementos en el precio, no le alcanza para cubrir el costo. Doña Francisca quiere brindarle a su hija lo mejor, para que pueda formar una familia y no quedarse sola al final de su vida. Con el dinero del préstamo comprara más carne de cerdo para cocinar más platillos y por ende aumentar su venta. En el futuro, a Doña Francisca le gustaría que su negocio rinda mayores ingresos económicos para no pasar apuros económicos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her 20-year-old daughter named Lizbeth. She is a very jovial and enterprising woman who sells pork rinds on her urban delivery trike, which she has been doing for 25 years in order to support her dependent daughter. Ms. Francisca is an integral part of the region in which she sells her delicious pork rinds because if she is gone for one day, all the residents notice her absence due to the great affection they show her. She really loves to work this way because it allows her to meet new people and make new friends. The most difficult thing for her is having to purchase pork because it is not easy for her to cover the costs due to constantly increasing prices. Ms. Francisca wants to offer her daughter the best so that she can form her own family and not be alone at the end of her life. With this loan, she will purchase pork in order to make more meals and in so doing increase her sales. In the future, Ms. Francisca would like for her business to yield greater profits so that she will not have to experience financial troubles.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase greater quantities of pork to increase pork rind sales

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es: Flavia tiene 26 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. En su afán de superación, se ha dedicado a diversas labores para poder solventar sus gastos económicos, incursionando desde hace 3 años la venta de pasajes interprovinciales en una agencia muy conocida de la ciudad de Juliaca. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde las 6 de la mañana, que es donde los autobuses comienzan a salir para brindar el servicio de transporte, hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde, cuando la releva otra compañera. A Flavia le gusta su trabajo, ya que no es rutinario y siempre hay mucho movimiento y dinamismo, solo que algunas veces el frió imperante de la zona hace que tenga que sufrir de algunos problemas de salud, como coger un resfriado, etc, pero estos problemas son mínimos, ya que son más los beneficios que obtiene de su trabajo. Flavia quiere forjarse un buen futuro y así poder pensar en conformar una familia a quien brindarle las mejores oportunidades de desarrollarse. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere incursionar en un negocio propio, en la venta de productos de belleza, para así, obtener mayores ganancias. En el futuro Flavia desea tener un negocio propio que pueda administrar desde su propia casa.
texts.en:
Flavia is 26 years old, she is single and she lives at home with her parents. In her efforts for self improvment, she has taken on various jobs to cover her expenses. For the past 3 years she has been selling interprovincial vacation packages through a very well known agency in the city of Juliaca. She starts her work at 6 in the morning, when the buses start running, until about 5 or 6 in the evening when she catches a ride home with a colleague. Flavia loves her work, especially because it is not routine and it is dynamic, always with lots of movement. Sometimes the cold weather of the region brings with it health considerations, such as catching a cold, but these problems are insignificant, and the benefits of her work far outweigh them. Flavia wishes to forge for herself a good future and to start thinking about a family for whom she might bring better opportunities. With the funds from the loan she plans to start up her own business selling beautty products, so that she might increase her earnings. In the future Flavia wishes to set up her own business that she would run from her own home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital funds to start a business selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen Baji is the wife of M. R. and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 15 years. She is the mother of six children: two sons and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Nasreen Baji’s husband has a grocery shop near the community. People of her community come to him and buys groceries. His monthly income is $120. Nasreen Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zafran Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Noor Baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell. Irshad Baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, sketches and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 42 años, es soltera, vive en compañía de una joven amiga, quien también es su ayudante de cocina. Se dedica a la atención de su propio restaurante, el cual abastece de almuerzos, desayunos y cenas a todo su vecindario, abriendo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche. Maria cuenta con una joven que la ayuda en la cocina y la atención a la clientela, siendo ella soltera, es la única compañía que posee, por ello, la considera más que una empleada, una amiga, con la que trabaja de sol a sol para sacar adelante su negocio. Lo difícil es tener que abastecerse para la atención, aún entre las dos, atender a toda la clientela es complicado. Maria se esfuerza día a día porque quiere asegurar su vejez. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más mesas y sillas para la atención en su restaurante, así podrá atender a más comensales y con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos. Su deseo a futuro es tener un gran restaurante, amplio y con mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old, single, and lives with a young friend, who is also her assistant in the kitchen. She had her own restaurant, which provides breakfast, lunch, and dinner to everyone in the neighborhood. Her restaurant is open from 7 in the morning until 8 or 9 at night. Maria has a young woman who helps her in the kitchen and tends to clients. Since Maria is alone, her assistant is the only company she has, which is why she considers her more than just an employee, but a friend with whom she works day by day to succeed in her business. It is difficult and complicated to give the attention needed, even between the two of them, to tend to all of their clientele. Maria makes an effort every day because she wants to secure her retirement. With the money from this loan she will purchase more table and chairs for her restaurant, so that she can entertain more customers, through whom she will obtain higher earnings. Her dream for the future is to have a grand restaurant, spacious and with the best services.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her small restaurant

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es: Pascuala tiene 41 años, es divorciada, vive con sus tres hijos de 6, 3 y 1 añito. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, hace 12 años decidió emprender su negocio de venta de abarrotes en su pequeña tiendita ubicada en el distrito llamado Cabanillas. Al no contar con la ayuda de su esposo y al separarse de él, se ha dedicado íntegramente al trabajo, el cual empieza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche, gustándole lo que hace ya que le permite trabajar independientemente, aunque a veces las bajas temperaturas de la zona le afectan, ya que tiene que poner mucho de sí, para seguir atendiendo a pesar del frío. Pascuala trabaja por sus hijos para darles las comodidades que ellos merecen. Con el dinero que se le brinde, podrá abastecer a su tienda con más productos de calidad, para en el futuro crecer y ser una tienda mucho más grande y mejor implementada.
texts.en:
Pascuala is 41 years old, divorced, and lives with her three children of ages 6, 3, and 1. She is a hard worker who decided 12 years ago to start her own business selling groceries in a small market located in the Cabanillas district. Because she has no help from her husband and is separated from him, she has dedicated herself to her job, working from 7:00 in the morning to 8:00 or 9:00 at night. She likes to work on her own, although sometimes the low temperatures affect her because cannot ignore the cold. Pascuala works for her children to give them the comforts they deserve. With this loan, she will supply her market with more quality products in order to grow in the future and to have a market much larger and better established.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products in her market

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 38 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 13 años llamado Susanny. Se dedica a la atención de su pequeño quiosco, donde ofrece bebidas, golosinas, galletas, etc, desde hace ya 19 años, ahora que su hija Susanny tiene 13 años, la ayuda mucho en la atención del quiosco, en sus ratos libres, y así juntas, trabajan para sacar el negocio adelante.  A Victoria le gusta su trabajo, ya que puede educar a su hija, realizándolo con mucha alegría, siendo lo más difícil, el no poder pasar todo el tiempo que a ella le gustaría junto a su hija. Victoria se esfuerza mucho para brindarle a su Susanny un futuro promisorio con muchas oportunidades. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más mercadería para la abastecer su quiosco.  En el futuro Victoria se ve con una gran tienda de abarrotes, que atenderá en la comodidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and a single mother of a 13 year old girl named Susanny. For the past 19 years, she has made a living by running a small kiosk where she offers drinks, candies, cookies, etc. Now that Susanny is 13 years old, she helps a lot with the kiosk in her free time and together, they work to move the business forward. Victoria likes her job because she can educate her daughter, which she does with great pleasure. The most difficult part is she cannot spend all of her time with her daughter. Victoria puts a lot of effort into providing a promising future with many opportunities for Susanny. With this loan, she will buy more merchandise to supply her kiosk. In the future, Victoria would like a big market of groceries that she could run out of the comfort of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her kiosk

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria tiene 32 años, es soltera, madre de Iris, una pequeñita de un añito de edad. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, trabajando en un primer momento para alguien más, hasta que desde hace un año, con todos sus ahorros logró poner su propia tiendita, alquilando un  pequeño local. Desde que comenzó con su propio negocio Candelaria ha trabajado desde muy tempranas horas para lograr los ingresos necesarios, cerrando a veces muy tarde, por la cantidad de clientela que se ha hecho frecuente a su negocio, es por eso que le gusta su trabajo, porque le permite crecer y tener esperanzas de un futuro mejor. La motivación de Candelaria es que su hija Iris tenga un futuro feliz. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su negocio con más productos y quiere hacerlo crecer mucho más, para en el futuro poder abrir una sucursal.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 32 years old. She is a single mother to Iris, a little baby girl of one year. For the past 6 yeasrs she has been running a convenience store, working at first for someone, but then last year thanks to all of the savings she was able to set up her own little store, renting a small space. Since she set up her own business, Candelaria works since the very early hours of the day to earn the income she needs. She closes down sometimes very late. She loves her work beause of the great number of returning clients and because it permits her to have and to form hope for a better future. Candelaria's motivation is to provide her daughter Iris with a happy future. With the loan that she is requesting she will invest the funds in her business to purchase more products. She wants to expand the business much more, so that in the future she might be able to start in a second location.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 20 años, vive sola en un local que alquilo para vivir y poner su negocio. Desde hace 4 años, se viene dedicando al negocio de la venta de bebidas, en los que ha tratado de trabajar muy duro para hacer que prospere, abriendo desde las 8 de la tarde hasta las 10 u 11 de la noche.  Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es la gratificación que le da tener independencia económica y poder solventar ella sola todos sus gastos. El motivo del esfuerzo diario de Yudiht es labrarse un mejor porvenir. Con el dinero que solicita implementará con más bebidas su local.  A ella le gustaría que su negocio tenga más rentabilidad y que sea mucho más grande, para poder atender mejor a la clientela.
texts.en:
Yudith is 20 years old and lives alone in an apartment that she rents to live and run her business. For 4 years, she has made a living by selling drinks and has tried to work very hard in order to prosper, starting at 8:00 to 10:00 or 11:00 at night. She receives the most satisfaction from her job from being economically independent and being able to pay all of her bills. Her motivation for this daily effort is to build a better future for herself. With this loan, she will supply more drinks for her market. She would like her business to be more profitable and increase in size, so that she can better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of drinks for sale

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.es: Clemencia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos. Se viene dedicando desde hace 17 años, al negocio de la venta de artesanía en cera, para las fiestas patronales y la elaboración de bordados de los mantos para las estatuas de los santos de la ciudad. Clemencia se dedica a su trabajo gran parte del día, ya que cuando no está elaborando las artesanías en cera o los bordados, está haciendo los contactos para su distribución. Lo más difícil es la elaboración de los bordados, ya que requieren tiempo, dedicación y mucha paciencia para llegar a los resultados deseados, pero le gusta, ya que puede explotar toda su creatividad. Clemencia trabaja para poder brindarle a su familia un futuro esperanzador. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará material para elaborar sus tejidos y artesanías en cera, para expandir su negocio en el futuro y que sea una de las tiendas más concurridas por la población.
texts.en:
Clemencia is 35 years old and she lives with her husband and her two small children. She has been selling wax crafts for the past 17 years, selling mostly on national holidays. She also creates needlepoint vestments for the statues of the saints in the city. Clemencia dedicates a large part of her day to her work. When she is not making her wax crafts or her needlepoint she is creating new contacts for their distribution. The hardest part is the needlepoint, taking up a great deal of time, dedication and so much patience to achieve the required results. But she loves doing it because she can put to use her creativity. Clemencia works so that she can provide her family with a future filled with hope. With the funds from the loan she will purchase fabric to create her tunics and for her wax crafts. She will expand her business in the future and she hopes to be one of the most visited stores in her region.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric for tunics and to create wax crafts.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis A. runs a boutique that sells dresses and shoes. The items are purchased in Uganda and sold at Phylis’ boutique stall here in Kisumu, Kenya. Business was booming until post-election violence occurred in the city during the early spring of 2008. Her stall was robbed and business has been difficult for Phylis ever since.

Phylis would like to make her business as successful as it was in earlier times and even improve it. Her goal is to move from a stall into a more permanent place. Having discovered a suitable location in downtown Kisumu, Phylis is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to pay rent and purchase dresses and shoes. This will be Phylis’ first loan with K-MET and she will be making monthly repayments over a 12-month period.

Phylis uses the profits from her boutique to take care of her family and all of their needs. Her husband died in 2005 and his second wife (of a polygamous marriage) passed away shortly after. Phylis provides for her child and the two children of the second wife and would like to see her business grow in order to better care for them.

loans.use: To pay rent on a new location and to buy dresses and shoes

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 25 años, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás, para solventar sus gastos económicos. Viaja constantemente para adquirir los vehículos en otras ciudades y traerlos para su venta en Puno y Juliaca. El trabajo de Javier no tiene horario, ya que viaja a diferentes horas y días de la semana, según se de la oportunidad de adquirir un nuevo vehículo, lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que viajar tanto, ya que no le permite permanecer demasiado tiempo en un solo lugar, haciendo que sea muy cansado, pero Javier ha aprendido a sobrellevarlo, ya que le gusta mucho los autos y también conducirlos. Este muchacho quiere trabajar, ahora que es joven, nos dice, y forjarse un mejor porvenir, para asegurarse económicamente y formar una familia, a la cual pueda brindarles lo mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo arreglará uno de los autos que compró para poder venderlo a un precio mayor. En el futuro Javier quiere tener una gran empresa de compra y venta de autos, y alquilar un local donde poder ofrecerlos.
texts.en:
Javier is 25 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He makes a living by buying and selling cars, an activity that he has been doing for the past 4 years in order to pay his bills. He constantly travels in order to acquire the vehicles in other cities and bring them to sell in Puno and Juliaca. Javier’s job does not have a schedule because he travels at different hours and days of the week based on the opportunities to buy new cars. The most difficult part of his job is traveling so much because it does not allow him to remain in one place for long. This makes him tired, but Javier has learned how to overcome it and very much likes the cars and driving them. This young man wants to work in order to build a better future, including financial security and a family, who he would want to provide the best available. With this loan, he will fix one of the cars he bought so that he can sell it at a high price. In the future, Javier wants to have a big business of buying and selling cars, and to rent a location to offer this service.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and improve a car he bought in order to resell it at a higher price

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 36 años, vive con sus dos hijas, Anira de 5 y Janet de 2. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza desde hace12 años, al divorciarse de su esposo y hacerse cargo de sus dos hijas.
