Realiza su trabajo los días de feria en su natal comunidad, llamada, Santa Lucia y en el distrito de Cabanillas, donde obtiene buenas ganancias, lo malo es que se le hace complicado el transporte del ganado a estas ferias, lo cual María a sabido sobrellevar muy bien, ya que a pesar de estos inconvenientes, le gusta lo que hace, poniéndole todas sus ganas y empeño. Esta madre quiere que sus hijas Anira y Janet sean profesionales y tengan mejores oportunidades, de las que tuvo ella. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará un ejemplar de ovino, para criar y luego vender a mayor precio, y así lograr mayores ingresos económicos.  En el futuro, María quiere que su negocio se incremente mucho más, teniendo mayor cantidad de ganado para vender.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives with her two daughters, Anira of age 5 and Janet of age 2. She makes a living by buying and selling cattle livestock, an activity that she has done for the past 12 years during which she divorced her husband and needed to support her children. She works on the days of the street market in her community, Santa Lucia, and in the Cabanillas district, where she makes good profits. The bad part is she has difficulty transporting the cattle to these markets but Maria has endured very well. Even though she has these inconveniences, she likes doing this job and devotes to it all of her willpower and effort. This mother wants her daughters, Anita and Jane, to be professionals and to have better opportunities than she did. With this loan, she will buy a high quality sheep to raise and later sell at a higher price that will provide her higher income. In the future, Maria wants her business to grow a lot and have a larger amount of livestock to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a small sheep to raise and then sell

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Mujeres Unidas esta ubicado en la comunidad D. Huamaspampa, en el distrito D. Acoria, en el departamento D. Huancavelica. Su actividad principal es la ganadería, la agricultura, el comercio y la artesanía donD. realizan manualidades en telares y textilería.

Claudia E., es casada y tiene 8 hijos, 6 mujeres y 2 varones, Claudia desD. hace 40 años se dedica a la venta D. comida dando pensión a los profesores, trabajadores D. la posta medica, con los prestamos que recibe ella a comprado utensilios para su cocina como olla a presión, carne para surtir los menús que ofrece. Claudia quiere comprar carnero para su negocio y sueña con tener un rebaño D. ovejas y un establo con vacas lecheras.

Juana C., es casada y tiene 9 hijos, se dedica a la compra y venta D. cuys, gallinas, queso y huevo. Con sus prestamos Juana a incrementado su negocio lo que le permite ahorrar D. a pocos, le gustaría comprar un puesto en Huancavelica para hacer crecer su negocio, esto le ayudaría en la educación D. sus hijos.

Victorina D.,  es casada tiene una hija D. 12 años, su negocio es una tienda donD. venD. materiales D. escritorio y golosinas. Con sus prestamos desea surtir mas su negocio para evitar la competencia, así tendrá mayores ingresos, pues su sueño es ver a su hija profesional.
texts.en:
The United Women Communal Bank is located in the Huamaspampa community, in the Acoria district of the Huancavelica department. Their principal markets are livestock, agriculture, business, and textile handicrafts. Claudia E. is married and has eight children, six girls and two boys. Claudia has been selling meals for 40 years and her customers incluD. local teachers and medical workers. With past loans Claudia has purchased meat for her recipes, and utensils for her kitchen, such as a pressure cooker. Claudia would like to buy mutton for her business and she dreams of having a herd of sheep and a stable of milk cows. Juana C. is married and has nine children. She buys and sells guinea pigs, hens, cheese, and eggs. With loans Juana has grown her business to the point where she can now save some of her income. She would like to buy a storefront in Huancavelica, which would expand her business and help her to educate her children. Victorina D. is married and has one 12 year old daughter. She has a store where she sells office supplies and candy. Victorina would like to better supply her store in order to avoid succumbing to the competition and have greater income. She'd also like to see her daughter become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The United Women communal bank needs 10,000 soles to distribute among its 18 partners, who would like to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 60 años, vive con su hijo D. 18 años Nelson, el cual es estudiante. Se viene dedicando a la venta D. ganado, el cual cría desD. en casa y venD. en las diversas ferias D. la ciudad. A Julia le agrada su trabajo, ya que siempre le han gustado los animales, a los cuales cría con mucho cariño y dedicación, siendo su trabajo muy esforzado, ya que  ayuda D. su hijo trasladan el ganado para su venta, lo que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo.
Un día D. venta, Julia se levanta las 6 D. la mañana para viajar a las ferias trasladando el ganado y regresa en horas D. la noche, agotada por el trajín del viaje. Julia quiere que su hijo Nelson sea un hombre D. bien y quiere acostumbrarlo al trabajo para que no vaya por el mal camino, que ve ella, esta corrompiendo ahora a la juventud. Con el dinero con que se le brinD. comprará más ganado para hacer su negocio más productivo. En el futuro, a Julia le gustaría tener un negocio paralelo, el cual pueda administrar su hijo.
texts.en:
Julia is 60 years old and lives with her son Nelson, who is a student and 18 years old. She makes a living by selling livestock, which she raises in her home and then sells in various markets in the city. Julia likes her job and always has liked animals, which she raises with much affection and dedication. Due to the difficulty of her job, her son helps her transport the livestock to the markets, which requires a lot of effort. On the days she sells the livestock, Julia wakes up at 6:00 a.m. to travel with the livestock to the street markets and returns in the evening hours, exhausted from the labor of the trip. Julia wants her son Nelson to be a good man and wants to accustom him to the job so that he doesn’t go down the wrong path because in her eyes, he is being corrupted by his young friends. With this loan, she will buy more livestock in order make her business more productive. In the future, Julia would like to have a similar business that her son could operate.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of livestock that she raises and sells

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: Filomena tiene 50 años, vive con su hijo Wilver de 12 años de edad, el cual estudia en el colegio. La venta de comida es el negocio de Filomena desde hace ya 16 años, actividad que adoptó como fuente de ingresos, para mantener a su hijo. Realiza la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la cual prepara en su casa, para luego salir a ofrecerla en su pequeño triciclo, hasta  aproximadamente las 5 o 6 de la tarde, lo bueno de este oficio es que a Filomena le encanta realizarlo, ya que es muy buena en la cocina, lo cual pueden notar los clientes que se van muy satisfechos luego de probar las delicias que prepara Filomena.  El motivo del esfuerzo de esta madre, es por su hijo Wilver, el cual está en proceso de educación, por lo cual Filomena quiere brindarle las mejores oportunidades en cuanto a educación. Comprará con el préstamo que reciba, ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos, ya que quiere aumentar su producción de comida. En el futuro, Filomena se ve vendiendo su comida en un local propio.
texts.en:
Filomena is 50 years old ans she lives with her 12-year old son Wilver, he is currently attendig school. Filomena's occupation is food sales and she has been doing so for the past 16 years. She started her business as a source of income to support her son. She makes her food sales door to door, but she prepares her foods at home to later go out an sell on her small tricycle. She sells until about 5 or 6 in the evening. The best part about the work is that Filomena loves doing it. She is a very good cook and her clients notice because they all come away feeling satisfied for having sampled the delicious foods prepared by Filomena. The movitation for this mother is her son, Wilver. He is currently attending school and he wants to provide him with better opportunities. With the funds from this loan she will purchase ingredients to prepare her dishes especially because she wants to increase her production. In the future Filomena sees herself selling her foods from her very own stand.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare the foods that she sells.

loans.name: Radislavka

texts.en: Radislavka Ristić is 35, married, and has two children. She comes from Petrovo, a big village near Gračanica. Radislavka is employed in a local store as saleswoman earning 300 KM monthly. She produces vegetabless in her garden for her own use. She also keeps pigs and bees near her house. She requests a loan from WWI in the amount of 600 KM to provide some food and medicine for her pigs and bees so they can survive the winter.

loans.use: To buy a food and medicines for animals

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 19 años, es soltero vive solo. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, el cual distribuye en las diversas ferias de la ciudad, criando a los animales en su casa, alimentándolos debidamente para hacerlos más atractivos a los compradores. Usualmente el trabajo de Rolando comienza muy temprano por las mañanas, cuando debe alimentar a los cerdos y demás animales que tiene, para luego viajar a las provincias y distritos de la zona a ofrecerlos a la venta, regresando muy  tarde de su jornada laboral, haciendo que el viajar sea lo más cansado de su trabajo. El motivo del esfuerzo de este joven, es ser un hombre de provecho a la sociedad, con un futuro prometedor. Con el dinero que obtenga del préstamo comprará más ganado, alimento balanceado, y algunas medicinas para mantener saludables a sus animales, y así lograr mejores ingresos. En el futuro, le gustaría tener otro negocio, paralelo a este, pero aun está definiendo el rubro de este.
texts.en:
Rolando is 19 years old, he is single and lives alone. He buys and sells livestock which he distributes in the different markets of the city, raising the animals in his home, feeding them properly so that they will be more attractive to buyers. Rolando's work usually starts very early in the morning, when he must feed his pigs and other animals before traveling to the provinces and districts of the zone to sell them, getting back from his working day very late as traveling is the most tiring part of his work. This young man works to be a worthwhile member of society, with a promising future. With the money that he gets from the loan he will buy more livestock, balanced feed and some medicines to keep his animals healthy and thereby earn better. In the future he would like to have another business running parallel to this one, but he is still defining where this one is going.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of livestock that he has, and also to buy feed and medicines for the animals/Incrementar la cantidad de ganado que tiene, además de comprar alimento y medicinas para los animales.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea A. D. P. is a member of the community bank, Tarpuy, a Quechuan word which means, ‘to sow or to plant’, which is appropriate for Andrea who sells flowers. Andrea lives in Ayacucho with her husband; they had 12 children, of which 9 are still alive. OutsiD. the cemetery in Ayacucho is where you’ll be able to find Andrea selling flowers daily.

Her loan of 1000 soles will be invested into her business with the purchase of more flowers including roses, gladiolas, pompons and various other flowers and to purchase a taxi for her son to drive. Andrea travels to Lima by bus every Monday and Wednesday to purchase flowers.

Her dream right now is to get her house back; the land she owns is near a church which has removed her and her family from their house, currently they are renting a house nearby. She hopes she and her youngest son, 22 years old, will be able to earn enough money to save their house and move back.

loans.use: Her loan of 1000 soles will be invested into her business with the purchase of more flowers including roses, gladiolas, pompons and various other flowers and to purchase a taxi for her son to drive.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.en:
Odilia E. R. is a member of the community bank, Tarpuy, a Quechuan word which in Quechua, the local language, means ‘to sow or plant.’

Odilia is married and lives in Ayacucho with her four children aged 28-21. Odilia has her own business growing and selling grains and cereals.

Her loan of 1000 soles will be invested into her business in the cultivation of her land, growing corn, wheat, barley, and beans. Odilia’s goals are to continue harvesting her crops and ensure her children earn their degrees and become professionals.

loans.use: Her loan of 1000 soles will be invested into her business in the cultivation of her land, growing corn, wheat, barley, and beans

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su familia. Desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de boletos de  pasajes interprovinciales, actividad que viene realizando para lograr su independencia económica. A Máxima, siempre le ha gustado trabajar y valerse por sí misma para sentirse útil y productiva, es así que  se siente muy a gusto en su trabajo. Realiza su trabajo por las noches, ya que quiere ponerse a estudiar una carrera técnica por las mañanas, su turno empieza desde las 7 de la noche hasta las una de la madrugada, el trabajo es sacrificado y mucho más si tiene que realizarlo hasta altas horas de la noche. El motivo del esfuerzo diario de Máxima, es trabajar en el presente para forjarse un mejor futuro. Con el dinero que solicita, además de apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos del hogar, lo utilizará en el pago de una preparación educativa, para lograr el ingreso a algún instituto técnico e iniciar con sus estudios superiores, para así obtener el tan ansiado éxito profesional.
texts.en:
Maxima is 19 years old, she is single and lives in her family home. For 5 years she has been selling inter provincial travel tickets in order to achieve economic independence. Maxima has always liked to work and to have confidence in herself by feeling useful and productive, and this is why she really likes her work. She works at night as she wants to start studying a technical degree in the mornings. She starts at 7pm until 1am, she sacrifices a lot for this work especially as she has to do it late at night. Maxima's main reason for working hard each day is to work in the present to forge herself a better future. With the money she has asked for, as well as supporting her family with the household costs, she will use it to pay for educational preparation to gain entry to a technical school and to start her higher studies so that she can achieve this sought after professional success.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the cost of a pre-professional education course/Pago de los costos de una preparación educativa pre profesional.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es: Genara tiene 49 años, es divorciada y vive sola. Se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de fruta, por las principales calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace 20 años atrás. Genara siempre le puso mucho énfasis y le dedicó tiempo  a su trabajo, lamentablemente este sacrificio no fue correspondido por su ex pareja. Genara es fuerte y luchadora, ve la vida como un reto a seguir, es por eso que hace frente a los problemas con mucha fe y buen humor, facilitándose su trabajo. El motivo del esfuerzo de Genara es trabajar porque la hace sentir útil e importante, además asegurar su vejez.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de fruta para obtener mayores ingresos, para que en el futuro pueda contar con un gran puesto de fruta en alguno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Genara is 49 years old, divorced, and lives on her own. She has been selling fruit on the main streets of the city of Juliaca for 20 years. Genara has always put a lot of emphasis on and dedicated time to her work. Unfortunately, her ex-husband did not make the same sacrifice. Genara is a strong fighter who sees life as a challenge, which is how she faces problems with a lot of faith and good humor, thus making her job easier. Genara makes an effort in order to feel useful and important, as well as to assure that she will be fine in her old age. With the loan money, she will purchase greater quantities of fruit in order to increase profits so that in the future she will be able to own a big fruit stand in one of the city’s most important markets.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase fruit

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en: Danijela Nedić is 23 and lives in Sočkovac, a village near Gračanica. She is not married and lives with her parents. Danijela is employed in a local store as saleswoman earning 300 KM monthly. She helps her mother to produce vegetables in her garden for their own use and in her free time she is busy as a tailor. Danijela does repairs in most cases, but she makes also her own creations and sells them to others. She would like to have a better sewing machine and she requests a loan in WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to purchase a new machine and some materials for her creations.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine and materials for tailoring

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita C. S. is a member of community bank Tarpuy, a Quechuan word meaning “to sow or to plant.” Hipolita lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their 4 children, ages 24, 23, 20 and 14. Hipolita is an artisan who makes purses, belts, hats, and upholstery.

With the help of her children, she works in a store where she sells her products. She will use her loan of 1000 soles to purchase more material to make her products including buttons and yarn. Her dream is to leave Ayacucho and sell her products in a different area.

loans.use: to purchase more material to make her products

loans.name: Dora Bernadina

texts.en:
Dora Bernadina H. J. is a member of the community bank, Tarpuy, a Quechuan word meaning, “to sow or to plant.” Dora lives in Ayacucho with her husband; they have 6 children ages 35-22. Dora currently works with her neighbor selling bread.

With her loan of 1200 soles, Dora will purchase ingredients for the bread including seasonings, flour and sugar. Dora’s dream is to save enough money to purchase her own oven to bake bread and have her own business. She also hopes that her children continue their education, earn their degrees and become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for the bread including seasonings, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 32 años, vive en casa de su familia, ya que es soltera y aun no tiene familia. Se dedica al negocio de la venta de golosinas, desde hace 10 años, ya que al no concluir sus estudios secundarios por diversos problemas económicos y familiares tuvo que dedicar íntegramente al comercio. Magdalena está acostumbrada al trabajo sacrificado, es por eso que empieza su jornada desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, hasta que la venta sea buena, quedándose muchas veces hasta altas horas de la noche, a pesar de estos sacrificios a Magdalena le agrada su trabajo porque le permite mantenerse y distraerse. El motivo del esfuerzo de esta mujer, es tener un mejor futuro, el cual le permita tener una vida sin preocupaciones económicas. Con el dinero que está solicitando, quiere agrandar su pequeño negocio, comprando más golosinas. En un futuro, a Magdalena, le gustaría tener una tienda de venta de golosinas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 32 years old and lives in her family home as she is single and does not yet have her own family. She sells sweets and has been doing this for 10 years as she never finished secondary school because of various economic and family problems which meant that she had to work full time. Magdalena is used to hard work, and this is why she starts working very early in the morning, until she has sold enough, sometimes staying until late at night. Despite these sacrifices Magdalena is very grateful to her job as it allows her to maintain and amuse herself. She works so hard to have a better future without economic worries. With the money that she has asked for, she wants to enlarge her small business, buying more sweets. In the future Magdalena would like to have a shop selling sweets in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of sweets she sells/Incrementar la cantidad de golosinas que vende.

loans.name: Froilan

texts.es: Froilan tiene 27 años, es soltero y vive solo en una habitación alquilada, es natural de la ciudad del Cuzco. Se ha dedicado a muchos oficios, ya que migró de la ciudad del Cuzco en vías de un mejor porvenir, es así que desde hace 6 años, incursionó en la venta de golosinas, en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la ciudad, con la ayuda de una pareja de esposos, los cuales lo apoyaron en la implementación de su negocio, y le brindaron una vivienda. Froilan es decidido, alegre y siempre tiene una sonrisa que brindar a la clientela, haciendo esto que  gane muchos amigos, gracias a su trabajo, que es lo que más le gusta. Froilan quiere superarse, tener un trabajo sólido y estable para poder brindarle una buena estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Con el dinero del préstamo incrementará su mercadería, para así acrecentar sus ventas, para que en el futuro pueda tener una tienda tipo almacén, donde abastezca a la clientela de diversos productos.
texts.en:
Froilan is 27 years old, unmarried, lives alone in a rented room, and is a native of the city of Cuzco. He has engaged in many trades, as he moved from the city of Cuzco in search of a better future. Six years ago, he ventured into the sale of candy, in one of the most famous markets of the city, with the help of a couple who supported him in the implementation of his business and gave him a home. Froilan is determined, cheerful and always has a smile for clients to win many friends through his work, which is what he likes most. Froilan wants to overcome adversity and have a solid and stable job in order to provide economic stability to his future family. With the money from the loan, he will increase his merchandise, thereby increasing his sales, so that he can have a shop type store in the future, where he will serve various products to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of sweets he sells.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
In Kisumu, Kenya, numerous small restaurants, which are known locally as "hotels", line the sides of the streets. Regina A. C. is the 36-year-old owner of one such hotel. From options of tea, bread, or porridge for a light breakfast, to heartier meals of fish, meat, or vegetables, Regina feeds her community what she calls "fast food".

The hotel is poorly built, and Regina longs to improve the building. She would like to take out a loan of $250 USD in order to plaster the walls and pay for structural improvements and maintenance, which will make the hotel more stable and her business more attractive to customers.

Regina is a single mother of four children; one is just out of high school, while the other three are in primary school. She wants to use some of the profits from her business to pay for her children's education: college for her eldest, and school fees for the younger three.

loans.use: To make building improvements on restaurant

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 45 años, vive solamente con su pequeño hijo, ya que es divorciada. Se dedica a la venta de helados, desde que se separó de su esposo, tuvo que hacerse cargo de su pequeño sola y brindarle, educación, vestido y salud. Lucia acostumbra elaborar los helados durante la noche, para venderlos por las mañanas y las tardes. Sus dificultades en este caso, son tener que lidiar con el clima que por estos rumbos es muy frió, en esta temporada lluviosa, haciendo que la venta disminuya, por otro lado, el carisma de Lucía hace que tenga clientes muy asiduos, que degustan de sus ricos helados, esto conlleva a que no pierda los ánimos. Lucia se esmera en sacar adelante a su hijo y brindarle un futuro mejor. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar una nueva cajita donde vender los helados, ya que la que tiene ahora ya está un poco desgastada, además de incrementar su producción. En el futuro Lucia quiere tener un negocio más estable, como una tiendita de abarrotes o una ferretería.
texts.en:
Lucia is 45 years old and lives only with her son, as she is divorced. Since she split up with her husband she has been selling ice cream as she had to take charge of her young son alone and give him an education, clothing and keep him healthy. Lucia is used to making ice creams at night so she can sell them during the mornings and afternoons. The difficulty in doing this is the climate as in that area it is very cold and it is the rainy season, which means that her sales decrease. However, on the other hand Lucia has some faithful clients who really love her delicious ice creams, and this keeps her spirits up. Lucia goes to great lengths so allow her son to move forward and to give him a better future. With the money she's asked for she would like to buy a new ice box to sell ice creams from, as the one she has now is very worn, and this will increase her production. In the future Lucia wants to have a more stable business, like a grocery store or a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new box from which to sell her ice creams, as well as increasing her production

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 26 años, vive sola, en una habitación alquilada. Se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, en la ciudad de Juliaca durante todo el día.
Maribel ha visto siempre la necesidad de superarse, es por eso, que ha trabajado siempre para contar con su independencia, lo más difícil ha sido tener que afrontarlo sola, las largas horas de trabajo hacen que algunas veces se sienta un estresada, pero el malestar es mínimo, ya que su trabajo es bueno y le gusta interactuar con la gente que busca en ella consejo para adquirir un móvil.  Maribel trabaja para prosperar, mantener su independencia económica y no tener que depender de una pareja. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más equipos para mejorar su venta e incrementar las ganancias de su negocio, en el futuro le gustaría contar con una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Maribel is 26 years old and she lives alone in a rented room. She sells cell phones and accessories in the city of Juliaca all day long.

Maribel has always seen the necessity of overcoming, and this is why she has always worked in order to be independent. The hardest part has been working long hours alone, as sometimes she gets stressed. However, her discomfort is minimal as her work is good and she likes interacting with the people that come to her for advice about buying a cell phone. Maribel works to prosper, maintain her economic independence and to not have to depend on a partner. With the money she has asked for she will buy more equipment to improve her sales and increase her earnings from this business. In the future she would like to have a much bigger shop.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of cell phones that seh sells/Incrementar la cantidad de equipos celulares que vende.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga inicio su negocio hace 3 años empezó con la venta de sartenes industriales para la elaboración de comidas, debido a que la situación económica en su casa era muy precaria ya que su marido gana el salario mínimo y no pueden solventar solo todos los gastos y ella desea darle educación a su hijo para que en un futuro sea una persona preparada.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Olga started her business three years ago. She started with the sale of industrial frying pans for making food, owing to the economic situation in her house it was very precarious, since her husband makes minimum wage and they cannot meet all of their expenses and she wants to give her son an education so that in the future he is a prepared person.

She needs a loan of $375 which she will repay in six months to buy merchandise and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 25, 22 y 11 años, su esposo trabaja como taxista. Ella inicio hace 2 años su negocio ya que siempre ha trabajado en venta de productos por catalogo después de un tiempo decidió cambiar de giro y empezó a elaborar y vender gorditas de azúcar ya que siempre le ha gustado cocinar así que empezó en su casa preparándolas como le ha ido muy bien ahora quiere dedicarse a venderlas en los mercados.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para establecer su negocio en el mercado y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel is married and has 3 children who are 25, 22 and 11 years old. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She began her business 2 years ago working in catalog sales, but after awhile she decided to make a change and began to make and sell sugar “gorditas” (sweet tortillas, popular in Monterrey). As Isabel has always liked to cook, she started preparing gorditas at home and since she did well with them she now wants to sell them at the markets.

Isabel needs to borrow $375 in order to establish her business in the market and to get more clients. She will repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Establish her business in a market

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. A. sells assorted cereals in Kisumu, Kenya. Her market stand carries maize, beans, and rice among other varieties. Wholesale cereal sellers are located in Busia town, which is located on the Kenya-Uganda border. Rose cannot afford the cost of travel in order to buy directly from Busia town, so she purchases her cereals from middle men in Kibuye market (a large open air market in Kisumu).

Rose is requesting her first loan of $250 USD so that she can travel to Busia town directly. There she can purchase cereals from the wholesaler herself, without buying through middlemen. She has calculated that the discounted wholesale price will pay for the cost of travel and also provide her with extra profits.

Rose is 35 years old and married with seven children. She and her husband have three girls and four boys. Two of the children are in secondary school, while the rest are still in primary school. Rose will be using profits from her cereal sales to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: Originaire de Bopa dans le département du Mono, dame O. Léa est née vers 1972. Mariée à WANOU Pierre, technicien en électronique de formation, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Elle n'a jamais été à l'école. A dix ans elle aidait sa maman à cultiver le manioc et à vendre  la liqueur traditionnelle  à base de vin de palme appelée "sodabi". Puis, elle alla en apprentissage en couture pendant 02 ans. Par la suite elle s'est lancée dans la production de farine. Depuis 10 ans elle s'est mise dans la vente des produits vivriers et de divers articles de grande consommation à savoir maïs, riz, etc. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Coming from Bopa in Mono Province, Mrs. Léa O. was born around 1972. Married to Pierre Wano, who studied to be an electronics technician, Léa is the mother of four children. She has never been to school. At the age of 10, she was helping her mother grow manioc and sell a traditional liquor made from palm wine called "sodabi". Then she became a seamstress's apprentice for 2 years. After that she began to produce flour. For the past 10 years, she has been selling foodstuffs and staples such as maize, rice, etc. that are in great demand. She is requesting this first loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 sacks of rice of 50 kg each, 1/2 sack of sugar and a sack of manioc flour

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth A. O. was born in Ringa, Kenya, and moved to Kisumu in 1998. She lives in Kisumu with her husband and their 4 children, 1 boy and 3 girls who are all in primary school.

Yucabeth runs a vegetable stand in Dunga, which is a small village on the outskirts of Kisumu, located on the edge of Lake Victoria. She purchases the vegetables in small quantities from Sondu, a town to the southeast of Kisumu.

This will be Yucabeth’s first loan, and she is requesting $125 in order to expand her range of produce. Now Yucabeth sells mainly potatoes, yams, and bananas, and she would like to offer her customers more choices, including pumpkins.

loans.use: To expand her range of produce

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr:
Madame Assa H. est âgée de 31 ans et vit avec son mari et ses trois (3) enfants dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Comme il est de coutume dans le milieu traditionnel rural, elle abandonna les études pour se marier très tôt. Afin de s’insérer dans la vie active, elle décida de mener une activité génératrice de revenus. Après une phase d’apprentissage auprès de sa maman elle décida de se spécialiser dans la vente de pagnes brodés et Wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest) depuis maintenant 15 ans. Jouissant d’une grande notoriété et de la maîtrise dans le domaine de la lingerie vestimentaire, sa boutique est très fréquentée par les jeunes filles et jeunes dames de la ville de Ségou.
Pour faire face à la concurrence du secteur et maintenir sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans.  Après avoir bouclé 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 50 pièces de pagnes brodés, 5 pièces de pagnes uni wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de grossistes du grand marché. Madame Assa H. vend ses articles au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de quelques hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui servira à augmenter son fonds de commerce et aider son conjoint à subvenir aux charges familiales. Son ambition est d’avoir une maison d’habitation afin de se défaire des péripéties de la location.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assa H., 31, lives with her husband and her 3 children in a monogamous family in the Médine neighborhood of the town of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

As is the custom in traditional rural areas, she left off her studies to marry at a young age. So as to get into active life, she decided to find a business that would allow her to earn money. After a period of apprenticeship with her mother, she decided 15 years ago to specialize in selling embroidered and Wax-style "pagnes" (lengths of colorful African cloth that are very much in demand in West Africa). She is well-known and very good at her specialty of wearing apparel, and her shop is frequently visited by girls and young ladies of the town of Ségou.

In order to keep up with the competition in this sector and to maintain her ever-growing clientele, she decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having repaid 4 solidarity loans (group loans) with an association in her neighborhood, she is presently on her third individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

This loan will be used to buy 50 lengths of embroidered pagnes and 5 lengths of "uni wax" pagnes. She does her buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers at the big open-air market. Mrs. Assa H. sells her items for cash and on credit to a clientele essentially composed of women and a few men.

She intends to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which will be used to add to her working capital and to help her spouse with the family expenses. Her ambition is to have a family home so as to be able to move out of that neighborhood.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of embroidered and wax-style lengths of African cloth

loans.name: Tavita

texts.es:
Tavita decidió emprender el negocio en su casa para poder atender a sus hijos, ya que su esposo la abandono sin aportar dinero para el gasto familiar. Hace 2 años decidió vender ropa, después que su negocio creció, empezó a viajara a Guadalajara para surtir su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $900 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y poder cumplir con varios pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Tavita decided to start a business at home so that she could be with her children since her husband abandoned her and does not pay anything to support the family. Two years ago she decided to sell clothes. After her business grew, she started to travel to Guadalajara to stock up on goods.

Tavita needs to borrow $900 which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and to fulfill several back orders.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Sidibé est âgée de 42 ans, elle vit avec son mari et ses six (6) enfants dans une famille nucléaire dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Obligée d’abandonner l’école pour le mariage, elle tenta plusieurs activités génératrices de revenu sans succès. Elle décide finalement de mener l’activité d’achat et de vente des matériels en bois fabriqués localement par les forgerons tels   les mortiers, les escabeaux, les pilons, les agitateurs etc et cela depuis 5 ans. Le mortier est un récipient en bois utilisé par les femmes (indispensable en milieu rural) pour décortiquer, broyer et moudre les graines de céréales, les condiments etc. Jouissant d’une grande popularité, elle est très sollicitée surtout à l’approche de l’hivernage où les femmes font beaucoup d’achat pour la constitution des trousseaux de mariage de leurs filles (car dans la mentalité bambara en générale et celle des maliens en particulier une femme qui n’a pas de mortier dans son trousseau de mariage est comme un cultivateur sans charrue). En plus de son activité principale, elle fait également le commerce du charbon de bois et de miel.
Afin de se faire un stock pour remédier à d’éventuelle rupture, elle a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elle est en relation depuis trois ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et un prêt individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 mortiers, 7 sacs de charbon et 20 litres de miel.
Madame Assitan Sidibé s’approvisionne à Tissala un des villages environnants de la ville de Ségou auprès de forgerons spécialistes du bois (pour les mortiers), des paysans faisant de l’apiculture(pour le miel) et ceux ayant une autorisation de coupe et de vente de bois( pour le charbon de bois). Elle vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Sidibé, 42, lives with her husband and her six children in a nuclear family in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Obliged to abandon school to be married, she tried out several money-earning activities without success. She finally decided to engage in the buying and selling of wooden objects made locally by metal-workers, such as mortars, stools, grain huskers, stirrers, etc. She has been doing this for 5 years now. A mortar is a receptacle made of wood used by women (indispensable for rural folk) to husk, break, and grind cereals, condiments, etc.

Enjoying great popularity, she is much sought after, especially around the beginning of the off-season when women do a lot of buying as they set up trousseaus for their daughters (since in Bambara culture in general and that of Malians in particular a woman without a mortar is like a farmer without a plow) de leurs filles (car dans la mentalité bambara en générale et celle des maliens en particulier une femme qui n’a pas de mortier dans son trousseau de mariage est comme un cultivateur sans charrue). Besides her principal business, she also sells charcoal and honey.

So as to build up her inventory to avoid running out of something, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been working for 3 years. After three group loans (solidarity loans) and one individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is on her second individual loan which she will use to buy 15 mortars, 7 sacks of charcoal, and 20 liters of honey.

Mrs. Assitan Sidibé does her buying in Tissala, one of the neighboring villages of the town of Ségou from blacksmiths specialized in working with wood (for the mortars), rural folk who keep bees for her honey, and those who have an authorisation to cut wood as far as the charcoal is concerned. She sells for cash or on credit to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which will be used to make repayments on the loan and for her own needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mortars, charcoal, and honey

loans.name: Djiguissèmè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguissèmè est composé de 6 femmes (une veuve et 5 mariées) ayant en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent à majorité dans des grandes familles élargies du bozokin (quartier de Bozo une ethnie spécialisée dans la pêche de poissons d’eau douce) de Kirango de la sous-préfecture de Markala région de Ségou(quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et professionnel, elles mènent toutes la même activité génératrice de revenu à savoir la vente du poisson (sous toutes ses formes). En plus de la vente du poisson, elles font le petit commerce de bois de chauffe et du savon pendant la période de crue où les poissons sont rares. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs affaires, les membres du groupe intégrèrent le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel ils sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 450 kilogrammes de poisson et 70 barres de glace. Une partie du poisson est fumée à la maison sur des fours traditionnels conçus spécialement pour cette activité et l’autre partie est vendue en etat frais. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson à l’entrée du barrage de Markala avec les pêcheurs. Une partie de leur marchandise est vendue en ambulant aux fonctionnaires domiciliés dans le quartier servicekin (quartier administratif) et au marché de Kirango tant disque l’autre moitié est vendue à Ségou à des clientes fidèles qui achètent en gros pour les revendre.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé généralement pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et aider les époux à subvenir aux charges familiales. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter chacune une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Djiguissèmè group is composed of 6 women (a widow and 5 married women) with an average age of 48 and 5 children. Most of them live in big, extended families in the Bozokin (in a neighborhood of Bozo, an ethnicity specialized in fresh-water fishing) in Kirango, Sous-prefecture of Markala, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Linked by bonds of kinship, neighborhood, and professional ties, they all work at the same business, i.e., selling fish (in all forms). Besides selling fish, they sell firewood and soap on a small scale during the periods when there are not many fish to be found.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, the members of the group joined the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans were reimbursed correctly.

This third loan will be used to buy 450 kg of fish and 70 blocks of ice. Some of the fish is smoked at their homes on traditional fireplaces specially designed for this activity and the rest is sold fresh. They buy their fish at the entrance to the Markala dam from fishermen. Some of their merchandise is sold door-to-door to bureaucrats who live in the Servicekin neighborhood (the administrative district) and at the market of Kirango, whereas the other half is sold in Ségou to faithful customers who buy wholesale in order to re-sell the fish.

They hope to make an average profit of 35,000 F CFA each month, using the money in general to pay school fees for their children and to help their husbands pay living expenses for their families. Their ambition is to each be able to buy a house to live in.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish to smoke or re-sell fresh

loans.name: Luz Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la compra y venta de ropa usada americana, que comercializa en una tienda que tiene a unas cuadras de un popular mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. Tiene tres hijos, los cuales estan en edad escolar; trabaja desde el año 2006 en Emprender, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. El crédito será invertido en la diversificación de la ropa que comercializa porque se vienen las fiestas de fin de año, una temporada alta para la venta, además destinará un monto en la refación de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Graciela, the mother of three school-aged children, has worked for a long time buying and selling used clothing from the US. She has a shop several blocks from a popular market in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Since 2006 she has worked with Emprender and is a hardworking and responsible person. The loan will be invested in the diversification of merchandise because end-of-year holidays are coming and with them, the season of high sales. Graciela will also use some of the money for house repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing and make repairs to home

loans.name: Geovana Estela

texts.es: La señora Geovanna se dedica a la venta de artesanias en la calle Sagarnaga, una calle turística y colonial de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia a su vez un lugar muy visitado por personas extranjeras, donde se puede comprar objetos autóctonos propios de la región y el país, asi como tejidos y manualidades hechas por manos bolivianas. Se dedica a este rubro desde muy pequeña, puesto que su mamá tenía este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene una hijita pequeña, de la que se ocupa, con el apoyo de su familia. Es muy reponsable, invertirá el crédito en la compra de aretes y collares hechos de semillas, y otros materiales artesanales.
texts.en:
Geovana has dedicated herself to the sale of crafts in La Paz, Bolivia on a street called Sagarnaga which is in a colonial district popular with tourists. It is a place where many foreigners come to buy objects native to the region and the country as well as fabrics and crafts made by Bolivian hands. She has been doing this work since she was small when her mother owned the business. She has a young daughter she cares for with the help of her family. Geovana is very responsible and with the loan she will invest in earrings and necklaces made from seeds and other craft materials.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Rella

texts.fr: RELLA S. EST COMMERCANTE DEPUIS PLUS DE 15 ANS. ELLE COMMERCIALISE DES PRODUITS COSMETIQUES, TISSUS? DRAPS DE LIT. ELLE EST MARIEE DEPUIS PLUS DE 35 ANS.
texts.en:
RELLA S. has been a merchant for over fifteen years. She markets cosmetics, cloth, and bedsheets. She has been married for over 35 years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics, cloth, and bedsheets

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr: OUSSEYNOU S. CCOMMERCIALISE DU MATERIEL ELECTRONIQUE DEPUIS 2001. MAIS AVEC LA PERIODE D'OUVERTURE DES CLASSES, IL VEND DES LIVRES ET PAPETERIES SCOLAIRES. IL EST CELIBATAIRE SANS ENFANTS A CHARGE.
texts.en:
OUSSEYNOU S. has been marketing electronics goods since 2001. But now that the school year has begun, he sells books and paper supplies for students. He is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell school books, supplies, and electronics goods

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es: El grupo Alfa y Omega esta compuesto por tres personas, trabajan solamente con Emprender, y son muy buenas clientes. La lider del grupo es doña Wilma que se dedica a las manualidades, como el bordado D. manteles, pintado en tela, y confección D. sets D. baño y cocina. Para estas fiestas D. fin D. año realizará arreglos naviD.ños,  que hace a pedido por ser muy conocida en su zona. Doña Silvia se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo, tiene bastantes pedidos D. perfumes, y en esta ocasión invertirá en el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo. Doña Rosario se dedica a la confección D. edredones, D. cuatro y tres plazas, confección D. almohadas D. colores vivos que son muy solicitados entre su clientela. Las tres señoras son muy responsables y puntuales.
texts.en:
The Alpha and Omega group is maD. up of three people, all of whom are very good clients and work exclusively with Emprender (i.e. they don't have loans out with any other microfinance institutions). Doña Wilma is the leader of the group, who makes handicrafts like embroidered tablecloths, fabric paintings and kitchen and bath sets. She is currently preparing Christmas arrangements for end-of-year festivities; she gets many requests for these items since she is very well-known in the area. Doña Silvia sells cosmetics from a catalog. She receives many perfume orders and plans to use this loan to increase her working capital. Doña Rosario sews quilts of different sizes as well as brightly colored pillows, which are very popular with her clients. All three women are very responsible and punctual with their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Etse

texts.fr: Etse K. est un commerçant de petits détails  âgé de 33 ans et réside à Kpalimé au Togo avec sa petite famille.  Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, il espère acheter des sacs de  riz, de sucres, des cartons de laits et autres boîtes de conserves afin d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Avec cette oportunité, il  espère mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Etse K. is a small-scale retailer. He is 33 years old and lives in Kpalimé, Togo, with his small family. With this third FECECAV loan, he hopes to buy sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, and canned foods in order to expand his commerce. With this opportunity, he hopes to meet the demands of his customers better and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, and canned foods

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca inició el negocio para tener una ayuda extra porque su esposo no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, servicios y demás. Comenzó cuando una amiga la invito a participar por medio de la venta de productos cosméticos, ella le ayudaba a vender y le daba una comisión, después con las ganancias fue juntando dinero y se inscribió para estar ella directamente como distribuidora ya que tenía sus propios clientes, lo que le permitirá tener mejore ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar productos de pedidos que ya tiene, ella quiere incrementar sus ganancias para poder terminar un cuarto que esta construyendo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisca began her business in order to have extra help because her husband does not make enough money to cover the cost of food, services, etc. She started when a friend invited her to participate in selling cosmetic products. She helped her sell and gave her a commission. Later with her earnings she signed up to become a distributor so that now she has her own clients and a greater income.

Francisca needs to borrow $225 which she will repay in 5 months. She will use the loan to buy products to fulfill back orders. She wants to increase her earnings so that she can finish a room she is constructing in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristal Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Cristal  está formado por 10 socias, pertenecen a la zona D. Pampahasi y San Antonio D. la ciudad D. La Paz, Bolivia Trabajan con Emprender desD. hace dos años, actualmente están en el 6º ciclo crediticio. La señra Cristina A., es la líder del grupo desD. sus inicios, es la fundadora, cuenta con un puesto D. venta D. frutas en el mercado D. la zona, es una socia muy responsable, que sabe guiar al grupo. El señor David M., es chofer propietario D. un minibús y además mecánico, también fundador del grupo. La sra. Basilia  M., socia antigua, se dedica a la venta D. libros por catálogo. La señora Nicasia G., cliente que ingresa en este ciclo, invitada por las socias que la conocen muy bien, su actividad es la venta D. cordero y queso en la ciudad D. El Alto, mercadería que trae D. su pueblo. La señora Beatriz M. es tambien cliente nueva, que ingresa en este ciclo, fue invitada por doña Cristina, se dedica a la venta D. frutas en el mismo mercado. La señora Julia Vasquez, cliente antigua es cocinera en un comedor popular D. la zona y atienD. contratos para acontecimientos sociales. La señora Elena Angélica M., fundadora del grupo, tiene su puesto D. venta D. DVD's y CD's musicales, y películas. La sra. Agustina C., buena cliente, se dedica a la venta D. frazadas, por pedidos. Elba C., cliente nueva, que se dedica a la confección D. chompas, invitada por las socias a participar en el grupo, por su carácter responsable. La sra. Catalina L., cliente invitada por las socias, venD. ropa nueva y usada americana, en la feria D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Todas las socias del grupo invertirán el crédito en aumentar su capital, ya que tienen que estar preparadas para las fiestas D. fin D. año.
texts.en:
The Cristal Communal Bank is maD. up of ten members who live in the Pampahasi and San Antonio neighborhoods in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. They have been working with Emprender for two years and are currently on their sixth loan cycle. Señora Cristina A. has been the group leader from the very beginning and is also the group's founder. She has a fruit stand in the local market. She is a very responsible member and knows how to lead the group. Señor David M. drives a minibus (the primary form of public transportation in La Paz) and is also a mechanic. He also helped found the group. Señora Basilia M., a long-time group member, sells books by catalogue. Señora Nicasia G. is a new member; she was invited by group members who know her well. She works in the city of El Alto, selling lamb and cheese that she brings to the city from her village. Señora Beatriz M. is also new to the group; she was invited by Doña Cristina to join this loan cycle. She sells fruit in the same local market. Señora Julia Vasquez, a long-time member, works as a cook at a "comedor popular" (a lunch counter that sells low-cost meals to the working class) and cooks for social occasions. Señora Elena Angelica M., one of the group's founding members, sells CDs and DVDs. Señora Agustina C., a good client, sells blankets by special order. Elba C., a new member, sews sweaters. She was invited to join the group because of her responsible character. Señora Catalina L. sells both used and new clothing in the El Alto market. She was also invited to join the group for this loan cycle. All of the group members plan to invest their loans to increase their working capital (to purchase more merchandise to sell, generally), since they have to get ready for end-of-year festivities.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D., 51 ans, divorcée avec 01 enfant qui est l’école primaire en charge est membre du banc villageois de Centre 2 C depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente  de thioub (tissus teintés), de prêt à porter  et chaussures pour femme et son élevage de poulets de chair. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Awa D., 51, is divorced, raising 1 child who is in primary school. She has been a member of the village bank of Centre 2 C for four and a half years. She wants to boost her business selling thioub (hand-dyed cloth), ready-to-wear, and shoes for women, as well as her business raising fryers. Her income allows her to improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of clothing and raising fryers

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Dame G. Bernadette est née en 1942 à Ouidah et est mariée à BOKO Pierre, comptable retraité. Elevée par sa grande mère paternelle, elle revendait des tissus et des pagnes avec cette dernière. Elle s'est mise ensuite à son propre compte avec l'aide financière de son mari. Elle achetait des pagnes, des parfums et savons qu'elle revendait au grand marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Victime d'un cambriolage, elle s'est retrouvée à la maison où elle vend des produits tels que charbons, produits de vannerie, feuilles et écorces pour tisanes. Aujourd'hui elle a repris avec la vente des produits cosmétiques à savoir savons, parfums, pommades et laits de soins corporels et autres produits de beauté. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt d'un montant de 160000fcfa pour agrandir son étalage.
texts.en:
Ms.Bernadette G. was born in 1942 in Ouidah and is married to Pierre BOKO, a retired accountant. She was raised by her paternal grandmother, who used to work with her selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth). Next, she got started on her own with her husband's financial assistance. She used to buy pagnes, perfume, and soap that she sold at the grand Dantokpa marketplace of Cotonou. A victim of burglary, she ended up at home, where she sold goods such as charcoal, woven baskets, and leaves and bark for making tea (infusions). Today, she has resumed selling cosmetics, namely soap, perfume, ointments, body care lotions, and other beauty products. She is requesting this third loan in the amount of 160,000 francs CFA to expand her display of goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 brooms, 40 baskets, 100 boxes of body care lotion

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es una persona honesta, alegre y muy trabajadora. Inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo, que en ese entonces vivía, con los gastos de la casa ya que sus 2 hijas estaban estudiando y querían apoyarlas para que terminaran una carrera universitaria. Comenzó en Marzo de 2002 cuando por iniciativa propia empezó a vender perfumes pero le quedaron mal varios clientes, por lo que se decidió mejor a vender ropa y calzado entre sus amistades y vecinos y le fue mejor. Desde entonces, su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco y el último crédito que recibió a través de KIVA le sirvió muchísimo para poder comprar mercancía.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir de nuevo en ropa y calzado de temporada que le permita tener un mejor surtido para esta época de fin de año que se acerca y de este modo satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gregoria is an honest person, cheerful and very hardworking. She started her business to help her husband, who she she lived with at the time, with household expenses. Their 2 daughters were studying and they wanted to help them finish their university degrees. In March of 2002 she started on her own initiative to sell perfume, but it did not work out well with several clients. For that reason she decided it would be better to sell clothes and shoes to her friends and neighbors and that has gone well. Since then her business has grown little by little, and her last loan from KIVA helped a great deal, making it possible for her to buy merchandise.

Gregoria needs to borrow $750 which she will repay in 6 months. Again, she will invest in seasonal clothes and shoes which will allow her to have a better selection for the coming end-of-year season. In this way she will be able to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey dans le département du zou, dame S.  Jeanne est née en 1964 .Divorcée avec 04 enfants à charge elle a été à l'école jusqu'en classe de Cinquième au cours secondaire. Le manque de soutien financier l'a obligé à abandonner les classes. Ensuite, elle reçut une formation en dactylographe qu'elle n'eut pas la chance d'exercer. Ainsi, elle s'est lancée dans la vente de nourriture, puis après, dans la vente de farine de manioc (gari), beignets d'arachide, liqueurs. Ces dernières années, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente charbon, fagots de bois et dans la distribution de pagne et autres articles à crédit pour les salariés de la fonction publique. C'est pour accroître le capital de son activité qu'elle sollicite ce deuxième prêt de 140000f pour pour s'approvisionner en maïs, tubercules d'igname et pagnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne S. was born in 1964, she is a native of Abomey in the department of Zou. She is divorced and financially responsible for 4 children. She attended school until 7th grade, middle school. The lack of financial resources forced her to abandon her schooling. Later, she received a training as a typist, but, unfortunately, was never able to practice. Thus she began selling food, then later, sold manioc flour (gari), peanut fritters,and liquor. In the last few years, she has specialized in the sale on credit of charcoal, bundles of firewood and the distribution of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric) and other goods to civil service employees. To increase her business capital she is requesting this second loan of 140,000F to stock up on corn, coco yams and pagnes.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bags of corn, one bag of coco yams and 12 pieces of pagnes

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna B., mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Centre 2 C depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des thioubs (tissus teintés) et revendre à Dakar. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna B., married and raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Centre 2 C for 4 and a half years. She wants to boost her business which consists of buying "thioubs" (lengths of hand-dyed cloth) to re-sell in Dakar. The income from her business allows her to help support the family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of lengths of dyed cloth

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El Sr. Javier tiene 33 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua, que se llama Villa Reconciliación, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 2,4 y 22 años de edad, el mayor estudia, el negocio de don Javier es la venta de madera, tiene tres años de experiencia en las ventas, inicio con ayuda de su jefe a quien le trabajo durante ocho años, lo cual con dedicación y esfuerzo gano su confianza y lo apoya para que tuviera su propio negocio. Con la solicitud de crédito es para invertir en madera y comprar cinco mil pulgadas de madera de cedro macho, para ofertar mas sus productos. a largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura del local de venta, crecer mas en ventas y mejorar el nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Javier is 33 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Reconciliation Village in the capital city of Managua. His wife has three children, ages 2, 4 and 22, and the oldest is in school. Javier sells lumber for a living and has three years' experience. He started with the help of his boss, for whom he worked for eight years. With dedication and hard work he gained the confidence and the support to start his own business. He's requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wood and to buy 5,000 inches of strong ceder in order to offer more of his products. In the long term, the goal is to improve the infrastructure of his store, grow his sales and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: La señora Marcela, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, se dedica día a día desde muy temprano en la mañana a la venta de frutas y verduras en un mercado muy popular de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. Esta casada, su marido es chofer de transporte público, y entre ambos llevan el sustento diario al hogar, son muy sacrificados y trabajan con mucho esfuerzo para mantener a su pequeño hijo que está en edad escolar. La casa donde vive la familia es muy pobre y humilde.
texts.en:
Señora Marcela is a very humble and hardworking woman. She works from day to day from very early in the morning selling fruits and vegetables in a popular market in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. She is married. Her husband is a driver of public transportation, and between them they are able to manage the daily sustenance of the household. They are very sacrificing and they work very hard in order to maintain their small son who is of school age. The house where the family lives is very poor and humble.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Edoh K. est un revendeur des produits phytosanitaire âgé de 47 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. C’est un commerce florissant pour lui car la concurrence n’est pas aussi rude dans ce secteur. Il veut contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire en gagnant la confiance de ses clients  et désire par ce crédit renforcer son  fonds de roulement .Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus exigeante, gagner plus d’argent et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Edoh est celui habillé en chemise bleu du côté gauche. La seconde personne est un client.
texts.en:
Edoh K. sells phyto-chemicals for farms. He is 47, married, and the father of 4 children. His business is booming since the competition is not bad in this sector. He would like to contribute to the prosperity of his business by gaining the confidence of his customers and with this loan, he wants to bolster his working capital. With the good fortune to be able to post on Kiva, he will from now on be able to meet the needs of his clientele who are more and more demanding. He will earn more money and thus be able to improve living conditions for his family. Edoh is the one wearing a blue shirt on the left in the photo. The other person is a customer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing phyto-chemicals for farmers

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr: Sieur AMOUSOU Gilbert est né vers 1963 à Toffo d'où il est originaire. Il a abandonné les cours en classe de CM2 faute de soutien familial. Il a été en apprentissage en maçonnerie pendant 8 ans. Il travaille en tant qu'ouvrier sur les chantiers de construction immobilière et y gagne son pain quotidien. Mais les difficultés à vraiment trouver  un revenu stable l'ont amené à se lancer dans le commerce parallèlement à son métier de maçon. Ainsi souhaite-t-il s'approvisionner par ce deuxième de 100000f en maïs, farine de manioc "gari " et haricot. Sieur A. Gilbert est marié et père de 5 enfants dont un est décédé.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilbert Amousou was born around 1963 in Toffo. He left school after 5th grade because of lack of family support. He apprenticed as a mason for 8 years. He works on building construction sites and earns his daily bread. But the difficulty in finding steady income has made him try sales at the same time as working as a mason. Thus he would like to use this, his second loan of 100,000 F CFA to purchase maize (corn), "gari" i.e., manioc flour, and dried beans. Mr. A. is married and the father of 5 children, of whom one is deceased.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of one sack of maize (corn), 1 sack of manioc flour, and 1/2 sack of dried beans

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es una persona muy trabajadora y simpática. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso para sacar adelante a sus hijos y tratar de darles estudio, pero desgraciadamente ellos al ver la situación decidieron no estudiar y ponerse a trabajar para ayudarla. Comenzó en Mayo de 1988 vendiendo productos cosméticos en sus tiempos libres, ya que también trabajaba como empleada en un negocio. Mas adelante, una amiga la convenció para que vendiera ropa ya que en su empleo no le pagaban bien, y así lo hizo. Después sus hijos entraron a trabajar y ya me empezaron a ayudar y apoyar con los gastos familiares.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para poder viajar de nuevo a la ciudad de Moroleón, Guanajuato a comprar ropa y calzado ya que ahí es donde se surte para tener siempre artículos de temporada y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a very hard-working and kind person. She began her business in order to earn an income to help her children to get ahead, and to try to give them access to education. Unfortunately, after seeing the economic situation they decided not to study and instead to find work in order to help her. She began selling cosmetics in her spare time in May of 1988, as she worked full-time in another job. Later, a friend persuaded her to sell clothes as her job did not pay well. Then her children started work and began to help with the family expenses. Juana needs a loan for US$750, to be paid over 6 months, in order to travel to the city of Moroleón, Guanajuato to buy clothes and footwear, in order to have seasonal items and to be able to meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To be able to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Aissatou D., 45 ans, mariée avec 06 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des thioubs (tissus teintés) en Guinée et au Mali et revendre. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Aissatou D., 45, married and raising 6 children, has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Aidara for 5 and a half years. She wants to boost her business which consists in buying thioubs (hand-dyed cloth) in Guinea and Mali for re-sale. The income from her business allows her to help out with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of thioub from Guinea and from Mali

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 58 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Riguero, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 21 y 25 años de edad,  que trabajan, don Carlos vende ropa y productos de plásticos, desde haces cinco años, el inicio con la liquidación de un trabajo que tenia anterior, con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en ropa de damas y caballero ya que los pedidos son mucho y desea aprovechar a sus clientes como la temporada. A futuro es poner un taller de costura y incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 58 years old and he lives in a neighbourhood within the capital city of Managua called Riguero. His wife has given him two children, aged 21 and 25 years of age, and they are both working. Carlos sells clothing and plastic products and he has been doing so for the past 5 years. He started out when he was layed off from the work he had before. With the loan he is requesting he will invest in the purchase of clothing for ladies and gentlemen, especially because he has many orders already placed. He wants to take advantage of the clientele that comes with the season. In the future he hopes to set up a tailoring shop and increase his sales.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ladies' and gentlemens' clothing.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Adama D., 39 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 2 ans. Elle travaille avec son mari. Ils ont ouvert une boutique au marché Central. Elle veut  un prêt pour acheter des thioubs (tissus teintés) et des wax à  revendre pour renforcer leur commerce de vêtements. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Adama D., 39, married and raising two children, has been a member of the village bank of Sinthiang Aidara for two years. She works with her husband. They have opened a shop at the Central Market. She wants a loan to buy thioubs (hand-dyed cloth) and lengths of wax-style cloth for re-sale to boost their clothing business. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of thioubs and wax-style cloth for their shop

loans.name: Marta Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Reconciliación de la bloquera Haward 2 c al este, tiene dos hijos de 19 y 28 años de edad uno estudia en la universidad la carrera licenciatura en admón., de empresa,y el otro trabaja y es independiente. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y se desempeña como auditor de contabilidad. Su negocio de doña Martha es la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace siete años esta con las ventas, inicio con dinero que su esposo e hijo le dieron para invertir en ropa lo cual vende al contado y al crédito a la gente que trabaja en la zona franca de las Mercedes. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para ropa de hombre, mujer y de niños ya que mucho vende por encargo y desea satisfacer a sus clientes con los pedidos. A largo plazo es incrementar en inventario, hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Reconciliation Village in the city of Managua. She has two children, ages 19 and 28, one who is studying business administration at the university and another who works and is independent. Her husband works for a private company as an account auditor. Martha's business has been selling clothes and shoes for six years. She started with money that her husband and son gave her to invest in clothing to sell on cash or credit to people in the Mercedes Industrial Free Trade Zone. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing for men, women and children since she has many orders and she wants to meet her customers' demands. Her long term goal is to increase her inventory and make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for men, women and children to sell

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Marta P. S. es originaria de la ciudad de Managua y labora en el mercado Israel Lewites donde se desempeña en la venta de productos de vidrio y productos para el hogar dedicándose a este negocio desde hace 16 largos años.

Hoy en día gracias al apoyo obtenido por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar su negocio ya que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de productos de vidrio y además ha mejorado su situación económica por lo que ha desarrollado su negocio. Una vez más solicita el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual adquirir los productos y comercializarlos en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marta P. S. is from the city of Managua and works in the Israel Lewites market where she sells glass and homewares, and manages very well. She has been devoted to this business for 16 long years. Today, thanks to the support of Ceprodel she has managed to improve her business as she has acquired greater quantities of glass products. She has improved her economic situation by developing her business. She is asking for help from Ceprodel once more, in order to get a loan to purchase stock and to market her business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stock

loans.name: Mardely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mardely tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Anexo Villa Libertad,  tiene tres hijos de 10,23 y 30 años de edad, el menor esta estudiando y dos trabajan su esposo trabaja como conductor, el negocio de la Sra. Mardely es la venta de cosmético desde hace doce años, inicio con  dinero propio con dinero de la venta de una camioneta que tenia. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar más producto de cosméticos y aprovechar la buena temporada como es la navidad. A largo plazo es poder establecer una tienda  en  un lugar céntrico donde pueda captar clientes, y elevar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mardely is 46 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Liberty Annexed Village in the capital city of Managua. She has three children, ages 10, 23 and 30. The youngest is in school and the two eldest work with husband as drivers. Mardely's business has been selling cosmetics for 12 years. She started with money she got from selling a van she had. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetic supplies and take advantage of the Christmas season.
