Her long-term goal is to establish a centrally located store where she can attract customers and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Reynaldo tiene 36 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Laureles Norte, su esposa le tiene 8 hijos todos están bajo su domicilio y le ayudan a trabajar sus edades son 7, 10, 12, 14, 15, 17,18 y 20 años de edad, estudian, el negocio de don Reynaldo es la compra y venta de chatarra y tiene diez años en las ventas que comenzó cuando vendió unas propiedades de tierra que tenia, en donde compro una camioneta en la cual hace su trabajo, su esposa anda con el en la compra de las chatarras, para poder sacar a delante a su familia ya que es un poco numerosa y tenemos muchos gastos. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de chatarra en el departamento de Boaco y sus comunidades que se haya bastante producto para luego venderla en Managua. A largo plazo es poder comprar otra camioneta para comprar más chatarra y tener más utilidades, poder dar estudios a sus hijos para que sean personas sociables.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 36 years old and livest in a neighborhood called North Laureles in the capital city of Managua. His wife has eight children, all who live under his roof and help him with his work. Their ages are 7, 10, 12, 14, 15, 17, 18 and 20, and they are in school. Reynaldo's business buys and sells scrap metal, and he has 10 years of experience in sales that began when he sold some land properties he had, and with it he bought a truck to carry out his work. His wife does the buying of the metals to help make headway for the family since it is quite large and there are a lot of expenses. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase scrap metal in the county of Boaco and its communities, which have a good amount of product, and then sell it in Managua. His long term goal is to be able to purchase another truck so he can take in more metal and have more profits, and provide for his children's education so they can be productive members of society.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de chatarra

loans.name: Crépin

texts.fr: Né en 1985 à Abomey d'où il est originaire, sieur T. Crépin est  marié et père des jumeaux  Luciano et Luciana. Il a été à l'école jusqu'en classe de CM2 et puis, il s'est formé en coiffure pendant trois ans et reçut son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage. Depuis 6 ans il exerce ce métier auquel il a ajouté la vente des produits cosmétiques pour l'entretien de la chevelure. Actuellement, il s'est lancé dans la vente de téléphones portables et  d'accessoires y afférents pour lesquels il va s'approvisionner au Nigéria. Pour renforcer cette dernière activité, il sollicite ce deuxième prêt de 120000fcfa d'une durée de 10 mois.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Abomey, where he is originally from, Mr. Crépin T. is a married man and father of twins, Luciano and Luciana. He had completed the fifth grade when he got training as a barber for three years, after which he received his apprentice certificate. For six years, he has been practicing his trade, to which he included the sale of hair care products. Currently, he started selling cell phones and their accessories, inventory that he will get from Nigeria. To bolster this latter aspect of his business, he is requesting this second loan in the amount of 120,000 francs CFA for a 10-month duration.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a box of chargers, a box of handset casings, and 12 boxes of batteries for cell phones

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Augusto tiene 34 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah, su esposa le tiene dos hijos un varón  de 10 años y una niña de 16 años, y están estudiando la secundaria, el negocio de don Augusto es la venta de productos reciclable como hierro, cobre, aluminio y acero. Desde hace dos años esta invirtiendo en este trabajo lo cual no ha crecido por falta de financiamiento, inicio vendiendo chatarra lo cual le gana el cien por ciento en las ventas su esposa le ayuda en los reciclaje es un trabajo agotador y se trabaja todo el día, para poder obtener muchos productos. Con la solicitud de prestamos es para invertir en su negocio de reciclaje, y mejorar su situación financiera, a futuro es lograr tener su propio puerto de reciclaje para obtener mejores utilidades, todo con el objetivo de poder construir un día su casa y poder gozar de una casa digna para su familia, también poder tener salud para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios y puedan cambiar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Augusto is 34 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Hialeah in the capital Managua. He and his wife have two children: a 10-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter who is in high school. Don Augusto sells recyclable goods like iron, copper, aluminum and steel to local recycling plants. He has been investing in his business for the past two years, but it hasn't grown much due to lack of financing. He began by selling scrap metal, on which he earns 100% in profits. His wife helps him with the recycling. It is an exhausting job, and he works all day long in order to collect many recyclable products. The loan he is currently requesting will be invested in his business to improve his present financial situation by buying more iron, copper and bronze to resell to the recycling plants. His goal for the future is to open up his own recycling stand in aims of earning more so that some day he can build a home for himself and his family. He hopes to stay healthy so that he can help his children with their studies and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy iron, copper and bronze

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Mariée à ADOUNVO Staël, dame A. Denise est originaire de Covè dans le département du Zou. Née le 26 mai 1985, elle n'a jamais été à l'école et a été élevé par l'une de ses tantes. A 12 ans, elle aidait cette dernière à vendre de la nourriture. Après s'être mariée, elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec l'aide de sa belle-mère et de son mari. Elle vendait d'huile d'arachide et de sel de table. Pour pallier aux difficultés financières, elle a choisi de faire un prêt. Elle en est à son quatrième crédit d'un montant de 120000fcfa. Elle compte l'investir dans la vente de pagnes qu'elle fait depuis un an.
texts.en:
Married to Staël ADOUNVO, Ms. Denise A. is originally from Covè in Zou County. She was born on May 26, 1985 and has never attended school. She was raised by one of her aunts. At the age of 12, she used to help her sell food. After getting married, she started working on her own with the help of her mother-in-law and her husband. She sold peanut oil and table salt. To fend off financial difficulties, she has chosen to borrow money and is on her fourth loan in the amount of 120,000 francs CFA. She intends to invest in the selling of pagnes (colorful West African cloth), something she has been doing for a year.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 lengths of HITARGET-series pagnes

loans.name: Jeovany Daniel

texts.es: Don Jeovany habita en un barrio que se llama Hialeah en la capital de Managua, tiene 26 años de edad, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 1 y 5 años de edad, es ama de casa, el trabajo del Sr. Jeovany es de soldador en una agencia de publicidad, y en los tiempos libres lava y limpia carro para obtener mas ingresos, tiene ocho años de estar trabajando. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, hierro y cemento para levantar dos paredes de su casa y tener una casa digna para su familia. A futuro es obtener un trabajo donde pueda tener mejores ingresos, terminar de construir su casa, que es su sueño mas anhelado.
texts.en:
Jeovany lives in a neighborhood called Hialeah in the capital, Managua. He is 26 years old. He and his wife have two children, 1 and 5 years old and she is a homemaker. Jeovany is a welder at a publicity agency, and in his free time he washes and cleans cars to increase his income. He has been working for eight years. His loan request is to buy construction materials, such as stone, sand, iron, and cement for constructing two walls for his house so that he can have a dignified house for his family. In the future he wants to get a job that can give him more income and he wants to finish building his house, which is his greatest dream.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materiasl for building two walls of his house

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: Née le 10/05/1951 à Covè dans le département du Zou, dame B. Denise est  mariée à  ZINNON Justin et mère de trois enfants. Frappée par la maladie à son jeune âge, elle n'a pas pu fréquenter. Initiée à l'agriculture par son père, elle aidait ce dernier dans les travaux champêtres. Plus tard, elle a commencé à vendre des beignets de haricot. Aujourd'hui elle vend divers articles tels que charbons, maïs et des articles de consommation courante. En vue d' accroître son  activité, elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt d'un montant de 100000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en maïs.
texts.en:
Born on May 10, 1951 in Covè in the Zou Province, Mrs. Denise B. is married to Justin Zinnon and the mother of 3 children. Struck by illness at a young age, she was not able to go to school. Her father taught her farming and she helped him work in the fields. Later, she began to sell bean fritters. Today she sells various items such as charcoal, corn (maize), and other staple foods. In order to boost her business, she is asking for this third loan in the amount of 100,000 F CFA to stock up on corn.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of four sacks of corn (maize)

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha B. T. is a member of the community bank Llapanchik, which is a Quechuan word meaning ‘everyone together’. Bertha lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their 2 children, aged 15 & 14. Bertha travels to the fairs daily to sell cereals and grains.

With her loan of 2400 soles, Bertha will invest in her business purchasing corn and wheat from the country. Her goal is to have a bigger business and ensure her children attend the university to earn their degrees and become professionals.

loans.use: purchase corn and wheat from the country

loans.name: Dolores Serafina

texts.en:
Dolores Serafina M. O. is a member of the community bank Llapanchik, which is Quechuan for “everyone together”. Dolores lives in Ayacucho with her husband and 5 children, aged 23 to 10. You can find Dolores at home cooking and selling traditional dishes from the area including "puca picante", a dish made with potatoes, a distinctive salsa, rice usually made with pork or sausage.

With her loan of 1000 soles Dolores will invest in her business, purchasing potatoes, rice, oil, and meat. Her goal is to have a bigger business and move her business out of her house.

loans.use: purchasing potatoes, rice, oil, and meat

loans.name: Raida Paulina

texts.en:
Raida Paulina C. O. is a member of her community bank, Llapanchik, which is Quechuan for “everyone together”. Raida lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children 18 & 16. Raida and her family work daily at a small store which is in their house.

She will use her loan of 1600 soles to increase her business and invest in it by purchasing groceries including milk, oil, corn and rice to sell from her store. She is currently saving for her dream of sending her children to the University where they can earn their degree and become professionals.

loans.use: To increase her business and invest by purchasing groceries including milk, oil, corn and rice to sell from her store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia R. R. is a member of community bank, Llapanchik, a Quechuan word meaning “everyone together”. Sonia lives in Ayacucho with her husband and three children who are all in school. In her house, Sonia has a workshop for making dresses. 

She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more sewing machines, currently her machines are rented. She will also be able to buy some fabric for her workshop. She dreams of having a larger place outside of her home for a workshop. She and her husband are also saving to start their own hardware store.
texts.en:
Sonia R. R. is a member of a Community Bank called Llapanchik, a Quechuan word meaning “everyone together”. Sonia lives in Ayacucho with her husband and three children who are all in school. In her house, Sonia has a workshop for making dresses.

She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more sewing machines, currently her machines are rented. She will also be able to buy some fabric for her workshop. She dreams of having a larger place outside of her home for a workshop. She and her husband are also saving to start their own hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan of 2000 soles to purchase more sewing machines, currently her machines are rented.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz B. D. L. C. is a member of community bank, Llapanchik, a Quechuan word meaning, “everyone together”. Mariz Luz lives with her husband and their 4 year old son in Ayacucho. Maria works daily as a shopkeeper. She currently takes cereals, grains and potatoes to the fairs to sell.

With her loan of 2000 soles she will invest into her business by purchasing more potatoes, corn, rice and wheat. She and her husband are currently saving for a car, which Maria knows will improve her business because it will make it easier to take her products to the fair.

loans.use: With her loan of 2000 soles she will invest into her business by purchasing more potatoes, corn, rice and wheat.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. L. C. J. is a member of the community bank Llapanchik, which means “everyone together” in Quechua, one of the official languages of Peru. Esther is a single mother with two adult children who are both studying at the university. Esther has her own business selling cereals and grains at the local market on Jirón Chorro in Ayacucho.

With her loan of 1000 soles she will invest in her business by purchasing wheat, cheese, and meat to sell. Currently, Esther’s dream is to put a roof on her house so she can open a store insiD. her house instead of taking her products to the fair each day.

loans.use: purchasing wheat, cheese, and meat to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 22 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años de edad. Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la zona, como la quinua, cañihua, etc.  Vende los cereales de forma ambulatoria, por la plaza de armas del distrito, ofreciendo sus productos a los transeúntes, usualmente sale a vender desde las 8 de la mañana hasta promediar las 3 de la tarde, ya que también debe ocuparse del cuidado de su pequeño hijo. Lo más difícil es tener que salir a trabajar con su pequeño, desdoblándose entre el trabajo de venta y el de mamá. El motivo del esfuerzo de esta madre es su pequeño hijo de 3 años, desea que tenga las mejores oportunidades de alcanzar un futuro mejor. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más de sus cereales, aumentando así sus ingresos económicos.  En el futuro, Maribel quiere tener una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que pueda administrar desde su casa.
texts.en:
Maribel is 22 years old, she is a single mother with a 3 year old son. For 6 years she has been buying and selling local grains, like quinoa and cañihua (which is a similar grain to quinoa local to the region), etc. She sells these grains around the 'plaza de armas', a square in the district, offering her products to passers-by. She normally goes out to sell at 8am until 3pm, as she must also look after her young son. The most difficult thing is going out to work with her son, as she must divide herself between being a saleswoman and a Mum. The motive for this Mum's hard work is her young 3 year old son, as she wants him to have the best opportunities to have a better future. With the loan she will buy more grains, thereby increasing her income. In the future, Maribel wants to have a small grocery store that she can look after from home.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of grains that she sells/Incrementar la cantidad de cereales que vende.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 29 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conviviente y progenitora de 03 hijos  (01 mujer de 11 años y 02 varones de 09, 06 años de edad). Vive en la Mz. C, Lt 14 (a la altura del Jr, Arica a 13 cuadras), del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Ella integra 04 años el Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”- Yunguyo, a los 02 años de edad quedó huérfana de padre, solo su madre la apoya, desde los 14 años de edad trabajó como empleada de hogar en Yunguyo, cuando cumplió 17 años de edad tuvo su pareja, desde los 20 años  empezó a vender productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes) en el mercado de Yunguyo, hace 09 años se dedica a la venta de plastiquería (lavadores, baldes, plásticos), los que compra al mayor y vende al por menor.

Con el crédito de S/.800.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 06 cuotas, comprará 01 docena de lavadores  con S/.80.00, 01 docena de baldes con S/.80.00, 01 rollo de plástico con S/.400.00 nuevos soles.

Su meta es apoyar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and she finished primary school. She lives with her partner and three children (an 11 year old girl, a 9 year old boy, and a 6 year old boy). Maria lives in Mz. C, Lt 14 (at the top of Jr, Arica at 13 blocks), in the District and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno. Maria has been a partner in the "La Yunguyeñita" Community Bank for four years. Her father died when she was only two years old, and at age 14 she began working as a domestic servant in Yunguyo. When she turned 17 she partnered, and she's been selling groceries in the market of Yunguyo since she was 20. Maria has also been selling plastics (buckets, washers, plastics) for nine years. She buys these products wholesale and sells them individually. Maria will repay a loan of 800 soles in six installments. With the loan she'll buy a dozen washers at 80 soles each, a dozen pails at 80 soles each, and a roll of plastic for 400 soles. Her goal is to support her children so that they can grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic products

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 26 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, quienes la apoyan en todo. La muy empeñosa Violeta se dedica a la venta de comida en su pequeño local ubicado en su casa, desde hace 8 años atrás. Comienza el día preparando los desayunos que ofrecerá, atendiendo a los clientes hasta la hora de almuerzo, para de nuevo abrir aproximadamente a las 5 o 6 de la tarde, para la venta salchipapas (papas fritas con salchicha) y salchipollo (papas fritas con pollo), tiene gran cantidad de clientela que frecuenta su local, siendo la venta muy buena. Violeta trabaja para poder ser independiente y crearse un futuro lleno de esperanzas y oportunidades. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará algunas ollas y cucharones que le hacen falta, además de ingredientes para preparar sus delicias.  En el futuro, a Violeta le gustaría tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Violeta is 26 years old, is single, and lives in her parent’s house. Her parents are supportive of her in all things. The very determined Violeta has been selling food from her small restaurant, located in her house, for the past eight years. She begins her day preparing the breakfasts that she will offer, tending to the customers until lunch-time, and then opening again at 5 or 6 in the evening to sell salchipapas (fried potatoes with sausage) and salchipollo (fried potatoes with chicken). She has a large number of customers at her restaurant and sales are very good. Violeta is working so that she can be independent and create for herself a future full of hopes and opportunities. With the money from the loan she will buy some pots and large spoons that she needs, and also the ingredients to prepare her delicious foods. In the future, Violeta would like to have a large restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils and ingredients for preparing her foods.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David es soltero, tiene 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Es un joven emprendedor que se dedica a la producción de zapatos desde hace ya 6 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una profesión. Para David lo mas difícil es armar y cortar los zapatos, pero la experiencia, le ha dado la seguridad para realizar su trabajo correctamente. A pesar de esos pequeños detalles, le gusta su trabajo, le gusta sentirse útil e independiente. Este joven muchacho trabaja motivado por la oportunidad de abrirse un camino en este mundo tan competitivo. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará materiales para elaborar sus calzados y que estos queden con los resultados deseados, así ganar prestigio y convertirse en una de las mejores tiendas de zapatos de la ciudad.
texts.en:
David is single, he is 21 years old, and he lives at home with his parents. He is a young entrepreneur, dedicating his time to make shoes, a business he has been running for the past 6 years. He did not have the opportunity to continue studying for a profession. For David the hardest part is cutting the material and assembling it into shoes, but experience has given him the confidence to carry out his work in excellence. Aside from those small details, he loves his work. He loves feeling useful and independent. This young man works hard to open up an opportunity in this highly competitive world. With the funds from the loan he will purchase materials to make more shoes with desired results. He will achieve a level of prestige and then become one of the better shoe stores in the city.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 18 años, vive con su conviviente y sus dos hijas. Maria se dedica la elaboración y venta de calzado, en su casa, donde tiene un pequeño taller con su pareja, hace ya 1 año. Ambos trabajan muy duro para sacar su negocio adelante, pero siempre existen problemas para la adquisición de los materiales, que cada vez suben más de precio, a pesar de las pequeñas dificultades el negocio va bien y sigue prosperando, haciendo que arroje buenos resultados para su familia. Esta joven madre desea que sus dos hijas logren salir adelante, para ser mujeres de provecho a la sociedad. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará los materiales que le faltan para elaborar sus zapatos, lograr que sus ganancias se incrementen y su negocio crezca, para que sea una gran fábrica de elaboración de calzado, con muchos trabajadores que la impulsen hacia adelante.
texts.en:
Maria is 18 years old and lives with her boyfriend and their two daughters. Maria makes and sells shoes in her house, where she has had a small workshop with her boyfriend for one year. They both work very hard to get ahead with their business, but there are always problems with obtaining materials, which are always going up in price. Despite the small difficulties, the business is going well and continues to prosper, which is bringing good results to her family. This young mother wishes for her two daughters get ahead in life, so that they can be hardworking members of society. With the money from the loan, she will buy the materials that she needs to make her shoes. She will make sure that her earnings increase and that her business will grow so that it can be a large shoe-making factory with many workers that will propel it forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the materials necessary for making shoes.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 54 años, es natural D. un distrito llamado Vilquechico, pero resiD. en la ciudad D. Juliaca casi toda su vida (50 años), es divorciada, así que vive con sus hijos Edita D. 26, José Carlos D. 24 y Julio César D. 22.  Se dedica a la fabricación D. calzado, gracias a las enseñanzas D. sus padres que también se dedicaban a este negocio.  Empieza desD. muy temprano, cociendo, pegando y demás, para que por las tardes pueda contabilizar lo producido y entregar a las personas que hicieron los pedidos, terminando como a las 7 u 8 D. la noche.  Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es diseñar los modelos que se realizarán, pero por otro lado el trabajo D. cocido es bastante trabajoso, haciendo que esta sea la parte difícil. Juana desea que sus hijos también formen sus empresas o que alguno, en el caso que le pasara algo, se hiciera cargo del negocio. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. materiales y D. mejor calidad, para hacer D. su negocio el mejor.
texts.en:
Juana is 54 years of age and is originally from the Vilquechco district but has lived in the city of Juliaca for almost all of her life (50 years). She is divorced which is why she lives with her children Edita, a 26 year-old, José Carlos, a 24 year-old, and Julio César, a 22 year-old. She works in the making of shoes thanks to the teachings of her parents who also worked in this business. She starts very early, sewing, gluing and more so that in the afternoons she can account for what she has produced and deliver to people who have placed orders with her, ending at about 7 or 8 at night. What she most likes about her work is designing models that she will later make. On the other hand, the work of sewing is plenty tiresome, making this the hard part. Juana wants for her children to have their own business or that one, in case something happens, can take over her business. With the requested loan she will buy a greater quantity of and better quality materials to maker her business the best.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Better Quality Materials for the Making of Shoes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 39 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y madre de 04 hijos (02 mujeres de 19, 17 años y 02 varones de 14, 05 años de edad), vive en le Jr. Arica Nº 1225  del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Desde el año pasado es socia del Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”- Yunguyo. A los 20 años de edad tuvo su pareja, desde el año 2002 empezó con la venta de ropa (mantas, llicllas, polares, etc.), que lleva a la ciudad de Juliaca, que a la fecha continúa con dicho negocio, paralelo a su negocio también vende detergentes desde el año pasado.

Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 06 cuotas, comprará: 01  docena de mantas con S/.300.00, 01 docena de llicllas con S/.300.00, 10 polares con S/.100.00 y otros para ser comercializado en  la feria de Yunguyo.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y ella continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 39 years old, she completed primary school, and she is married with 4 children (2 daugthers of 19 and 17 years of age, and 2 boys aged 14 and 5 years of age). They live in Jr. Arica No. 1225 in the district and province of Yunguyo - Puno.

For the past year she has been a member of the "La Yunguyenita" community bank in Yunguyo. At the age of 20 years she was married. Since the year 2002 she has been selling clothing (jackets, sweaters, fleece etc.). She takes her products to the city of Juliaca and she continues to do so up to now. Aside from this business she has also been selling detergents since last year.

With the loan amounting to S/. 1000 neuvos soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase: 1 dozen jackets S/.300, one doze sweaters with S/.300, and 10 fleece with S/.100, and other items to resell at the fairs in Yunguyo.

Her dream is to see her children going to school and for her to keep running her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, and jackets.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene 45 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos Ricardo de 24, Irma de 22, Diana de 20, los cuales ya se encuentran trabajando, haciéndose cargo solo de su hija Marlene de 19 años, quien aún está estudiando. Se dedica a la venta de carne en un mercado muy conocido de la ciudad de Juliaca, tiene 30 años de experiencia en esta labor, ya que antes trabajaba para sus padres, pero desde hace 6 años decidió poner su negocio propio, en el cual ahora le va muy bien. Trabaja por las mañanas hasta promediar las 7 de la noche de forma ambulatoria, siendo lo más difícil soportar el frío que hace al estar sentada casi todo el día, pero lo más gratificante son las conversaciones con las colegas del costado. Margarita trabaja arduamente para brindarles a sus hijos mayores oportunidades de superación. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará algunos instrumentos que le  harán mas fácil el cortado de la carne, además de comprar mayor mercadería. En el futuro, Margarita quiere tener su propio emporio comercial.
texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years of age, is single, and lives with her children Ricardo, a 24 year-old, Irma, a 22 year-old, and Diana a 22 year-old, who now are working, leaving her responsible for her daughter Marlene, a 19 year-old, who is studying. She sells meat in a very well-known market in the city of Juliaca. She has 30 years of experience in this work, since before, she worked for her parents. 6 years ago she decided to open her own business which now is going very well. She works in the morning until, on average, 7 at night selling on the street. She feels that the most difficult part is standing the cold from sitting all day. The most gratifying part is the conversations she has with colleagues at her sides. Margarita works arduously to provide her children with the best opportunities to overcome. With the money from the loan, she will buy some tools that will make cutting meat easier and also to buy more merchandise. In the future, Margarita wants to have her own commercial emporium.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for the cutting of meat and also to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto tiene 45 años, es soltero y vive en la casa que sus padres le heredaron. Se dedica a la producción y venta de calzado desde hace 20 años. Usualmente inicia con un  tiempo para la producción de los pedidos que hicieron, después viene la etapa de la venta que mayoritariamente se realiza cada semana en la ciudad del Cuzco. Humberto siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro, trabaja en lo que le gusta, ya que desde siempre quiso tener algo propio y en este negocio le va muy bien, ahora tiene dos ayudantes, que producen las cantidades de calzado que necesitan en los pedidos. Humberto quiere en un futuro formar una familia y quisiera brindarles una buena estabilidad económica. Con el dinero que se le preste comprará materiales para elaborar sus calzados y hacer que su negocio siga creciendo y logrando mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en:
Humberto is 45 years of age, is single, and lives in a home that he inherited from his parents. He has worked in the production and sale of shoes for 20 years. Usually he start with time to produce the orders people have placed with him. Later comes the period of sale that he mostly does each week in the city of Cuzco. Humberto always has a smile on his face. He works with pleasure since he always wanted to have something of his own and he is doing well in this work. Now he has two helpers who produce the quantities of shoes that they need for the orders. In the future, Humberto wants to have a family and he would like to provide them with economic stability. With the money that you loan him, he will buy materials to make shoes and to make his business continue growing and earning greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Materials for the Making of Shoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, tiene 43 años, es divorciada y vive con su hijo Yohan de 17 años, el cual es estudiante. Se dedica a la compra y venta de lana, cueros y otros, para poder mantener a su hijo el cual requiere de materiales para sus estudios. Tras el divorcio de su pareja, se ha dedicado mucho más a su trabajo, el cual quiere sacar adelante, es así que empieza desde muy temprano separando la lana, y poniéndola en costales para su próxima venta, su trabajo no tiene un horario fijo, ya que recibe pedidos y también sale a venderlos por su cuenta. Le encanta su trabajo, ya que puede administrarlo sola y tomar todas las decisiones. Elena trabaja a favor de su hijo Yohan, para que pueda superarse en el futuro. Con el dinero que se le facilitará comprará más lana para generar más ingresos y convertir su negocio en el más importante de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Elena is a native of the city of Juliaca. She is 43 years old, divorced, and lives with her 17-year-old son, Yohan, who is a student. She buys and sells wool, leather and other goods for a living in order to be able to support her son, who needs materials for school. Ever since her divorce, she has dedicated herself even more to her work, which she wants to move forward. She starts early in the morning separating the wool and putting it into sacks to be sold. She does not have a fixed work schedule because she receives orders and also goes out to sell her products on her own. She loves her job because she can manage it by herself and make all the decisions. Elena works for the benefit of her son, Yohan, so that he can better himself in the future. With this loan, she will purchase more wool in order to increase her profits and turn her business into the most important one in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of wool that she sells

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 45 años, vive al lado de sus hijos Miguel Ángel de 24, Tania de 21 y Katherine de 6, los cuales son estudiantes. Empieza su rutina diaria a las 8 de la mañana aproximadamente y termina hasta que se oculta el sol, trabaja mucho para lograr buenos ingresos económicos para su familia. Su pequeño puesto está ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ofrece artefactos electrodomésticos como DVDs , televisores, radios, etc., se viene dedicando a este negocio desde hace 8 años, gustándole mucho su trabajo y no encontrándole mayor problema en realizarlo. Delia quiere que sus hijos sean los mejores en los estudios, ya que de eso dependerá su futuro económico. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más artefactos y arreglará su stand para brindar una mejor acogida a los clientes. En el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda muy grande de venta de artefactos electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Delia is 45 years old and she lives with her children Miguel Angel (24 years old), Tania (aged 21 years old), and Katherine (aged 6 years old). They are all attending school. She starts her daily routine at 8 a.m. and she works until sundown. She works hard to earn enough money for her family. Her little stand is located in one of the markets in the city of Juliaca. She sells home electronics such as DVDs, TVs, radios etc. She has been running this business for the past 8 years. She loves her work and she finds no real difficulties in running the business. Delia wants for her children to be the best in their studies, especially because this will dictate their financial future. With the funds that she is requesting she will purchase more products and she will remodel her stand to provide a more inviting experience for her clients. In the future she would like to have a larger store to sell even more home electronics.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electronics for resall to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 20 años, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado. Es natural de la zona llamada Yllalli, reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 2 meses, consiguiendo un trabajo para cuidar y vender en un stand de carteras y adornos de escritorio. El negocio que atiende Elizabeth queda en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad, por ello puede lograr buenos ingresos vendiendo las carteras. Usualmente abre desde las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 7 u 8 de la noche, deteniéndose solo para almorzar.
Le gusta su trabajo, porque como a toda joven le gustan las carteras, por otra parte, el tener que atender casi todo el día la canse mucho, terminando agotada. Esta joven trabaja mucho para mejorar su situación económica  y tener mayores oportunidades de crecer. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere asociarse con la dueña del local, comprando algunas cosas que ella pueda vender y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro, le gustaría tener su negocio propio de ropa o  venta de comestibles.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 20 years old and she lives alone in a rented room. She is originally from a region called Yllalli. She has lived in the city of Juliaca for the past 2 months after she secured a job attending to a stand selling purses and office supplies. The business that is attended by Elizabeth is located in one of most popular markets in the city, which is why she can generate a good income selling purses. Usually she starts at 8 o'clock in the morning and she finishes around 7 or 8 at night, only taking a break at lunch time.

She loves her job because like all young people she loves purses, but on the other hand, having to work almost the entire day is very tiring and she ends her days exhausted. This young woman works hard to improve her financial situation and to secure better opportunities to advance. With the funds from this loan she wishes to partner with the owner of the stand, purchasing some items that she will be able to sell as well, and improve her income. In the future she will like to have her own business selling clothing or selling foods.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to partner with her employer.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma es natural del pueblo de Chuchito, tiene 45 años y vive con sus hijos Nélida de 22, Ivan de 17 y Yesica de 8. Se dedica a la venta de licores, los cuales trae desde otras ciudades, esta labor la realiza hace 20 años, tiempo en el que le ha ido muy bien y sigue prosperando. A Irma le gusta la venta de Licores, ya que son muy consumidos en la ciudad y casi siempre vende toda su mercadería, lo dificultoso está, en transportar los licores, ya que a veces por el movimiento de los carros las botellas resultan quebradas. Irma sabe que si sigue trabajando podrá brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará licores y viajará a adquirir más, En el futuro, quiere tener una gran tienda con productos de las mejores marcas.
texts.en:
Irma is from the town of Chuchito. She is 45 years of age and lives with her children Nélida, a 22 year-old, Ivan, a 17 year-old, and Yesica, an 8 year-old. She works in the sale of liquor which she brings from other cities. She has done this work for 20 years, time in which she has done well and continues prospering. Irma likes the sale of liquor now that it is highly consumed in the city and she almost always sells all of her merchandise. What is difficult is transporting the liquor as sometimes, with the movement of the vehicles, bottles end up breaking. Irma knows that she will continue working to be able to provide her children with the best opportunities. With the money from this loan she will buy liquor and will travel to acquire more. In the future, she wants to have a large shop with products of the best brands.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of liquor that she sells.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 33 años, es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, Wendi de 8 y Juan de 3. Es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace 15 años se ha venido  dedicando al negocio de la venta de ropa, y ahora con mucho más empeño, ya que tiene que mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos. Por las mañanas, empieza la venta a las 8, y atiende hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche, haciendo que el ambiente frígido haga que Lucy deba permanecer abrigada todo el tiempo, causándole cierta incomodidad, por otro lado su trabajo le causa gran satisfacción, ya que le gusta utilizar la persuasión y convencer a los clientes de llevar las prendas que les ofrece. Esta madre trabaja con mucho empeño para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere comprar más ropa y más variada para complacer el gusto de sus clientes. Lucy se ve en el futuro con una enorme tienda de ropa de muy buenas marcas.
texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years of age, is single, and lives with her two children Wendi, an 8 year-old and Juan, a 3 year old. She is from the city of Juliaca. For 15 years she has been in the business of selling clothing and she works with much more determination now that she has to support her two small children. In the mornings she starts selling at 8 and works until 6 or 7 at night. The cold environment makes it so that Lucy must stay in her coat all of the time, causing her some discomfort. But, on the other hand, her work greatly satisfies her since she likes to use her powers of persuasion and to convince her clients to wear the clothing she offers them. This mother works with much effort to get her children ahead. With the money from the loan she wants to buy more clothing and more of a variety so that she can satisfy the desires of her clients. Lucy sees herself in the future with a large clothing shop selling very good labels.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products to sell

loans.name: Thessy

texts.es: Thessy tiene 21 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus familiares. Desde muy pequeña le han gustado las artes y utilizar toda su creatividad, es por eso que desde hace 3 años, ha venido realizando adornos de todo tipo para vender, mantenerse y ayudar en los gastos familiares. Thessy es natural de la ciudad de Tacna, de donde captó algunas ideas novedosas para poner en práctica en la ciudad donde vive, lo único malo de su trabajo es que al estar sola, su producción, muchas veces no se abastece para terminar los pedidos que le hacen, pero aun así, con las cosas buenas y malas Thessy sigue trabajando con mucha fe y buena vibra. El dinero del préstamo lo empleará en comprar materiales para realizar sus adornos, para que en el futuro, su pequeño negocio se transforme en un gran stand donde pueda ofrecer toda su mercadería, de manera más estable.
texts.en:
Thessy is 21 years old, single, and lives in her family's house. Since she was very young, she has liked art and using her creativity. Because of this, beginning 3 years ago, she started making decorations of all types to sell, in an effort to support herself and help with the family's expenses. Thessy was born in Tacna, from where she captured some novel ideas to put into practice in the city in which she lives. The one downside to her work is that because she is alone her production is not enough to fill all of the orders she receives. But even so, through the good and the bad, Thessy continues working with much faith and good vibes. Thessy will use the loan to purchase material to use in the production of her decorations, so that in the future her small business transforms in a large stand where she can offer all of her merchandise, in a more stable way.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to use in the production of her decorations

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es: Carlota tiene 59 años, es natural del distrito de Moho y vive con su hija Meri, quien tiene 20 años y es estudiante en un instituto. Como toda mujer fuerte, ha sabido sobrellevar la muerte de su esposo, con su trabajo dedicándole varias horas al día en su atención. El día de Carlota empieza, desde hace ya 20 años, a las 8 de la mañana, cuando debe trasladarse hasta el mercado para abrir su pequeño puesto de venta de ropa para niños. Según Carlota, su trabajo es muy bonito, ya que siempre está en contacto con los niños, llevado por sus mamás para probarles la ropa, se le alegre el corazón con tantos niños, por otro lado el permanecer durante casi todo el día en su trabajo es agotador, pero aun así a ella le gusta dedicarse a ello ya que la distrae de su soledad. Carlota quiere que su hija Meri salga toda una profesional para que no sufra lo que ella sufrió y se le abran mayores oportunidades en la vida. Con el dinero que solicita, comprara más ropa de niños para mejorar su venta y hacer que su negocio crezca hasta convertirse en una gran tienda comercial.
texts.en:
Carlota is 59 years old and she is originally from the district of Moho, and she lives together with her daughter Meri. Meri is 20 years old and she is currently attending school. Like a strong woman would, she has been able to pull through the impact of her husband's passing, thanks to her work that takes up her attenion and many hours of her day. For the past 20 years, Carlota's days begin at 8a.m. when she travels to the market to open up her stand to sell children's clothing. According to Carlota, her work is wonderful, especially because she's always around children and their Mom trying on clothes. Her heart is filled with happiness with so many children, but on the other hand to work all day the way she does is very exhausting. But she loves her work nonetheless, taking her away from her loneliness. Carlota wants for her daughter Meri to become a professional so that she may not have to suffer all that she has gone through. She wants her to have better opportunities open up for her in life. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase more kids' clothing to improve her sales and to make her business grow, until she can open a store of her own.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the selection of children's clothing that she sells.

loans.name: Klery

texts.es: Sherly es natural de la provincia de Azángaro, convive con su pareja, Valerio de 36 años, el cual es enfermero y tienen una hija Ariane de 1 añito. Se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas fritas con sachichas) desde hace más de un año para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Cuida a su pequeña por las mañanas y por las tardes al promediarse las 5 o 6 de la noche sale a vender sus salchipapas, quedándose hasta muy tarde, ya que tiene que terminar todo lo preparado. Lo mas difícil es tener que trabajar y estar pendiente de su hija, que ya está en una etapa muy inquieta, pero lo bueno de esta actividad es que le permite ganar dinero extra al que gana su pareja para la manutención de la pequeña Ariane. Con el dinero que pide comprará más ingredientes para producir más cantidad de salchipapas, y en el futuro poner un pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Sherly is from the province of Azángaro, lives together with her partner, Valerio, who is 36 years old and is a nurse and they have a daughter Ariane who is one year of age. She has worked selling salchipapas (french fries with sausages) for more than a year to be able to help with household expenses. She cares for her small daughter in the mornings and in the afternoon until an average of 5 to 6 in the evening she goes out to sell her salchipapas, staying until very late as she has to finish everything that has been prepared. The most difficult thing is to have to work and take care of her daughter as she is at a very active age, but the good thing about this activity is that it allows her to earn extra money in addition to what her partner earns to take care of little Ariane. With the money that she is requesting she will buy more ingredients to produce a greater quantity of salchipapas and in the future start a small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and materials to make salchipapas.

loans.name: Serapia Rosalia

texts.es:
Serapia es una mujer que se ha dedicado a las ventas durante muchos años (aproximadamente 20 años). Hace un año y medio, decidió colocar una tienda, en donde ella tiene a la venta dulces, chicles, ricitos; artículos de consumo como arroz, fríjol, azúcar, consomé, jabón, gaseosas, etc; además, Serapia tiene una  venta de ropa y calzado, en donde ella se ha podido dar cuenta que la necesidad la ha llevado a innovar sus negocios.
Por tal razón, Serapia, necesita capital para poder invertir en ambos negocios, ya que por la demanda que ella tiene de sus clientes, y por la necesidad de salir adelante con su familia.
Serapia tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ha logrado darles educación, salud, vivienda, a 5 de ellos. Aún le hace falta por darle estudio a otra hija,  el mayor anhelo de Doña Serapia, es verla graduada profesionalmente, y que tenga una mejor vida que la que ella ha tenido.
Con el préstamo, ella piensa agrandar más su tienda, porque cuando los clientes que llegan a preguntar, si tiene algún producto, ella no lo tiene, y allí es donde ella se dio cuenta que necesita capital para poder invertir más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Serapia has been selling for many years (approximately 20). A year and a half ago, she decided to open a shop where she sells sweets, chewing gum; foods like rice, beans, soup, sugar, ham, sodas, and more besides. She also sells clothes and footwear, and has realized the need to be innovative in her business. For this reason, Serapia needs capital to be able to invest in both of her businesses, to meet the demands of her clients and to help her family get ahead. Serapia has 6 children, and has given them education, a home, and taken care of their well-being. She has just one daughter left to provide with an education. Serapia's greatest wish is to see her daughter graduate and have a better life than she has had. With the loan, she will extend her shop, because sometimes her clients ask for products which she does not have, and she realises that she needs capital to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in basic products for her store, and to purchase clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Doña Adriana es viuda, tiene 60 años D. edad, estudió primaria completa y es madre D. 02 hijas ambas con familia, vive en el Jr. Grau Nº 636 del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo – Puno.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca” – Yunguyo. A ún inicio obtuvo un crédito D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, con el que compró leña por mayor con todo el capital. A los 20 años D. edad formó su  hogar y con 21 años D. edad empezó con el negocio D. venta D. madera, leña a la fecha, lamentablemente su esposo falleció hace 23 años, desD. entonces ella sigue sola con su negocio, cuenta con dos trabajadores, desD. el año pasado aperturó su tienda D. abarrotes.

Con el crédito D. S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar madera con S/.1500.00 y leña con S/.1500.00 para ser comercializado al por mayor y menor.

Su sueño es dejar un capital a su hija menor para que pueda trabajar.

“Me acostumbré ir a las reuniones del Banco Comunal, porque nos encontramos con las demás socias, además nos capacitan y nos orientan”.manifestó doña Adriana muy contenta.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 60 year old widow, she completed primary school and is mother to two grown daughter who each has her own family. She lives at Jr. Grau Nº 636 in Yunguyo, Puno district and province. She is one of the founding members of the Communal Bank “Wiñay Marca” of Yunguyo. Initially she obtained a loan for S/.300.00 nuevos soles, with which she bought wool at wholesale, using the entire loan. At 20 years old she married and at 21 years old she began a business selling wood and firewood and continues selling today. Sadly her husband passed away 23 years ago, and since then she continues on with the business by herself, relying on two workers, as last year she opened her grocery store. With this loan for S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she proposes to buy wood with S/.1500.00 and firewood with S/.1500.00 to be sold at wholesale and retail. Her dream is leaving her youngest capital so that she can work. “I am used to going to the Community Bank meetings, because we meet with the other members, teach and train ourselves,” says a very content Adriana.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood and firewood at wholesale

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 31 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaria, es casada, tiene 02 hijas de 06, 04 años de edad, vive en el Jr. José Carlos Mariategui S/N, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “La Yunyuyeñita”- Yunguyo, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró: papa, chuño. Avena, para ser comercializado en las ferias de Huapaca, Huacullani. Desde los 18 años de edad se fue a la ciudad de Tacna a trabajar como empleada de hogar, a los 20 años de edad tuvo su pareja y ambos hacían negocio de productos (abarrotes), durante los últimos 04 años se dedica al negocio de productos agrícolas (papa, chuño, haba), que compra de Yunguyo, Centro Poblado de Chacachaca y vende en las ferias de Huapaca, Huacullani.

Con el crédito de S/.1200.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 06 cuotas, comprará: 10 arrobas de haba con S/.250.00, 10 arrobas de chuño con S/.350.00, 10 arrobas de avena con S/.200.00.

Su meta es tener una casa propia, aperturar su tienda de abarrotes o ferretería  y que sus hijas estudien.
texts.en:
Marleny is 31 years old, studied to the third year of high school, is married, has 2 daughters of 6 and 4 years of age, lives at Jr. José Carlos Mariategui S/N, of the District and Province of Yunguyo – Puno. She is a member of “La Yunyuyeñita” Communal Bank in Yunguyo and with her first loan of S/. 300.00 new soles she bought: potatoes, chuño (freeze dried potato) and oatmeal to be sold at the markets of Huapaca, Huacullani. When she was 18 years old she went to the city of Tacna to work as a domestic employee and at 20 years of age she and her partner both had businesses selling products (groceries). In the last 4 years she has worked selling agricultural products (papa, chuño, fava beans), which she buys in Yunguyo, the populated area of Chacachaca and sells in the markets of Huapaca, Huacullani. With the loan of S/.1200.00 new soles, which she will pay in 6 installments, she will buy: 10 sacks of fava beans with S/.250.00, 10 sacks of chuño with S/.350.00, 10 sacks of oatmeal with S/.200.00. Her goals are to have her own home, to open her grocery or hardware store and that her daughters are educated.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fava bean, freeze dried potatoes, oatmeal (agricultural products).

loans.name: Maritza Dalila

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, todos ya mayores (con familia) termino sus estudios superiores y trabaja en el Hospital de Ilave, vive en el Jr. Pumacahua Nº 184 – Puno.

Hace 01 año es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”- Ilave, con el primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró mas mercadería para su negocio de artesanía, y así mejorar sus ingresos. Ella  cuenta  que desde los 43 años de edad compra y vende bordados en bayeta para enviarlos al  Cusco. Debido a la competencia,  inició hace 04 meses con el negocio de compra y venta de quesos, estos productos los vende en las Pizzerías de la misma ciudad donde lleva también su artesanía, Actualmente se dedica a ambos negocios.

Con el crédito que solicitara de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles que pagará en 03 cuotas, comprará mas quesos  en Juliaca para viajar al lugar antes mencionado.

“Es de gran ayuda el préstamo que nos brindan para nuestros negocios” manifiesta muy contenta, Maritza.

 Su visión  para el futuro es vivir con comodidad y asegurar su vejez
texts.en:
Maritza is 47 years of age, is married and is the mother of 3 children, all of them older (with families). She finished her secondary education, works at the hospital in Ilave and lives at Jr. Pumacahua Nº 184 – Puno. Since a year ago she has been a member of the “San Miguel”- Ilave Communal Bank. With the first loan of S/. 500.00 new soles she bought more merchandise for her craft business and through this improve her income. She tells that since she was 43 years of age she has bought and sold embroideries on wool cloth to send them to Cusco. Due to this ability, 4 months ago she started with a business buying and selling cheeses, products which she sells to pizzerias in the same city where she also brings her crafts. Currently she works on both businesses. With the loan that she is applying for of S/. 1200.00 new soles which she will repay in 3 installments, she will buy more cheeses in Juliaca to travel to the place mentioned previously. “The loan that you provide us is of great help for our businesses” Maritza expresses very happily. Her vision for the future is to live comfortably and secure her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses wholesale.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Doña Honorata tiene 62 años de edad, estudió cuarto año de secundaria, es conviviente  y madre de 02 hijos varones de 27 y 23 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 543 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo, desde el año 2001, con el crédito inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró: azúcar, arroz, verduras para cocinar en su restaurante. A los a los 30 años de edad trabajó en su salón de belleza, durante 08 años y en 1994 aperturó su restaurante que a la fecha atiende.

Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará: 02 bolsas de arroz con S/.290.00, 02 bolsas de azúcar con S/. 152.00, 02 quintales de papa con S/.120.00  y  con el saldo comprará verduras y carne.

Su sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Puno y que su hijo menor termine sus estudios superiores (estudia en Bolivia).

“El Banco Comunal es muy bueno porque las señoras son puntuales en el pago y asisten a la hora exacta y no tenemos problemas” dijo muy contenta doña Honorata.
texts.en:
Honorata is 62 years of age, studied up to the fourth year of secondary school, lives with her partner and is the mother of two sons ages 27 and 23. She lives at Jr. Bolognesi Nº 543 of the District and Province of Yunguyo – Puno. She has been amember of the Communal Bank “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo since the year 2001. With the initial loan of S/.300.00 new soles she bought: sugar, rice, vegetables to cook in her restaurant. At 30 years of age she worked in a beauty salon for 8 years and in 1994 she opened her restaurant which she has to date. With the laon of S/.1000.00 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 installmente, she will buy: 2 bags of rice with S/.290.00, 2 bags of sugar with S/. 152.00, 2 100 lb. pages of potatoes with S/.120.00 and with the remainder she will buy vegetables and meat. Her dream is to buy a house in the city of Puno and that her younger son finish his higher education (he studies in Bolivia). “The Communal Bank is very good with the women are punctual with payments, arrive on time and we do not have any problems" Honorata said very contently.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials (vegetables, meats, potatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 35 años de edad, estudió superior universitario, es casada, progenitora de 02 hijos varones de 10, 04 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 630 del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo, con su crédito inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles aumentó a su capital y compró: 01 fotocopiadora. Desde los 13 años de edad empezó a vender ropa para niños y a la edad de 25 años tuvo su pareja. En la actualidad tiene una tienda de celulares y accesorios, a su vez cuenta con un locutorio, una librería.  

Con el préstamo que solicitará de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles,  que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará celulares de diferentes marcas y precios desde S/.69.00 hasta S/.1900.00, ella hace pedido a las distribuidoras de la ciudad de Puno.

Su visión es tener tiendas sucursales en los Departamento de  Tacna, Arequipa y que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 35 years old and she went to university. She is married and she is the mother of two sons, aged 10 and 4 years old. They lie in Jr. Bolognesi No. 630 in the district and province of Yunguyo – Puno.

She is a founding member of the community bank "Winay Marca" in Yunguyo. With the initial loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she replenished her capital and purchase a photocopier. When she was 13 years old she started selling children's clothing. When she was 25 years old she got married. Currently she runs a store selling cellular phones and their accessories. In the store she also has a public phone and a book store.

With the loan is requesting, amounting to S/.1000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase more cellular phones of different makes and prices, starting from S/.60 up to S/.1900. She places an order to the distributers in the city of Puno.

Her dream is to have various franchise locations in the region of Tacna, and Arequipa. And she wants to see her children go to school and become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cellular phones wholesale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Carmen tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió quinto D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. 03 hijos (01 con familia y 02 solteros), vive en la Av. Ejercito Nº 578 del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo – Puno.

DesD. el año 2003 integra  el Banco Comunal “Wiñay Marca”- Yunguyo. A la edad D. 37 años empezó hacer negocio D. plastiqueria  a la fecha, venD. en su puesto que tiene en el mercado D. Yunguyo.

Con el crédito D. S/.2000.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, tiene presupuestado comprar: 02 paquetes D. lavadores con S/.660.00, 01 paquete D. baldes con  S/.200.00 y otros (plastiquerias).

Su meta es tener una tienda granD. D. plastiquerias (surtido) y  su hija menor termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carmen is 57 years old and she attended school up to graD. 11. She is married and she has 3 children (one still lives with the family, and the two others are independent). She lives in Av. Ejercity No. 578 in the district and province of Yunguyo - Puno.

Since the year 2003 she has been a member of the community bank "Winay Marca" in Yunguyo. When she was 37 years old she started selling plastic products, and she continues to carry on this business. She sells from her stand in the market of Yunguyo.

With the loan of S/.2000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 2 packs of washers (costing S/.660), 1 pack of pails (costing S/.200) and other plastic items.

Her goal is to have a large store to sell her plastic products (bearing a wiD. variety) and she dreams of seeing smallest daughter complete her schooling.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic products.

loans.name: Magaly Maybbe

texts.es:
Magaly es soltera tiene 26 años de edad, actualmente estudia en la Universidad Nacional del Altiplano de Puno, es madre de una niña de 02 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Pumacahua Nº  184- Puno.

Es nueva integrante del Banco Comunal  “San Miguel” – Ilave. Ella hace 01 año se dedica a la venta  de productos de belleza de la línea NATURA  y lencería por catalogo de la línea LEONISA, Para incrementar su capital  solicitara el préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  que pagara en 03 cuotas, el cual invertirá en la compra de productos ya mencionados.

Su visión es ampliar su negocio vendiendo más productos y apoyar a su hija para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Magaly is single, is 26 years old, currently studies at the National University of the Altiplano of Puno, is the mother of a 2 year old daughter and lives at Jr. Pumacahua Nº 184 - Puno. She is a new member of the Communal Bank “San Miguel” in Ilave. For the past year she has worked selling beauty products of the Natura line and lingerie by catalog from the Leonisa line. To increase her working capital she is requesting a loan of S/. 500.00 new soles to be paid in 3 installments, which she will invest in the purchase of the aforementioned products. Her vision is to expand her business selling more and more products and supporting her daughter so that she becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Aldo Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Aldo tiene 32 años de edad, casado y habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Venezuela, su actividad es un cyber de café que lo tiene ubicado en su casa, con tres años de experiencia lo cual hasta ahora ha sobresalido adelante, solo cuando hay apagones de luz pues le va mal ya que no tiene el servicio y cuando lo hace con la planta eléctrico se le eleva el consumo de energía. Inicio con ahorro que trajo de Panamá donde trabajaba en una empresa procesadora de café colombiano. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de computadoras y así elevar la oferta a sus clientes y obtener mayor utilidades. A futuro es hacer una barra en el cyber y mantener el café a granel con la maquina tostadora y procesadora  todo integrado, Y hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Aldo is 32 years old, he is married and he lives in a region of the capital city of Managua called Villa Venezuela. His occupation is running a cyber cafe located in his home. With three years' experience he has seen great success until now. Only when there are blackouts is when he sees problems because he cannot run his services without the generator, which is very taxing on their energy reserves. He started out with some savings he put away from when he worked in Panama in a columbian coffee processing plant. With the loan he requests he will invest into his business through the purchase of computers. He will then be able to provide more to his clients and obtain a greater income. IN the future he hopes to set up a coffee shop in his cyber cafe, complete with roasting and processing equipment. He also wants to remodel his home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computers.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: EL SEÑOR JULIO CESAR  LABORA PARA UNA EMPRESA MUY CONOCIDA DE REFRESCOS, EL HA DEMOSTRADO DENTRO DE SU TRABAJO  QUE ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE Y DEDICADA ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA LA AMPLIACION DE SU VIVIENDA TENIENDO MAS COMODIDAD PARA EL Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar works for a very well-known soda company, and has shown in his work that he is a very responsible and dedicated person. He is asking for this loan to extend his home in order to have more room for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home extension

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN ANTONIO ES UNA PERSONA GRANDE DE EDAD AL IGUAL QUE SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA MARGARITA , SON PERSONAS MUY TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES Y CON UN GRAN CORAZON.
ELLOS POCO A POCO LE HAN IDO REALIZANDO MEJORAS A SU VIVIENDA Y HOY ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COLOCACION DEL VITROPISO Y ASI LOGRAR EL PROYECTO DE TENER UN HOGAR MAS COMODO.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is an elderly person, as is his wife Margarita. They are both very hard-working, responsible, big-hearted people. Little by little they have been carrying out improvements to their home, and now they are asking for this loan to lay tiles and manage to finish their project of making their home more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lay tiles in his home.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. William habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Campo Bruce, su esposa le tiene tres hermosos hijos que tiene 2,5 y 10 años de edad, dos de ellos están estudiando la primaria, el negocio de don William es la venta de CD y ropa tiene cinco años de vender, y trabaja junto con su esposa que siempre lo ha apoyado en las ventas, inicio con dinero prestado lo cual ha podido crecer en inventario. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de mercadería variada para ofertar a su clientela.  A largo plazo  es tener un modulo de ropa lovable en un mercado que se llama oriental, donde pueda captar mucha clientela ya que es el mercado mas visitado por los Nicaragüense por sus ventas variadas de productos, también desea mejorar su casa, y ver por su familia
texts.en:
Mr. William lives in a neighborhood called Campo Bruce in the capital of Managua. He and his wife have three beautiful children, who are 2, 5, and 10 years old. Two of the children are in primary school. Mr. William has sold CDs and clothes for five years. He works with his wife, who has always supported him in his business. He began the business with borrowed money, which he has put toward expanding the inventory. This loan request will allow William to invest in purchasing a variety of merchandise to offer his clients. In the long-run, he wants to have a unit of nice clothes in a market called Oriental, where he can gain many clients. The market is visited frequently by Nicaraguans because it sells diverse products. He also wants to improve his home and look after his family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for men and women and to buy CDs

loans.name: Flor De Amancay Group

texts.es:
La asociación “flor de Amancay” pertenece al centro focal de Villa Adela y trabaja junto a Pro-Mujer hace más de un año.
Casadas en su mayoría tienen un promedio de cinco hijos cada una, en muchos casos sus parejas las abandonaron teniendo que hacerse cargo ellas solas de sus familias, es por ello que emprendieron pequeños negocios, con el fin de conseguir recursos para sus hogares.
La asociación “Flor de Amancay” se dedica al comercio en general, diversos productos son vendidos en diferentes mercados y calles de la ciudad; material escolar, plasticos, maletines, accesorios para el cabello, y otros, estos son adquiridos de mayoristas para luego ser vendidos al por menor. Este grupo necesita mayores créditos para comprar mercadería al por mayor de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias y por ende les permita generar ingresos suficientes para sustentar sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Amancay” [Amancae Flower] Association is located in the Villa Adela neighborhood and has worked with Pro-Mujer for more than a year.

Most members are married and each has an average of five children; in many cases their spouses have abandoned them, leaving them solely responsible for their families. It is because of this that they started small businesses with the goal of obtaining household income.

The Flor de Amancay Association works in different markets and streets of the city selling diverse products such as school supplies, plastics, purses and bags, hair accessories, and other items. These products are obtained from wholesalers to then be retailed. This group needs increased credit in order to buy wholesale merchandise in greater quantities and in this way have greater earnings and sufficient income to maintain their households.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased credit in order to buy wholesale merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Elena

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SONIA Y SU HIJO EL JOVEN JOEL ALBERTO LABORAN PARA UN CONOCIDO RESTAURANT DE LA CIUDAD DEMOSTRANDO QUE HAY QUE SER RESPONSABLES Y TRABAJADORES PARA SALIR ADELANTE, LA SEÑORA SONIA ELENA ES MADRE SOLTERA SOLO RECIBE EL APOYO DE SU HIJO Y JUNTOS COMO FAMILIA DESEAN REALIZAR EL PROYECTO DE COLOCARLE PROTECCIONES A PUERTAS Y VENTANAS DE SU HOGAR POR ELLO ES QUE ESTAN SOLICTANDO ESTE PRESTAMO.
texts.en:
Sonia and her son Joel Alberto work for a well-known restaurant in their city, which shows that they have needed to be responsible and hard-working in order to get ahead. Sonia Elena is a single mother and only receives support from her son. Together they would like to carry out the plan of installing security bars to the doors and windows of their home, and this is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Protecciones en puertas y ventanas.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
Azucenas,  es la denominación que adoptan 10 socias que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer . Dicha asociación es un grupo nuevo, cumpliendo así un año de trabajo responsable.
Casi todas se dedican a la comercialización de víveres y comestibles, éstos adquiridos al mayor para su respectiva venta al por menor y generalmente sus ventas la realizan de forma ambulante. Ellas requieren capital para comprar estos productos al por mayor y para alquilar tiendas en la calle Raúl Salmón, de la Ceja de El Alto, ya que es un zona netamente comercial, o en otras calles donde la venta sea segura, con lo que garantizarían mejores ingresos para sustentar a sus numerosas familias.
texts.en:
Azucenas is the name taken by 10 members working together with Pro-Mujer. This association is a new group, counting on one year of responsible work.

Almost all of the members sell groceries and foods. Most of these items are purchase in wholesale and resold and generally all of the sales are carried out door to door. They require working capital to purchase these products wholesale and to rent spaces along the street Raul Salmon in Ceja de El Atla, a commercial zone, or on other streets where sales will be steady. With these improvements they will secure better earnings to better support their large families.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As working capital to purchase products wholesale and to rent spaces.

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Rosas Blancas” pertenece a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de tres años cumpliendo con seis  ciclos de crédito, esta se encuentra en la zona de Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha cuenta con 15 socias que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto al trabajo del centro. 
Además de dedicarse al comercio, podemos afirmar que la artesanía es la actividad principal de este grupo, produciendo así, tejidos de aguayo, (tejido nativo hilado a mano) que los comercializan en la feria 16 de julios de la ciudad de El Alto y también a pedido a la tiendas artesanales de la ciudad de La Paz; otra singular actividad es la fabricación de miniaturas; desde pequeños productos de consumo hasta billetitos de distintos valores, estos son comercializados en ferias especiales, como también los venden a pedido. Necesitan de mayor capital para ampliar sus talleres y comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima de esta manera sus ganancias serian mayores, para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Rosas Blancas” [White Roses] Association has been part of the Pro-Mujer family for more than three years, fulfilling six credit cycles. The association is located in the Villa Exaltación zone of the city of El Alto. Right now there are 15 active members who have demonstrated themselves to be organized in working as a group.

In addition to selling products, we can see that craftwork is the principal activity of this group, producing 'aguayo' weavings (woven using a handspun natural fiber) that they sell in the 16 de Julio craft market in the city of El Alto, and also by order to craft stores in La Paz. Another special activity is the making miniature replicas, from very small consumer products to “billetitos” [miniature money] of various denominations. These products are sold in special craft fairs and also sold by order. The association needs more capital to expand their workshops and purchase a larger quantity of raw material. In this way their earnings will be greater as will be the economic stability of their households.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need increased capital to expand their workshops and purchase a larger quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sudantri

texts.id: Keseharian Ni Ketut Sudantri yang hidup di desa selalu dihabiskan untuk menggarap ladangnya bersama suaminya. Penghasilan dari ladang yang tersebut tidaklah mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya serta untuk menyekolahkan anaknya yang masih di bangku sekolah. Ni Ketut Sudantri juga mencoba usaha sampingan yaitu jual beli kakao kering serta memelihara babi di rumahnya. Melihat perkembangan ternak babi yang semakin pesat serta menarik untuk ditingkatkan maka Ni Ketut Sudantri mencoba menambah modal usahanya beternak babi dengan cara mengajukan pinjaman ke DINARI . Ini merupakan pinjaman pertama ke DINARI yang besarnya Rp.5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan serta untuk pelunasannya akan dilakukan pada akhir periode dengan perhitungan babi-babi peliharaannya sudah terjual. Sebagai langkah awal Ni Ketut Sudantri membeli bibit penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dengan harga Rp.350.000,- / ekor. Pinjaman ini juga digunakannya untuk membeli pakan babi selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Ni Ketut Sudantri berharap keuntungan yang diperoleh selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan bisa mencapai Rp.1000.000,- sehingga mampu dijadikan tambahan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari serta membiayai sekolah anaknya.
texts.en:
Dengan keadaan ekonomi keluarga yang pas-pasan tidak membuat Putu Oko berusaha dengan setengah-setengah dalam menghidupi keluarganya. Putu berusaha membantu suaminya yang sebagai petani dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu setiap bulannya dengan mengembangkan ternak babi di rumahnya. Ternak babi memang menjadi keseharian ibu-ibu di desanya dan Putu sendiri sudah lama menekuni beternak babi. Tetapi sekarang Putu bertekad meningkatkan usahanya ternak babinya supaya maksimal dan memberikan penghasilan yang bagus. Maka timbullah kerja sama antara Putu dengan DINARI untuk pertama kalinya dengan besar pinjaman Rp.5000.000,- dimana sistem pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman yaitu dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan. Pinjaman ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dengan harga Rp.300.000,- serta selanjutnya berencana juga membeli induk babi. Disamping itu pinjaman ini juga berguna untuk membeli persediaan pakan ternak selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Diharapkan keuntungan yang diperoleh nantinya minimal Rp.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Kerja sama dengan DINARI melalui program KIVA ini memberi harapan besar bagi Putu Oko untuk meningkatkan ekonomi keluarganya dan bisa menanggung kebutuhan kedua anaknya.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi dan pakannya

loans.name: Ni Kadek Wiastini
