texts.id: Menjadi peternak babi memang sudah ditekuni Kadek Wiastini sejak sebelum menikah karena tinggal di pedesaan kebanyakan beternak babi sudah turun-temurun dalam setiap keluarga. Meskipun suaminya sudah bekerja tetap sebagai seorang pegawai tetapi keseharian Kadek Wiastini tetap ikut berusaha baik di ladangnya maupun dengan memelihara babi di rumahnya. Sebab himpitan ekonomi terasa semakin berat saja, ditambah lagi harus menyekolahkan anaknya yang masih SMA serta menanggung seorang anaknya lagi yang belum bekerja. Melihat peluang dari beternak babi yang bisa menghasilkan keuntungan yang bagus maka Kadek ikut dalam program DINARI yang memberikan permodalan kepada para peternak babi di pedesaan. Pinjaman pertama dengan DINARI ini sebesar Rp.5000.000,- dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan dan pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman. Pinjaman ini digunakan Kadek untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi penggemukan sebagai langkah awal dalam meningkatkan populasi serta pengembangan usahanya selain memang sudah ada induk babi di kandang miliknya. Pinjaman ini juga akan digunakan untuk membeli persediaan pakan selama 5 bulan kedepan. Dengan harga bibit per ekornya Rp.350.000,- diharapkan nantinya bisa dijual minimal Rp.1.500.000,- per ekor setelah 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Keuntungan yang dicapai per bulan diharapkan berkisar Rp.200.000,- sehingga bisa menambah penghasilan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Kadek Wiastini started farming pigs even before she got married. Pig farming is a common family tradition in her village. Her husband works as a private employee, but Kadek Wiastini still works diligently in the family farm. She feels that economic condition is getting more difficult, furthermore she needs to pay high school tuition for her child. Ni Kadek Wiastini joined DINARI foundation's program and sought technical and financial help to develop her skills and productivity. She is seeking $500 6-month loan that she plans to use to purchase 4 fattening piglets. She also own a breeding pig at her farm. She will also use the loan to purchase feeds for the next 5 months. Each piglet costs $35, and she hopes that it can be sold for $150 when mature. She hopes the additional $20 projected profit can be used to increase her family's income.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Ni Putu Oka Sumawartini

texts.id: Dengan keadaan ekonomi keluarga yang pas-pasan tidak membuat Putu Oko berusaha dengan setengah-setengah dalam menghidupi keluarganya. Putu berusaha membantu suaminya yang sebagai petani dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu setiap bulannya dengan mengembangkan ternak babi di rumahnya. Ternak babi memang menjadi keseharian ibu-ibu di desanya dan Putu sendiri sudah lama menekuni beternak babi. Tetapi sekarang Putu bertekad meningkatkan usahanya ternak babinya supaya maksimal dan memberikan penghasilan yang bagus. Maka timbullah kerja sama antara Putu dengan DINARI untuk pertama kalinya dengan besar pinjaman Rp.5000.000,- dimana sistem pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman yaitu dengan jangka waktu 6 bulan. Pinjaman ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor dengan harga Rp.300.000,- serta selanjutnya berencana juga membeli induk babi. Disamping itu pinjaman ini juga berguna untuk membeli persediaan pakan ternak selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan. Diharapkan keuntungan yang diperoleh nantinya minimal Rp.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Kerja sama dengan DINARI melalui program KIVA ini memberi harapan besar bagi Putu Oko untuk meningkatkan ekonomi keluarganya dan bisa menanggung kebutuhan kedua anaknya.
texts.en:
Tough family economic situation does not make Putu Oko lose motivation. Putu tries hard in helping her husband who works as a farmer with uncertain income by farming pigs in her home. Farming pigs is very popular profession for women in her village. Putu is determined to increase her farm's productivity and increase her earnings. She is applying for $500 6-month loan from Dinari that will be used to purchase 4 piglets that cost $30 each and a breeding pig. The loan proceed will also be used to purchase 5 month feed supply. She hopes to earn at least $50 profit in the next 6 month. She is really hopeful that, DINARI's program that is supported by KIVA, can help her increase her farm's productivity and increase her earnings. So she can improve her family's financial situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets an dbreeding pigs

loans.name: Niso

texts.ru:
Абдуллоева Нисо, 1943 года рождения. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 9 лет опыта в этой деятельности. Она торгует на улице, на против центрального рынка Гисарского района. У нее в ассортименте детская одежда, начиная с младенца до школьного возраста. Это комплект детской одежды, джемпера, покрывало, полотенце,  носки, нижнее белье и т.д.. У Нисо есть мечта, увеличить товарооборот и арендовать лавку на рынке. Она постоянно обновляет свой товар, так как торгует возле дороги, и прохожие разные, и спрос на разновидность товара. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Нисо хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2500 сомони чтоб закупить носки.
texts.en:
Niso A. was born in 1943. She began her business selling children's clothing, and has been engaged in this kind of business for nine years. She trades in the street opposite the central market of Gisarski district. She sells all kinds of children's clothing, for infants to schoolage children, including jumpers, blankets, towels, socks, underwear, etc. Niso has a dream to increase her trade turnover and to rent a stall in the market. She regularly renews her stock, as she trades in the street and passers take interest in her goods, and she responds to the demands for a variety of goods. She purchases her stock from the wholesale market in Korvon. With the help of the Kiva program, Niso hopes to take a 2500 somoni loan, to buy socks.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of socks

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Алиева Малохат, 1972 года рождения. Начала свой бизнес с продажи женской одежды. У нее 10 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на центральном рынке Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент мужской и детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект мужского нижнего белья, джемпера, носки, детская обувь белье и т.д.. У Малохат есть мечта, увеличить товарооборот и получать большую прибыль Она хочет обновить свой товар и закупить сезонную одежду и обувь. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Малохат хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони чтоб закупить детскую обувь.
texts.en:
Malohat A. was born in 1972. She began her business selling women's clothing and has 10 years experience as an entrepreneur. She sells her goods at the Muboriz Gisarski district central market. She carries a wide variety of men's and children's clothing, from underwear to outerwear for babies and for school age children, as well as men's underwear, jumpers, socks, children's shoes, and children's underwear. Malohat dreams of increasing her turnover and making a big profit. She hopes to renew her stock and purchase clothing and footwear for the upcoming season. She buys her stock from the Korvon wholesale market. With the help of Kiva, Malohat hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni, in order to stock up on children's footwear.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's footwear

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Нуруллоева Халима, 1963 года рождения, она за мужем и у нее 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской обуви. У нее 7 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект одежды для младенца, джемпера, носки, спортивная одежда, шапочки и т.д.. Халимы хочет закупить сезонную одежду, куртки, ветровки и пуховики. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Халима хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони чтоб закупить детские пухавики.
texts.en:
Halima N. was born in 1963. She is married and has four children. She began her business selling children's shoes and has seven years experience as an entrepreneur. She sells her goods at the Muboriz Gisarski district market. She carries a wide variety of children's clothing for babies and school age children that includes underwear, jumpers, socks, sport clothes, caps, etc. Halima would like to stock up on clothes for the upcoming season, such as warm coats and jackets. She buys her stock at the Korvon wholesale market. With the help of Kiva, Halima hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni, in order to stock up on down coats for children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's coats

loans.name: Mrs. Ma Vanny's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma V. is the group leader of eleven people who all live in Oknha Pang village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 42-year-old widow without any children and she is a nurse in the local village.  In this business, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy medicine to sell and cure her patients.  Thus, Mrs. Ma V. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.  She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.  

Of the group, Mrs. Men S. C. did not come to take her loan, but her husband came, so he is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These three members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell and cure her patients.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo K. Y. lives in Hang Chouk village in Kampong Chhnang province, and she owns a grocery store in the local village.  Her husband, Mr. Huon Sarem, uses electricity to charge batteries for an income.  Although Mrs. Keo K. Y. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot afford to build a new house.  So, Mrs. Keo K. Y. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house for her family to live in better conditions.  She hopes to improve her conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family to live in better conditions.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Kork village in Kampong Chhnang province.  She is a widow with three children.  One is a worker while the others are attending school.  Mrs. Nem S. owns a small restaurant where she sells soup to the villagers and passengers.  

Although she and her working child have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well.  In order to improve her living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng I. was born in 1952 and she now lives in Boeng village in Takeo province. She has a small piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Bu, is a policeman who gets a small salary to support his family. Even though she and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Sieng I. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Huth

texts.en:
Mrs. Huth T. is a villager in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province, and she is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field for cultivating rice.  

On this plantation, she cannot plant right now because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds.  Thus, Mrs. Huth T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive. 

Her husband, Mr. Tak Koeurn, is an ice seller in the local village. 

Mrs. Huth T. is 51 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom help with their parents businesses while the remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Thin

texts.en:
Mr. Thin S. is a villager in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province.  He owns a 0.5-hectare field for cultivating rice in order to earn for living.  

On this plantation, he now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for rice seeds.  In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support his field.  

His wife, Mrs. Sun Cheang, is a grocer in the local market.  Mr. Thin S. is 34 years old and the father of two children who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel to support his field.

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Mr. Uy S. M. lives in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province and has a hectare of land for cultivating rice. In this agriculture, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant rice, so he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.  He will also buy fertilizers to support his field and produce a better crop. 

His wife, Mrs. Sien Seang, helps him on the plantation.  Mr. Uy S. M. is 53 years old and the father of seven children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while three others are attending the local school.  The youngest one is too young to study or work because that child is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers to support his field and produce a better crop.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun S. is a villager in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province.  He and his wife have a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living.  In this plantation, they now face a small problem because they do not have rice seeds to cultivate.  So, Mr. Sun S. is requesting a loan for this purpose, and he will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support his field.  He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions after he sells the rice he produces. 

Mr. Sun S. is 39 years old and the father of eight children, two of whom help their parents on the plantation, while another three are attending the local school.  The remaining three are too young to work or study because that they are at the ages of one, three and five years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel to support his field.

loans.name: Kreal

texts.en:
Mr. Kreal K. is a villager in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  He is a fisherman and his wife, Mrs. Nao Roeurn, is a farmer.  In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have animals to plow the rice field.  So, her husband decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers. 

Mr. Kreal K. is 35 years old and the father of four children, three of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only two years old.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field, and purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Mr. Chhang S. is a villager in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Hok Sieknai, are farmers who own a hectare of land to cultivate rice. On their plantation, they now face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy rice seeds to plant.  So, Mr. Chhang S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.  He will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his crop more productive. 

Mr. Chhang S. is 57 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a teacher while the remaining three help their parents on the plantation.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. ChE. E. was born in 1950 and she now lives in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  She is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectares of land for cultivating rice to earn a living.  In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have any animals to plow the rice field.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer to plow the field.  With the rest of the loan, she will purchase rice seeds and fertilizers in order to cultivate rice. 

Mrs. ChE. E. is a 58-year-old widow with a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the field, and purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sum T. is farmer in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  She has 2-hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living.  On this plantation, she now faces an obstacle because of infertile soil.  To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sum T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and fuel.  

Mrs. Sum T. is a 45-year-old widow with a child who owns a small grocery store in the local market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Mrs. Hin C. is a villager in Preak Russey village in Kandal province.  She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land for cultivating rice to earn a living.  On this plantation, she now has a problem because her field is infertile, which is affecting her crop badly.  In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to protect against all kinds of insects. 

Her husband, Mr. Pey Chamrouen, is a fisherman.  Mrs. Hin C. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive and pesticides to protect against all kinds of insects.

loans.name: Kasenyanku Women's Group

texts.en:
Protazio (Paul) Z. is 38 tears old and has been a member of the Kasenyanku Women’s Group in Mpigi for 6 years. Married with 16 children, 10 of whom are in school, he also takes care of four orphans belonging to his late relatives.

Paul has operated a retail shop in the Katende trading center for 5 years now, selling new clothes like gomesi for ladies, trousers, shirts, dresses and skirts. He sold this same apparel in daily markets in and around Mpigi until he solicited funds to open the shop. He is happy with his business and is now asking for a loan to purchase additional inventory. Paul hopes to one day have many branches of his shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Yory

texts.en:
Mrs. Yory C. is a farmer in Doeum Pring village in Kandal province.  Since her field is far from irrigation, and she does not have any irrigation to generate water for her field, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to water her crop.  With the rest of the money, she will buy rice seeds to cultivate.  

Her husband, Mr. Kuy Cheng, is a wedding chef who is able to make a small income to support his family.  Mrs. Yory C. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom help their parents in their current business, while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pump in order to water her crop, and rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Hao

texts.en:
Mrs. Hao C. is a villager in Preak Talai village in Kandal province.  She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables.  In vegetable farming, she usually grows beans on a 0.5-hectare field, while she cultivates rice on a 1-hectare field.  

On these plantations, she now faces an obstacle because her field is infertile, which is affecting her crop badly.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field and produce a better crop. 

Mrs. Hao C. is a 44-year-old widow without any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field and produce a better crop.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Mrs. Yon C., 33, is a villager in the Ampil village in the Kandal province. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Yon is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Mo Phal, is a fisherman who now cannot go to gather fish because his boat is too old. Yon decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat in order to re-start her husband's business. With the rest of the money, she wants to buy fishnets so her husband can catch more fish and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and fishnets for her husband business.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun L., 23, is a pig breeder in the Ampil village in the Kandal province. She is the mother of two children, age one and four.  Her husband, Mr. Toem Kruoch, is a fisherman who now cannot go to gather fish because his boat is leaking and too old. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yun L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat to restart her husband's business. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fishnets so that her husband can catch more fish.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and fishnets to restart her husband's business.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en: Mr. Khem B., 29, lives in the Pour Dos village in the Kandal province. He is the father of two children who are too young to work or study. He and his wife, Mrs. Khem Da, are tailors in the local village. They now face a small problem because they do not have enough sewing machines to make clothes for their customers. So Khem decided to ask for a loan to buy one more sewing machine for this purpose. His wife is pictured because Khem was busy with his business at the time.

loans.use: To buy one more sewing machine for their business of making clothes.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon Y., 62, lives in the Chek village in the Kandal province. She is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 2-hectar field. She now faces a small problem because she does not have an animal to plow the rice field. So she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field.  She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel in order to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field; and to buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak D., 48, lives in the Chek village in the Kandal province. She is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She owns a 1.5-hectar field where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Since her plantation has a problem with plowing, she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field.  She would use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her rice field; and to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Roeurn R., 29, lives in the Chek village in the Kandal province. She is the mother of five childR., a preschooler and four who are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Nhor Dos, are farmers who have a 1.3-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn their living. They face a problem because their field is infertile, which has a bad effect on their crops. To deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help make their crops more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to help make their crops more productive.

loans.name: Twekembe Women's Group

texts.en: Sarah M. is the chairperson of Twekembe Development group in Mukono. She is married with no child but takes care of her husband's children and 5 nieces, all in school. Her retail shop and milk selling business are doing well thanks to the loans that have helped her cope with paying school fees for her beneficiaries. She has also managed to buy a plot together with her husband, and they are planning to build a house on the same plot. She still has her plans of opening up a dairy shop in Nasuuti so that her income increases tremendously; but right now, she would like to buy more goods for her retail shop once she has access to a loan.

loans.use: Sarah Mugerwa needs a loan to help with buying more sugar, bread, margarine, and cooking oil for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Muvo Women's Group

texts.en: K. Naome is the leader of Muvo women’s group in Lugazi. Along with taking care of, and paying school fees for her five children, she also looks after two of her relatives' children. Naome has a retail shop which she has maintained and expanded with the assistance of her first loan. She is requesting another loan so she can buy more products like bread, toothpaste, cooking oil and other products for her shop. By joining this lending group, she hopes that she can get a loan to help improve her business and the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy products for retail shop

loans.name: Ni Nengah Norti

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah tidak muda lagi Ni Nengah Norti masih tetap tekun dalam menjalankan usaha sebagai pengrajin anyaman. Itu semua dilakukan disaat saat pekerjaan sebagai ibu rumah tangga sudah selesai. Suaminya, I Wayan Bajra adalah seorang petani. Ia mengandalkan hasil pertanian dari kebunnya. Melalui organisasi adat yang ada didesanya, Ni Nengah Norti mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan dana pinjaman dana dari yayasan DINARI. Dari pinjaman dana ini Ni Nengah Norti dapat mengembangkan usaha kerajinannya dengan melengkapi kebutuhan bahan baku rotan yang saat ini sudah susah didapatkan. Disamping itu, harga bahan baku cukup mahal.

Berbagai macam kerajinan seperti aneka macam piring, aneka macam mangkuk, keranjang dapat dikerjakannya. Ni Nengah Norti dapat memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 30.000. s/d Rp. 40.000,- per hari. Dari usaha inilah Ni Nengah Norti dapat membantu pendapatan keluarga  dan seorang anaknya yang masih sekolah pada tingkat dasar. Harapan kedepannya usaha ini dapat berkembang sehingga dapat memperoleh penghasilan lebih meningkat.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Norti is still very diligent working as a handcrafter. She performs her business work after she is done with her household works. Her husband, I Wayan Bajra works as a farmer. Ni Nengah Norti is seeking a loan from DINARI foundation to grow her business. The loan proceed will be used to purchase raw material, whose price has been increasing lately. She makes weaved plates, bowl, basket, etc from rattan. Ni Nengah Norti earns about $3-$4 per day in profit. This business has been providing supplemental income for her family. It also helps her afford tuition for her child. She hopes to grow her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli bahan baku berupa rotan

loans.name: Balyelesa Women's Group 2

texts.en:
Clement B., 49, is the chairperson of Balyelesa Development group in Mukono. She is married with 7 children as well as caring for 6 other relatives. She has three businesses: growing maize and beans both for sale and home consumption, making yoghurt and selling milk for over 10 years.

She is not regretting joining her group. She has achieved more than she had ever imagined using loans and she is so grateful. Her children have gone to school, she is able to put food on her family table, treat her children in case of illnesses as well as save and repay her loans. She is developing a more loyal customer base with her quality yoghurt and now needs a loan to help buy more labels for her packaging.

loans.use: Buy more labelled packaging materials for her yoghurt.

loans.name: Jero Taman

texts.id:
Kegiatan beternak Babi pada awalnya hanyalah membantu pendapatan suaminya. Setelah berjalan sekian tahun dan mendapatkan keuntungan yang menjanjikan, Maka Jero Taman mencoba untuk mencoba memelihara babi secara serius. Karena sudah mempunyai induk, maka Jero Taman mengembangkan ternaknya akan dipelihara secara penggemukan dengan tujuan nantinya dapat keuntungan lebih banyak lagi.

Impiannya  dapat terwujud setelah Jero Taman mendapat dana pinjaman dari Lembaga  adat yang ada didesanya dan lembaga tersebut merupakan lembaga binaan dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipakai untuk membeli tiga ekor bibit babi yang akan dipelihara selama 4 bulan dan pakan. Jero Taman memperoleh  pembinaan dan training tentang kesehatan ternak babinya yang dilakukan secara berkala dari Yayasan DINARI. Keuntungan yang diperoleh selama  4 bulan  dapat mencapai Rp. 1.200.000,- dari hasil beternaknya Jero Taman dapat memperoleh pendapatan tambahan selain dari  pendapatan suaminya.
texts.en:
Jero Taman started farming pigs to help her husband by earning supplemental income. After several years with good results, Jero Taman is becoming more and more serious in this business. Jero Taman owns a breeding pig, so she is expanding her piglet fattening business to increase her profit. She dreams that she can obtain financial and technical assistance from DINARI. She will use the fund to purchase 3 piglets, that will be fattened for 4 months, and feeds. Jero Taman obtains training on pigs health from DINARI foundation. She can earn $120 profit in 4 months after the piglets mature. She hopes to obtain additional income from the farm.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sueri

texts.id:
Diusia yang sudah tidak muda lagi Ni Nengah Sueri saat ini tinggal dirumah sendirian. Anak-anaknya sudah semua menikah, namun ada beberapa anaknya yang sudah menikah masih tinggal dalam satu area namun sudah membuat rumah sendiri.Walaupun hanya tingga sendirian Ni Nengah Sueri tidak kesepian karena anaknya masih ada yang tinggal disebelah rumahnya. Usaha yang yang ditekuni sejak lama yaitu Usaha Warung. Warung dibuka didepan rumahnya sehingga dalam sehari-hari Ni Nengah Sueri dapat melakukan pekerjaan dirumahnya.Warung dibuka sejak  pukul 07.00 pagi  s/d 07.00 malam. Barang – barang yang dijual adalah barang yang sering diperlukan oleh masyarakat sekitar seperti beras, minyak, aneka macam makanan ringan, sabun cuci, sabun mandi, dll.

Ni Nengah Sueri berencana untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Untuk mengatasi modal usahanya dalam usahanya, Ni Nengah Sueri mendapat kepercayaan dan mendapatkan  pinjaman dana dari Lembaga adat yang ada didesanya yang sudah menjadi binaan Yayasan Dinari. Dengan adanya sokongan dana, Ni nengah Sueri yakin usahanya akan maju.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Sueri has been quite old, and live alone. All her children have got married, and have moved to their own home. Some are near to Ni Nengah Sueri's home, that makes her not too lonely. Ni Nengah Suari runs a grocery store. She has a booth in front of her house that starts to serve costumers from 7 am to 7 pm. She provides all stuffs that usually needed by community surround, i.e. rice, palm oil, various snacks, soaps, detergent, etc. A traditional organization in Ni Nengah Suari's village which earns assistance form DINARI, entrusted her with loan to develop her store. She is sure that by the loan, her business will grow.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital

loans.name: Balyelesa Women's Group 1

texts.en: Godfrey M. is a 24-year-old married man with 2 kids and he cares for 2 orphans belonging to his late sister. Godfrey is a farmer, has a retail shop and has a new business of brick laying. His wife manages the shop, while they work together on their plantations with the help of hired labor. All his businesses are doing well and the new loan he is seeking is to help pay labor both in his plantations and making bricks and partly to buy a few products that are missing in his shop. He is thankful for the loans because, to him, no business survives without external help and in his case a loan anytime he needs one eases his work.

loans.use: Hire labor in his farm and brick making plus stocking sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi

texts.id:
Walaupun Saat ini Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi sebagai tenaga honorer pada sekolah tingkat kanak-kanak. Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi tetap tidak meninggalkan usahanya beternak babi. Karena sudah mempunyai satu ekor induk Sri Kuntari Dewi ingin mengembangkan usaha ternak dengan memelihara anak babi untuk dipelihara secara pengemukkan dengan harapan pendapatan akan lebih besar. Semua ini dilakukan karena saat ini setelah menikah dengan I Komang Nyeneng belum dikaruniai anak maka masih belum terlalu sibuk sehingga masih dapat memelihara babi sebagai kesibukan yang dapat menghasilkan uang tambahan. 

 Melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya Sri Kuntari Dewi mendapat dana pinjaman  dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipakai untuk membeli tiga ekor bibit babi yang akan dipelihara selama 4 s/d 5 bulan. Selain mendapat dana pinajaman juga memperoleh  pembinaan dan training tentang kesehatan ternak babinya yang dilakukan secara oleh berkala dari Yayasan DINARI.Keuntungan yang diperolah selama  4 s/d bulan  dapat memcapai Rp.400.000,-dari hasil beternaknya ketut sri kuntari dewi dapat memperoleh pendapatan tambahan selain dari  pendapatan I Komang Nyeneng suaminya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi is a contracted employee in a kindergarten school. At home, she raise piglets as her side job. She has had a pig mother and wants to purchase piglets that could be raised to increase income. She has all the time to manage because even though got married with I Komang Nyeneng, they have not had any children yet. Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi earned DINARI foundation's loan through traditional organization in her village. She used the loan to purchase 3 piglets that would be raised for 4 up to 5 months. Not only loan, DINARI Foundation also gave trainings that teach i Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi to take care of the piglets, including to keep the piglets healthy. Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi could earn Rp 400,000 within 4 up to 5 months, as an additional income to support her family daily life.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Lugazi Kweyamba Women's Group

texts.en: Prossy N. is the chairperson of Lugazi Kweyamba Women, a group that was set up four years ago. She has a retail shop selling soda, juice and mineral water in Namawojjolo, a highway gathering place for selling roasted meat and chicken to passengers on the Kampala-Jinja road. Her previous loans have helped her buy more sodas, water and juice for sale and as a result, the profits have enabled her to look after her family, paying school fees for her children, repaying her loans as well as saving for her future plans. She has four children and takes care of her sister’s child. All of the children are still in primary school. She has a dream of buying another freezer that can stock more drinks. She is in need of another loan to help restock her shop with more soda, mineral water and juice.

loans.use: Prossy Nanyanzi needs to restock her shop with more soda, mineral water and juice once given a loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gavhar would like to expand her business making national head-dresses.

loans.name: Keram

texts.en: Keram is a 42 year old woman. She lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and three children. She owns a small shop for clothes near her house. She has asked for a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to pay the clothes suppliers, since they are pushing her to pay her debt from 2 months ago. She also wants to purchase the new collection in cash. This is her seventh cycle and she always pays on schedule.

loans.use: To pay her debt and purchase clothing stock

loans.name: Vukosava

texts.en:
Vukosava is 59 years old, is married, and lives in Bukovica, a village near Doboj in Bosnia. Her husband earns 400KM/month (roughly equivalent to $260USD). It is not enough to support her family, so Vukosava grows vegetables and raises cows and chickens, and sells the products at the local market.
The growing cost of food is making it difficult for Vukosava to feed her animals. She is requesting a 1000KM loan from Women for Women International to purchase feed for her cattle and chickens, so they can survive the winter.

loans.use: To buy food for her cattle and chicken, so that they survive the winter.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is 35, married, and she lives in Bukovica, a village near Doboj in Bosnia. Her husband earns 400KM/month (equivalent to roughly $260USD). Nada has three children, and this level of income is not high enough to support her family. Nada grows vegetables and raises chickens. She sells the vegetables and eggs at the local market, earning about 300KM/month (equivalent to roughly $200USD).

Nada requests a loan of 1,000KM from Women for Women International, which she will use to buy cattle. She hopes to save the additional income she earns from selling the cow`s milk and milk products, so her family has a financial reserve if it ever experiences difficult times.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Insaf

texts.en: Insaf is a 52 year old woman. She lives with her husband and their child in Saida, southern Lebanon. She sells clothes in a small shop and she wants to expand her business. Insaf has requested a loan of 600 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase school bags for her shop. She has paid back all of her previous cycles on time.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for her shop and also expand her inventory

loans.name: Najjuma Mwaijuma, Kweyamba Group

texts.en:
Mwaijuma N. is a member of Lugazi Kweyamba Women’s Group. She has a retail shop selling soda, juice, and mineral water in Namawojjolo on the Kampala - Jinja road. She employs a total of 3 boys and girls to do the running around with cold water and juice to sell to passengers in the stopped vehicles. Hence the more drinks she has, the more will be sold by her workers.

The loans have always helped her in stocking more drinks for sale, hence more profits. Mwaijuma needs a loan to buy more soda, mineral water, and juice for her shop. Her dream is to own a much bigger shop with more soda, mineral water, and juice plus other goods like sugar, maize flour, soap, salt, and many others.

loans.use: to stock her shop with more soda, mineral water, and juice for re-sale

loans.name: Hasnija

texts.en:
Hasnija was born in 1962 and she lives in a village near Doboj in Bosnia. She is married and has two adult children. Her son is employed and her daughter is studying at a local university. To support her family (and particularly her daughter`s education expenses), Hasnija works in a textile factory where she earns 500KM/month, the equivalent of roughly $330USD. She also has a vegetable garden and raises chickens seasonally for her family`s consumption.

Hasnija requests a loan for 1,000KM from Women for Women International, which she will use to buy chickens and food for chickens. She hopes to start selling chicken products at a local market to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken food.

loans.name: Jadranka

texts.en:
Jadranka was born in 1963 and she lives in Doboj, a town in Bosnia. She is married, and her husband earns 750KM/month (the equivalent of roughly $500USD) at the local train company. She has two young children, and takes care of other kids from a small daycare center in her house.

Jadranka requests a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women International. She will use part of the loan to buy children`s books and toys, in order to attract more children to her daycare center. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase a high-quality vacuum cleaner, so that she can start cleaning houses on the weekends to generate additional income. This is her first microfinance loan.

loans.use: To purchase toys and books for a daycare center, and to purchase a vacuum cleaner for maid services.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat Z. is 54 years old. Together with her husband, who is the entrepreneur, Muhabbat raised three children, all of whom are already married and independent of the parents. She has been running a drug store for 1 year, selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the city which allows her to have many clients and customers. With the help of a loan she wants to expand her business

loans.use: Muhabbat would like to expand her business and purchasing equipment for her drugstore.

loans.name: Fahima

texts.en:
Fahima is a woman who has been involved in retail shopkeeping for more than 3 years. She lives in a household of 5 members, including her husband. He was out of the country for 5 years and she couldn't support his family there and her husband helped them, but when she came to Kabul she tried to help her husband and family so she would like to expand her business.

Therefore she requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to complete her stock and further her business to help her family and make a better life in Afghanistan for all the family.

She is happy with this loan process. She plans to open a shop for her husband in the next 2 or 3 years. She would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process of small loans in this country. She would like to be a good businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To complete her stock

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said has been in agrobusiness for 6 years. He has 1 hectare of land where he grows potatoes. He has two children growing up. He hopes to get a good harvest this season and pay for his children’s education. Although it is a hard job working at the field he works there every day hoping to get a rich harvest and earn a good profit. He wants to borrow money to purchase bags for potatoes.

loans.use: Said would like to purchase bags for potatoes at his potato farm.

loans.name: Raghed

texts.en: Raghed is a 45 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their 3 children. He works as a tile polisher. Raghed has asked for a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to buy raw materials for his work such as salt and gasoline for the generator, and also to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his work and pay the school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulanya Women's Group 1

texts.en: N. Immaculate is a widow of 53 years of age who cares for 7 children and 4 grandchildren. She is a businesswoman with a bar at her home selling local brew of two kinds (waragi and kwete) that she makes herself. On top of this, she also sells beer and wines since variety brings in more income.  She also sells the excess of her home made brew to other bar owners that can not afford to make it themselves, both at wholesale and retail, and this has increased her customer base and revenue. Out of her profits, she was able to start a retail shop that mostly sells snacks and sugar, salt, cooking oil, maize flour and paraffin to her community. Right now, her life is better and keepsogetting better by the day.  She needs a loan to help with restocking her shop and buying more beers for sale.

loans.use: Namuleme Immaculate needs to buy more goods for her shop and bar.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en: Bahodur has had an agricultural business for many years. He processes seedless raisins and sells them during the winter season. He also grows wheat every year on land that he owns. He is a good client of our organization and has a good credit history. He wants to borrow money to purchase wheat seeds while they are still cheap and plans to get a good harvest next year.

loans.use: Bahodur would like to purchase wheat seeds for planting.

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru: Юсупов Шукрулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует стройматериалами  на рынке «Гулистон». Увеличить товарооборот хочет путем получения кредита , поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shukrullo U. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. For the last 15 years Shukrullo has been selling building materials at the "Guliston" market. To expand his store's inventory he wants to take out this loan. Shukurullo is planning to pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en: Mukaddas is 55 year-old widow and the loving mother of two adorable kids. Since her husband passed away she has had to provide to feed her family. Her business is livestock; she buys cattle, fattens them and then sells them. She wants to borrow money to buy more cattle and also to buy more hay for the winter season.

loans.use: Mukaddas would like to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 42 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her parents. She owns an internet café and also sells candies in her café. Sanna wants to expand her business and also develop her business by purchasing accessories like bracelets, necklaces, and earrings. She has asked for a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua. This is her fifth cycle and she always pays on schedule

loans.use: To expand her business by also selling accessories

loans.name: Ibragim

texts.en: Ibragim is 66 years old. For many years he has grown carrots on land that he owns. As he is getting older now his kids help him in their family business. They grow carrots and sell them themselves every year at the market. This way he supports his family. He need money to purchase seeds and fertilizers for the next season.

loans.use: Ibragim would like to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his carrot farm.

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulanya 2 Group

texts.en:
M. Teddy, 49, is the leader of her group and has various businesses such as having banana, beans and maize plantations, buying and selling coffee, and buying and selling small fish from her neighboring landing sites. Teddy is married with 8 children and she looks after 4 grandchildren. All her children are currently out of school, except one who is soon joining university, but she also pays school fees for her 4 grandchildren whose parents died of AIDS.

She is grateful for the loans because as a result of investing more into her businesses, she makes enough profits that help to cater for her family and pay her grandchildren’s school fees, while not forgetting to repay her loans promptly. She needs a loan to help her buy more fish for sale and partly for labor on her farm. In the photo at the front is their credit officer.

loans.use: Buy more fish for sale and hire labor on her farm.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 34-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his parents. He owns a taxi and also works as a tile polisher. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to help purchase a school bus. Fadi has been an Al Majmoua client since 2004 and he paid back all his previous loans on time.

loans.use: Fadi wants a loan to help purchase a school bus

loans.name: Musavvara

texts.en: Musavvara lives in Istaravshan and has five children. She sells men’s national skull-caps at the market. She has been in this business for 8 years. First she started by sewing them and then selling them. But now she only sells them; she has clients who sew the skull-caps and she buys from them. She wants to borrow money to expand her business. With her profit she wants to give a good education to her kids.

loans.use: Musavvara would like to purchase more national skull-caps to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Originaire de Hêvié dans le département de l'Atlantique, elle est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à NOUVOESSI Firmin, employé des travaux publics. Elle est mère de 03 enfants. Couturière de formation, elle exerce ce métier à temps partiel. Son activité principale consiste à la vente de produits (Fruits) saisonnier. Depuis 04 ans,elle s'est lancée dans la vente des fruits qu'elle achète à l'intérieur du pays et revend en gros à ses clients. Elle sollicite ce sixièmme prêt de 120000fcfa pour relever le niveau de son activité.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is 35 years old and originally from Hêvié in Atlantique County. She is married to Firmin NOUVOESSI, a public works employee. She is the mother of three children and is trained as a seamstress, a trade she practices part-time. Her main work consists of selling seasonal produce (fruit). Four years ago, she got started in selling fruit that she buys from inland areas and resell in bulk to her customers. She is requesting this sixth loan of 120,000 francs CFA to enhance her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 40 sacks of pineapples

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en: Nasrullo has six children. His wife works at a farm. But her salary is very small. So for almost 15 years Nasrullo has been buying cattle, fattening them and then selling them at the cattle market. He first started his business with a small amount of money. But now he is using money from his profit to he expand his business. He wants to borrow money to buy more hay for the winter season. This way he won’t have to sell his cattle for less during the winter season.

loans.use: Nasrullo would like to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Zulfia

texts.ru:
Салимова Зулфия, 1950 года рождения, она за мужем и у нее 5 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 8 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект одежды для младенца, нижнее белье, джемпера, носки, спортивная одежда, шапочки и т.д. Зульфия в осеннее-зимний сезон хочет закупить джемпера и спортивные костюмы. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Зульфия хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить джемпера.
texts.en:
Zulfia S. was born in 1950. She is married and has five children. She began her business selling children's clothing and has eight years experience as an entrepreneur. She sells her goods at the Muboriz Gisarski district market. She carries a wide variety of children's clothing for babies and school age children that includes underwear, jumpers, socks, sport clothes, caps, etc. Zulfia in the autumn-winter season hopes to stock up on jumpers and sport jackets. She buys her stock at the Korvon wholesale market. With the help of Kiva, Zulfia hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni, in order to stock up on jumpers.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jumpers

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Bintou D., 44 ans, veuve, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Ressortissantes Mpack depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer ses activités d’abattage de bœuf et de vente de crème glace fait à base  de pain de singe, bissap et sucre pour satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Bintou D., 44, a widow raising 4 children, has been a member of the village bank of Ressortissantes Mpack for 5 and a half years. She wants to boost her businesses slaughtering cattle and selling ice cream made with monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), hibiscus flower syrup, and sugar to satisfy the demand of her clientele and improve her living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of ice cream and slaughtering of cattle

loans.name: Husrav

texts.en: Husrav has been in agrobusiness for 8 years. He has rented 1.5 hectares of land where he grows potatoes. He has two children growing up. Although it is a hard job working at the field he works there every day hoping to get a rich harvest and a good profit. He wants to borrow money to purchase bags for potatoes and pay for labour.

loans.use: Husrav would like to purchase potato bags and pay for labour for his potato farm.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en: Bahrom is a master in baking national bread. He and his wife bake national bread and sell it at the market. As baking national bread is very hard work, Bahrom makes it and his wife sells it at the market. They have a son who studies at the university. They pay a lot of money for his studies. So to earn more money to support him they have to work hard. Bahrom wishes that some day his son will become a good specialist. He wants to borrow money to purchase more flour and ingredients for baking national bread.

loans.use: Bahrom would like to expanding his business baking national bread.

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: Âgée de 27 ans, dame D. Cathérine est originaire de Porto-Novo, la capitale politique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKONNOU Hounhoui, mécanicien automobile, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Initiée à la vente de boule de pâte de maïs bouillie (akassa) par sa mère et dans la vente de trousseaux pour bébé par sa tutrice, elle a choisit se lancer dans la vente de fruits pour son propre compte avec l'aide de son mari. Elle est une semi grossiste. Elle livre les fruits en gros ou au détail à ses différents clients. Parfois elle se transforme en ambulante pour pouvoir vite écouler sa marchandise. Elle sollicite ce sixième prêt de 120000fcfa pour une durée de 08 mois en vue de devenir grossiste. Elle compte s'approvisionner en ananas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cathérine D., 27, comes from Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. Married to Hounhoui Hounkonnou, a car mechanic, she is the mother of 2 children. Her mother taught her to make and sell maize (corn) porridge balls (akassa) and her guardian taught her to sell baby layettes, but she chose to sell fruit on her own with the help of her husband. She is presently a semi-wholesaler. She delivers fruit wholesale or retail to her various customers. At times, she does door-to-door sales so as to sell her merchandise quickly. She is requesting this, her sixth loan of 120,000 F CFA for a period of 8 months in the hopes of becoming a wholesaler. She intends to buy pineapples.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 40 sacks of pineapples

loans.name: Sadafmo

texts.en: Sadafmo is a married woman and has two children. Her husband works as a construction worker. But Sadafmo also has her own business. First she started her business by selling newspapers and journals with a small amount of 400 somoni which she borrowed from her relatives. With the profit she repaid them and started her stable business. But not long ago she also started selling toys because she analyzed that selling toys is more profitable. She wants to borrow money in order to buy more goods to sell and have more profit. And later she plans to build a small store.

loans.use: Sadafmo would like to purchase more toys to sell.

loans.name: Kiwamirembe Women's Group

texts.en: M. Mary and L. Moses are executive members of Kiwamirembe Women’s group. Mary has a business selling old clothes in daily markets locally known as mubuulo, and she is married with 5 children of whom 1 is in school and the rest are working. She needs a loan to help with buying another bale of more clothes for sale. Meanwhile, Moses is a retail shop owner in Kigombya and he needs a loan to help with buying more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, Vaseline and many others for his shop.

loans.use: Mukasa Mary needs a loan to help with buying another bale of more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en: Gairat is the loving father of four children. His wife works as a teacher in high school. But the salary is very small for teachers. So for almost 13 years Gairat has had his own business raising livestock. He buys cattle, fattens them and then sells them. He started his business with a small amount of money. He was also able to use money he made to expanded his business. He wants to borrow money to buy more hay for the winter season. This way he won't have to sell his cattle for less during winter season. Unfortunately Gairat was gone to the market to buy food when we came to take a picture. So we took a picture of his father and his wife who help him in his business.

loans.use: Gairat would like to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Юлдошева Фарида, 1976 года рождения, у нее 1 ребенок. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 8 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект одежды для младенца, нижнее белье, джемпера, носки, спортивная одежда, шапочки и т.д. Фарида в осеннее-зимний сезон хочет закупить джемпера и спортивные костюмы. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Фарида хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить детские джинсовые брюки и костюмы.
texts.en:
Farida Y. was born in 1976 and has one child. She began her business selling children's clothing and has eight years of experience as an entrepreneur. She sells at the Muboriz Gisarski district market. She has a wide variety of children's clothing for babies to school age kids that includes underwear, jumpers, socks, sport clothes, caps, etc. In the autumn-winter season, she would like to stock up on jumpers and sport suits. She buys her stock at the Korvon wholesale market. With Kiva's assistance, she hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to stock up on denim trousers and suits for children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of denim trousers and jackets

loans.name: Valijon

texts.en: Valijon is a married man who has three wonderful kids. He and his wife have their own business selling kids’ clothing and perfume. They have a constant place at the market and they have many clients. Valijon usually goes to other towns to buy more goods and his wife sells them at the market. But since everything got so expensive the money they use for business isn’t enough now. So he decided to borrow more money to buy more goods. This way he can have more profit and provide a better living to his family. Unfortunately Valijon was gone to another town to buy more goods and we took a picture of his wife who always helps him in his business.

loans.use: Valijon would like to expand his childrens' clothing business.

loans.name: Staèl

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey, sieur A. Staèl fît ses études jusqu'en Deuxième année de Sciences Juridiques à l'Université d'Abomey-Calavi du BENIN. Parallèlement à ses études, il est instituteur dans une école privée à Cotonou. Très ingénieux, il n'est pas de nature à se tourner les pouces. Outre sa profession actuelle, il commercialise divers articles tels que l'huile, l'oignon, les pagnes, etc. C'est pour consolider cette activité qu'il sollicite ce troisième prêt de 100000fcfa pour s'approvisionner en Huile et Pagnes. Marié, il a un garçon de 10 ans nommé Calliclès actuellement au CM2.
texts.en:
Coming from Abomey, Mr. Staèl A. made it all the way to second year Law studies in the Abomey-Calavi University of Benin. At the same time, he has been working as a teacher in a private school in Cotonou. Very ingenious, he is not one to twiddle his thumbs. Besides his present job, he sells various things such as oil, onions, lengths of brightly colored African cloth (pagnes), etc. He is presently requesting his third loan in the amount of 100,000 F CFA to consolidate this latter business by buying oil and "pagnes". Married, he has one son aged 10, by the name of Calliclès, who is presently in 5th grade.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 100 liters of peanut oil and three lengths of "pagne"

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en: Nazih is a 58 year old man who lives with his wife and their 3 children in Saida, southern Lebanon. Nazih owns a small shop where he sells underwear. He is a very energetic man who works 12 hours per day in order to provide a suitable life situation for his family. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase products for his shop since he wants to diversify his business.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson N. is a proud member of Kiwamirembe Women’s group and has a retail shop that has been basically running with the help of loans. His first loan was used to buy more products for his shop, and now as a result, he has been able to cater to his family’s needs as well as paying the children’s school fees. He has so far started up a fresh fruits and vegetables business for his wife, and his dream is to open up another shop for his wife to manage. He is so grateful for the loans because his well-being depends on them.

loans.use: Wilson Ntulume needs a loan to help with restocking his shop.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Pascaline B., 40 ans, mariée, 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois des Ressortissantes Mpack depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du riz, de l’huile, du lait et des produits divers et revendre dans sa boutique. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Pascaline B., age 40, is married and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Ressortissantes Mpack for two years. She wants a loan to buy rice, oil, milk, and various goods to resell in her shop. Her income enables her to improve her living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell various good at the reail level, out of her shop

loans.name: Nukra

texts.en: Nukra is the mother of three wonderful kids. She has her own business selling perfume and other small items. She has a constant place at the market and many clients. She usually goes to other towns to buy goods and sells them at the market where she lives. But since everything has been getting so expensive, the money she uses for business isn’t enough. So she decided to borrow more money to buy more goods to sell. This way she can have more profit and provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: Nukra would like to expand her perfume business.

loans.name: Thérèse Marguérite

texts.fr: Née vers 1966 à Abidjan en Côte d'Ivoire, dame Thérèse Marguérite B. est originaire d'Abomey. Elle n'a jamais été à l' école et fut placée comme domestique  pendant 10 ans à  Cotonou où elle travaillait à faire le ménage au quotidien. Puis, après son mariage , elle se mit à vendre de la farine de manioc. Elle a fini par préférer la vente de nourriture à savoir du riz, de la pâte de maïs , du haricot  et de pâte alimentaire . Elle cherche à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle  qui ne cesse de s'accroître. C'est pour se faire qu'elle sollicite troisième prêt de 150000fcfa. Elle est devenue veuve voici juste 06 mois et a 02 orphelins à sa charge: Jérémie et Sonia. Elle compte s'approvisionner en maïs, riz, huile végétale et autres.
texts.en:
Born around 1966 in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, Mrs. Thérèse Marguérite B. comes from Abomey. She never went to school and was hired out as a servant for 10 years in Cotonou, where she did daily housekeeping tasks. Then, after her marriage, she began to sell manioc flour. In the end, she found she preferred selling cooked food such as rice, maize porridge, beans, and pasta.

Mrs. B. is seeking to satisfy her ever-growing clientele. For that reason she has requested her third loan in the amount of 150,000 F CFA. She was widowed just 6 months ago and is raising 2 orphans: Jérémie et Sonia. She is intending to stock up on maize (corn), rice, vegetable oil, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of maize, 1 sack of rice, and 25 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Dezilanta's Group

texts.en: N. Dezilanta is a proud member of Kiwamirembe Women’s Group in Kigombya. She is married with 3 children and has a business selling maize and chicken mash for the poultry farmers in her locality. She also keeps around 300 egg-laying chicks and a few broilers at home to service her own customers. She is one of the founding members of her group and she started up this business after being a farmer. She is grateful for the loans from Pearl Microfinance because without them, her life and that of her family would be doomed. She is asking for another loan from Kiva through Pearl to enable her to buy and stock more maize, shells and mash for sale. In the photo, she is with N. Flo. During her free time, she makes some mats for sale and this brings in more income for her.

loans.use: Buy and stock more maize, shells and mash for her chicks and for sale.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru:
Рахматова Зухра, 1986 года рождения. У них в доме семейный бизнес. Зухра торгует на центральном рынке Гисара продуктами питания, разновидность конфет и кондитерских изделий. Кроме этого дома в месте с матерю занимаются откормом крупно-рогатого скота. В этом бизнесе у нее 4 года опыта. Она купила корову, чтоб откормить ее и продать по выгодной цене. Если корова будет продана за хорошую сумму, Зухра хочет купить дойную корову, чтоб получать от нее молока для продажи. Для покупки дойной коровы ей нужны дополнительные средства.
Зухра хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони чтоб купить корову.
texts.en:
Zuhra R. was born in 1986. Her family has a family business. Zuhra sells food products (candy and baked goods) at Gissar’s central market. In addition, she raises livestock at home together with her mother. She has 4 years of experience in this business. She bought a cow in order to fatten it up and resell it for a profitable price. If she can sell the cow for a good sum, Zuhra would like to purchase a dairy cow in order to get milk from it for sale. Zuhra needs additional resources to purchase a dairy cow. She would like to borrow 3000 somoni ($300) in order to buy a cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 26 year old man. He lives with his parents in Saida, southern Lebanon. He is a car polisher. He has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase materials for his business such as polish, oil, paints, and glass papers. This is his second cycle and he always pays on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for his business.

loans.name: Oigul

texts.en: Oigul is a loving mother of 4 children. She has her own business - livestock. She buys cattle, fattens them, and then sells them. Besides livestock, she also cooks national bread and sells it at the market. In this way she helps her husband support their family.  She wants to borrow money for buying more cattle and also for buying more hay and forage for the winter season.

loans.use: Purchasing more livestock and supplies

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Азимов Умеджон живет в городе Вахдат. Имеет магазин в центре города ,  где торгует уже 12 лет. Продает запчасти для велосипедов. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Кредит нужен в размере 1200 долларов США. Погашать кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Умеджону 34 года , женат и имеет четверых детей.
texts.en:
Umedjon A. lives in the city of Vahdat. He owns a store in the center of the city where he has been selling bicycle spare parts for the last 12 years. Umedjon wants to take out this loan to increase the variety of spare parts he can offer in his store. He estimated that a loan of 1200 US dollars will be required. Umedjon is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months. He is 34 years old, married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Cate

texts.en: Cate N. is a devoted and hard working client of Pearl Microfinance of Kasenyanku women. She is a farmer growing potato and cassava both for sale and home consumption, as well as buying from others when the season is not favorable for her. When it is harvest time, she is always a happy woman with a lot of work to do that brings in more income. For a season like this where she has less on her plantations, she needs a loan to help with buying cassava and potatoes for sale, as well as employing manpower on her farm. She is married but her husband does not care about her and her children and this is why she works so hard to take them to school and feed them, and to save for their medical care. She is determined for a bright future for her four children in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale and to pay for labor on her farm.

loans.name: Marie Cica

texts.fr: Néé le 05/06/1966 à Cotonou, elle est originaire de Ouidah. Dame G. Marie Cica n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Avec sa maman elle a commencé, alors adolescente, à vendre des boules de pâte préparée à base de maïs (communément appelée Akassa) avec du poisson frit. Il y a 7 ans elle fit un changement d'activité et se mit à vendre de la farine à base de manioc (gari), de l'arachide grillée et de cacahuètes. Ce changement d'activité est intervenu du fait de la mévente qui est devenue de plus en plus croissante avec sa précédente activité. C'est pour augmenter le capital de la nouvelle activité et mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 100000fcfa. Marié, elle est mère de quatre enfants dont seule la benjamine Sylvia est encore à sa charge.
texts.en:
Born on June 5, 1966 in Cotonou, Ms. Marie Cica G. is originally from Ouidah. She has never attended school nor learned a trade. At her mother's side, she started as an adolescent selling balls of "pâte" , commonly called "akassa" (similar to polenta made with boiled corn meal) and served with fried fish. Seven years ago, she switched her business to selling cassava flour (gari) and two types of roasted peanuts (arachide and cacahuète). This switch came about in her previous business due to an accelerating drop in sales. So, increasing the capital of her new business and better meeting customer demands are the reasons why she is requesting this third loan of 100,000 francs CFA. Ms. G. is married and the mother of four children, of whom only the youngest, Sylvia, is still in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of cassava flour and a half-sack of sugar

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en: Tohir lives with his parents. In order to support his parents he has been in the agricultural business for many years. He grows wheat every year on a land that he owns. Also he has a business of fattening cattle and selling them. He works very hard in the field and hopes to get a good harvest. He wants to borrow money for purchasing fertilizers and fuel. And also he wants to fix his house with the profit he gets from his business.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдукарим житель города Вахдат . Женат и имеет троих детей. Возраст 42 года. Занимается торговлей . Имеет магазин рядом с рынком в центре города. Торгует запчастями для автомобилей. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Он планирует завезти еще и стройматериалы. Это даст возможность привлечь новых клиентов и получить дополнительный доход. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdukarim K. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 42 years old, married and has three children. Abdukarim owns a store in the city's downtown where he has been selling automotive parts for the last 10 years. He wants to take out this loan to expand the store's inventory. Abdukarim is also planning to purchase building supplies to expand the variety of goods his store has to offer. This will help Abdukarim attract new clients and collect additional profits from the store. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en: Zainura lives in Istaravshan, is married, and has three kids. Along with her husband, she has been in the business of selling men’s shirts at the market for the past seven years. Sadly, last year there was a fire in her house and some of her goods she kept in her house were also ruined. She managed to save some of her goods and continue her business. She would like to borrow additional money to help expand her business. With the increased profits she would like to give a good education to her kids.

loans.use: Purchasing more shirts for sale

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 32-year-old man. He lives with his wife and their child in Saida, southern Lebanon. He is an auto mechanic and also a car polisher. In addition to his business, he imports cars from the USA. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to pay the importation fees. This is his second loan and he always pays on schedule.

loans.use: Hani wants a loan to pay the import fees for his additonal business

loans.name: Mgeni's Group

texts.en:
Mgeni A. B. has been selling firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00am to 4:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can expand her inventory, sell more firewood, and increase her profit.

Mgeni is 30 years old, divorced, and has four children, aged 3, 6, 12, and 14. She also cares for her two elderly parents.

Mgeni will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Sina, Mwanapili, Mwajuma, Tatu, and Miza. Each has her own small shop in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her shop.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Рахматова Дилором, 1972 года рождения, замужем и у них 2 детей. Она торгует детскими игрушками и школьными принадлежностями в магазине Детский мир Гисарского района. В этом бизнесе у нее 5 лет опыта. Ее ассортимент это детские игрущки, машинки, куколки, мячи, школьные карандаши, ручки, тетради и т.д. Покупает свой товар в потовом рынке Корвон и в магазинах Сафар-Центра. Дилором хочет увеличить ассортимент и товарооборот, чтоб получать больше прибыли. Она хочет закупить разновидность машин и кукол с двигающимся механизмом и ей нужны средства в сумме 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Dilorom R. was born in 1972, she is married and has 2 children. Dilorom sells children’s toys and school supplies at the store Children’s World, in the Gissar region. She has 5 years of experience in this business. Her product assortment includes children’s toys, cars, dolls, balls, school pencils, pens, notebooks, etc. Dilorom purchases her products at the market in Korvon and at the Safar-Center stores. Dilorom would like to increase her product assortment and inventory, in order to increase her profits. She wants to purchase an assortment of cars and dolls with moving mechanisms and she needs to borrow 3000 somoni ($900).

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cars and dolls

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Dame G. Yvette est née le 11/03/1963 à Cotonou et est originaire de Ouidah dans le département de l'Atlantique. Elle eut un bref cursus scolaire jusqu'en classe de Quatrième au Collège d'Enseignement Général de Dantokpa à Cotonou avant d'abandonner les classes suite au décès de son papa. Elle alla par la suite en apprentissage. Dans un premier temps elle apprit la couture et ce pendant  2 ans. Finalement elle opta pour la tresse  et la coiffure. Elle exerce le métier de Tresseuse Coiffeuse depuis 25 ans déjà. Parallèlement à son métier, elle vend les mèches synthétiques. Depuis 2 ans, elle a commencé par diversifier son activité en y associant la vente de bonbons et autres friandises. C'est pour le renforcement de ses activités qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 140000f pour s'approvisionner en mèches, bonbons et savons. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yvette G. was born on March 11, 1963 in Cotonou and comes from Ouidah in the Atlantic Department. She was briefly in school until fourth grade in the "Collège d'Enseignement Général" of Dantokpa in Cotonou before dropping out of school following her father's death. She then went on to learn a job. In the beginning, she learned sewing for two years. In the end, she chose braiding and hairdressing. She's been a hairdresser and braider for 25 years now. In parallel to this activity, she sells synthetic hair extensions. Two years ago, she started diversifying her activity by selling various kinds of sweets and other food products. To bolster her business, she's seeking this third loan of XOF 140'000 (ca US$ 280) to purchase hair extensions, sweets, and soaps. Married, she's the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 6 dozens of hair extensions, 21 packs of sweets, 4 packs of chewing-gum, and one box of soap.

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija has been selling perfumes and soaps in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 9:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.

Khadija is 25 years old, married, and has one 3-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Salha, Bimkubwa, Mboga, Zuhura, and Hamisa. Each has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and soaps for her business.

loans.name: Hakimjon
