Housni is a barber and owns a salon near his home. He wishes to purchase new salon supplies such as scissors and hair care products, and also wants to paint his store. Housni has requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from A. Majmoua for this purpose. This will be Housni’s first loan with A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new hair cutting tools and redecorate his salon

loans.name: Ashura's Group

texts.en:
Ashura Z. has been preparing and selling small food items in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $135 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more ingredients and increase her sales and profit. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Ashura is 38 years old, widowed, and has two children, aged 4 and 7. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members who also have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods she prepares and sells.

loans.name: Emil

texts.es: Emil tiene 21 años, vive con su madre y hermanos. Desde su niñez ha sido un apoyo económico para su familia en las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, pero hace más de 3 años decidió dedicarse enteramente a la crianza de cuyes, para lo cual habilitó, en su misma casa, un granja de tamaño regular, donde actualmente tiene alrededor de 100 cuyes, por ello es que en sus propias tierras de cultivo ha sembrado principalmente alfalfa, alimento primordial de sus animales, a fin de tenerlos saludables. Cada 2 semanas, luego de obtener el tamaño y peso deseado, los vende, es ahí cuando puede ver las ganancias de su esfuerzo. Emil trabaja movido por sus deseos de superación, en el futuro, se ve como propietario de una gran granja de cuyes. Solicita este préstamo para comprar alimento balanceado y cuyes de raza mejorada.
texts.en:
Emil, 21, lives with his mother and siblings. From childhood, he's contributed to his family's income by supporting their farming and livestock business. However, he decided more than 3 years ago to dedicate himself entirely to raising cuyes [a hamster-like animal], for which he has a skill, on the farm--a regular-sized place--where he now has around 100 cuyes. He grows alfalfa, the main food source for his animals, on the farm so that he can make sure they cuyes are strong and healthy. Every 2 weeks, when they're at the right size and weight, he sells them. That's when he can see the benefits of his efforts. For the future, he sees himself as the owner of a large cuyes farm. He's applying for this loan so that he can provide a balanced diet for his animals and better stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock and feed for livestock business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 32 años, vive con sus padres. Cada día se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y calzado, el punto de exposición de sus productos es en un salón de belleza, también les vende a sus compañeras del salón. Periódicamente viaja a la ciudad de Lima para adquirir nueva mercadería, todas las mañanas  se le encuentra vendiendo sus productos en su vitrina y por las tardes en su centro de estudios, recientemente adicionó a su venta, accesorios para damas, de los cuales también obtiene las ganancias necesarias para su sustento. Dora trabaja de esta manera porque le permite solventar los gastos de sus estudios profesionales de medicina. Con el préstamo que obtenga comprará más mercadería, porque desea seguir con esta actividad independiente, y en el futuro tener una tienda de ropa, a la vez ser una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Dora is 32 years old and lives with her parents. Everyday, she sells apparel and footwear, displaying her merchandise in a beauty salon. She also sells her merchandise to her co-workers at the beauty salon. She periodically travels to the city of Lima in order to obtain new merchandise. Every morning, you can find her selling her products from a glass display case, and in the evening, she attends school. She recently added accessories for women to her inventory, and they help her earn more profits needed to support herself. Dora works this way because it allows her to pay for her studies in medicine. With this loan, she will purchase more merchandise because she wishes to continue with her business. In the future, she would like to have her own clothing boutique while at the same time become a fine professional.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 49 year-old woman who lives in a small village in the Bekaa Valley with her parents. 

Salwa operates a sewing business and owns a small shop in town where she does alterations and clothing repairs. Salwa has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of 1000 US Dollars in order to purchase new fabrics which she will use to design her own clothing. This is the first time that Salwa will be working with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics with which she can design her own clothing to sell

loans.name: Abed

texts.en: Abed is a 30 year-old man who lives in a small village in the Bekaa Valley. Abed owns a hair salon and wants to improve his store by purchasing new hair cutting tools, new mirrors, and store decorations. For this purpose, he has requested a loan for 1000 US dollars from the Lebanese MFI, Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy new barbershop necessities and redesign his shop

loans.name: Mafunda's Group

texts.en:
Mafunda S. has been selling food in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for several years. She is now hoping to take out her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can open a new cosmetics shop. She repaid her first loan successfully and on time. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 85 each month.

Mafunda is 32 years old, married, and has two children, aged 16 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members who have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To open a cosmetics shop

loans.name: Youssif

texts.en:
Youssif is 53 years old and lives in the rural Bekaa Valley. 

Youssif is a contractor by trade and specializes in wall plastering. He needs to purchase a new supply of wooden boards, iron clips, and supporters to improve his business. He has requested a loan of 1000 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to cover the expenses. This will be Youssif’s first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his construction business

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Comité Nueva Esperanza, así se denomina el comité integrado por 21 mujeres del Asentamiento Nueva Esperanza de la Ciudad de Itá. Este grupo se conformó gracias a que la actual presidenta, Nancy S., se acercó a la asesora en una reunión que la misma tenía en la zona, para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la misma quedó muy entusiasmada y logró conformar su grupo en fecha 02 de julio del 2008 con 21 mujeres, quienes se encuentran muy contentas trabajando con este programa.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades tales como:

1) Nancy S.. Confección y venta de ropas artesanales.

2) María M.. Venta de lencerías y perfumes.

3) Mirian Chávez. Venta de frutas y verduras.

4) Elvira Álvarez. Venta de plantas.

5) Claudia Cáceres. Venta de comidas y reciclajes.

6) Rosa O.. Compra y venta de reciclajes y huesos.

7) Lorenza F.. Despensa.

8) Teresa L.. Venta de mercerías.

9) María D.. Venta de comidas.

10) Apolonia E..Venta de frutas y verduras.

11) Francisca Brítez. Venta de ropas.

12) Lidia S.. Despensa.

13) Liliana M.. Venta de zapatos.

14) Aida S.. Venta de frutas y remedios refrescantes.

15) Saturnina Benítez. Venta de carnes.

16) María Benítez. Venta de comidas.

17) María R.. Reciclajes.

18) Celsa Jiménez. Venta de frutas.

19) Yohana V.. Venta de ropas artesanales.

20) Magdalena R.. Venta de comidas.

21) Sara L.. Cría de chanchos y gallinas.

Todas las integrantes del grupo demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

Desean adquirir con sus créditos materiales para la confección de ropas artesanales, compra de materiales reciclados y huesos, compra de frutas y verduras, compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, compras de lencerías y perfumes, compra de plantas, compra de zapatos, compra de mercerías, compra de carnes, compra de ropas, compra de mercaderías para la despensa y cría de chanchos y gallinas.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) Committee is made up of 21 women of Asentamiento Nueva Esperanza in the city of Itá. This group was created because the current president Nancy S. was approached by a counselor in a meeting to find out about the Program of the Committee of Enterprising Women. Nancy was very enthusiastic and succeeded in making her group on July 2, 2008 with 21 women, who are very happy to be working with this program. The members of this group will use their loan for different activities including the following:

1. Nancy S.. To make and sell traditional clothes. 2. María M.. To sell undergarments and perfumes. 3. Mirian Chávez. To sell fruits and vegetables. 4. Elvira Álvarez. To sell plants. 5. Claudia Cáceres. To sell food and recycling. 6. Rosa O.. To buy and sell recycling and bones. 7. Lorenza F.. Larder. 8. Teresa L.. Haberdashery. 9. María D.. To sell food. 10. Apolonia E.. To sell fruits and vegetables. 11. Francisca Brítez. To sell clothes. 12. Lidia S.. Larder. 13. Liliana M.. To sell shoes. 14. Aida S.. To sell fruits and refreshing cures. 15. Saturnina Benítez. To sell meats. 16. María Benítez. To sell food. 17. María R.. Recycling. 18. Celsa Jiménez. To sell fruits. 19. Yohana V.. To sell traditional clothes. 20. Magdalena R.. To sell food. 21. Sara L.. To raise pigs and hens.

All the members of the group show companionship and solidarity. They attend weekly meetings and pursue activities to collect funds for the common good of the group. With their loans, they want to acquire materials to make traditional clothing, to buy recycled materials and bones, fruits and vegetables, ingredients to make food, undergarments and perfumes, plants, shoes, merchandise for the haberdashery, meats, clothes, merchandise for the larder, and to raise pigs and hens.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varied merchandise

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama C. est âgé de 31 ans et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son épouse et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (une préfecture de  Sikasso troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons économiques Adama C. devait rester à côté de son père pour l’aider à subvenir aux charges de la famille.  Afin de s’insérer dans la vie active( n’ayant jamais fréquenté l’école), il décida de méner une activité génératrice de revenus notamment le commerce de semences et des produits phyto-sanitaies. En plus de la vente des articles ci-dessus cités, il fait la pulverisation des jardins et des maisons. Il a appris cette activité auprès d’un oncle et cela durant deux ans.
Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires, il décide de rejoindre le programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son premier prêt.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 40 paquets (de sachets de différentes semences et 3 cartons de produits phyto-sanitaires pour la pulvarisation des maisons et des jardins.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de  la république du Mali) auprès des établissements spécialisés dans ce domaine. Avec une clientèle composée de structures étatiques et de particuliers(jardiniers et propriètaires de villas), il effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit.
La rotation de ses affaires  est  élévée et il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour agrandir son entreprise. Il ambitionne devenir un grossiste un jour.
texts.en:
Mr. Aama C. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and child in the Torakabougou district of the city of Bougouni (Sikasso prefecture, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For economic reasons, he had to remain at his father's side to help him support the family. In order to enter the working world (having never gone to school), he decided to make an income notably through commerce in seeds and pesticides. In addition to selling the items cited above, he does spraying in gardens and houses. He learned how to do this from his uncle over a two-year period. In his search for supplemental financial resources, he has decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which he is on his first loan.

With this loan, he intends to buy 40 packets (bags of different seeds) and 3 boxes of pesticides to spray houses and gardens.

He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali) from establishments specialized in this domain. With customers composed of public organizations and of individuals (gardeners and owners of villas), he makes his sales in cash or on credit. His sales figures are high, and he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which will essentially be used to expand his enterprise. His ambition is to become a wholesaler one day.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Balakissa

texts.fr:
Madame Balakissa D. est âgée de 38 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses deux enfants dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de  Bougouni (une des préfectures de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé les activités économiques notamment la restauration qu’elle a apprise  auprès de sa soeur depuis maintenant 12 ans. Madame Balakissa s’est spécialisée dans les grillades(brochette de viande) et les fritures(de pomme de terre, de banane plantin) 
Elle travaille avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans et est à son deuxième prêt indivuduel, après avoir correctement remboursé le premier.
Elle compte constituer avec ce prêt un stock important de pomme de terre et de bananes plantins. En plus journalièrement elle achetera  3 kilogrammes de viande, 1 litre d’huile alimentaire , 10 miches de pains.
Elle s’approvisionne exclusivement au marché de Bougouni. Son lieu de vente se trouve dans le  même marché où il ya une grande affluence surtout les voyageurs et  les  routiers. La nuit elle vend devant sa porte où les noctambules et les voisins viennent se régaler.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui servira à agrandir son entreprise et à aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille (santé,éducation. nourriture, etc...)
texts.en:
Mrs. Balakissa D., 38, lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her two children in the Faraba neighborhood of the town of Bougouni (one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Since her youth, she began earning money, especially in the restaurant business which she learned from her sister and has worked at for 12 years now. Mrs. Balakissa has specialized in grilled meat (brochettes) and fries (potato and plantain, a kind of banana). She has been working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for 2 years now and is on her second individual loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first.

With this loan she intends to put together significant stocks of potatoes and plantains. Moreover, she will purchase 3 kg of meat, 1 liter of cooking oil, and 10 loaves of bread daily. She does all her shopping in the market of Bougouni. Her sales venue is located in the same market where there are lots of travelers and taxi and truck drivers. In the evenings she sells in front of her door where night owls and neighbors come to regale themselves.

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA which she will use to enlarge her business and to help her husband with family expenses (health, education, food, etc.)

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for her restaurant dishes

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maimouna K. est une femme mariée de 50 ans qui est mère de 8 enfants et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative du Mali : Sikasso)
Elle s”est très tôt intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus et s’est spécialisée dans la fabrication et la vente du Dèguè ( crème de mil avec du lait) qu’elle a apprise auprès d’une  amie  dès son jeune âge. Avec une expérience de 13 ans elle maîtrise cette activité au bout des doigts et jouit d’une réputation sans pareille dans la ville de Bougouni. 
Afin de satisfare sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenat 3 ans. Après avoir bouclé trois prêts de groupe(prêt solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt elle veut constituer un stock important de mil, de sucre et de sachets et de bolles à boire. En plus elle achetera quotidiennement 20 litres de lait frais et de la glace.
Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières (mil, sucre, sachets, bolles, glaces et lait) à Bougouni auprès de vendeurs spécialisés.
Sa clientéle est composée de toutes les catégories sociales de  la population et ses ventes sont effectuées aux alentours de l’unité d’égreinage de coton de Bougouni.
Elle compte  réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  aider son époux (qui est à la rétraite) à assurer les dépenses de la famille, payer les intérêts du prêt et développer son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maimouna K., 50, is married and the mother of 8 children. She lives in a monogamous family with her spouse and children in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali: Sikasso).

Early in life she became interested in earning money and specialized in making and selling “dèguè” (crème of millet with milk) which she learned to prepare from a friend while she was young. With 13 years of experience, she has truly mastered the art of preparing this dish and has an excellent reputation in the town of Bougouni.

In order to satisfy her clientele which is getting more and more numerous, she decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. After having paid off 3 group loans (solidarity loans) with an association from her neighborhood, she is now on her second individual loan. All preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this new loan, she wants to stock up on millet, sugar, bags, and bowls to drink from. Moreover, she will buy 20 liters of fresh milk and ice daily. She buys her ingredients and materials (millet, sugar, bags, bowls, ice and milk) in Bougouni from specialized vendors. Her clientele is composed of all sorts of people and she sells in the neighborhood of the cotton gin in Bougouni.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA with this loan; she plans to use the money to help her husband (who is retired) pay family expenses, make payments on the loan, and develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of milk, millet, and sugar

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou B. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni (une des préfectures de la   troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) dans la concession paternelle avec sa maman et ses frères et soeurs.
Très tôt  Seydou B. a abandonné l’école pour mener  les activités économiques notamment l’achat et la vente de bicyclettes neufs et surtout d’occasions qu’il a appris  auprès de son cousin. 
Avec une experience de 8 ans, Monsieur Bagayogo maîtrise parfaitemenet cette activité et jouit d’une notoriété exemplaire et enviable à Bougouni. Il est beaucoup sollicité pendant les périodes de fêtes et la veille de la rentrée des classes car chaque enfant veut avoir une bicyclette.
C’est dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de son activité qu’il décida de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, 15 bicyclettes tout terrain. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la republique du Mali)
La vente de ses bicyclettes se fait au marché de Bougouni à une  clientéle composée de toutes les franches de la population.
Monsieur Seydou B. vend ses bicyclettes au comptant ou à crédit payable mensuellement. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA.qui servira essentiellement  à  agrandir son entreprise et  assurer les dépenses de la famille.  Son ambition est d’associer à ses activités autres articles tels la vente de moto d’occasions et de pièces de vehicules.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou B., 31, is married and the father of one child. He lives with his wife and his child in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni (one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) in his father’s holdings, together with his mother and his sisters and brothers.

Seydou B. left school at a young age to go out into the business world, selling in particular new bicycles and especially used ones, a business he learned from his cousin. With 8 years’ experience, Mr. Bagayogo is perfectly at home in this business and has an exemplary and enviable reputation in Bougouni. He has lots of customers during the holiday season and just before school begins, since every child wants to have a bicycle.

With a view to expanding his business, he came to Soro Yiriwaso through whom he is presently requesting his first loan. With this loan he intends to buy 15 all-terrain bikes. He does his buying in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). He sells the bicycles in the market in Bougouni to a clientele composed of all sorts of people.

Mr. Seydou B. sells his bicycles for cash, or on credit with monthly payments. He expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 F CFA which he will use to expand his business and support his family. His ambition is to add other lines to his business, for example used motorcycles and spare parts for cars.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bicycles for re-sale

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 26 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, coépouses, beaux frères, belles sœurs, enfants et autres parents dans la sous-préfecture de Fana Région de Koulikoro(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces femmes font généralement le commerce de pagnes (wax et fancy tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest) et de différentes sortes de tasses (ustensiles de cuisine, thermos, tasses galvanisées en aluminium etc.). Les tasses servent également de récipients pour les travaux domestiques mais aussi à servir la nourriture.
Ce groupe de femmes a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son cinquième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les femmes du groupe comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 100 pièces de pagnes wax et 500 tasses auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Elles effectuent leur vente dans les marchés journaliers de la ville de Fana et dans les foires hebdomadaires des localités environnantes telles Dioïla, Massigui, Beleko et N’golobougou à une clientèle essentiellement constituée de femmes et de quelques hommes. Les ventes se font surtout au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à des clients fidèles.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFAqui sera utilisé pour aider les conjoints dans les dépenses familiales et élargir la taille de leur commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are all married women with an average age of 26 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-spouses, brothers- and sisters-in-law, children and other relatives in the Sous-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region, (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women generally sell “pagnes” (lengths of brightly colored African cloth; wax-types and fancy types, much esteemed in West Africa) and various sorts of table ware (kitchen utensils, thermoses, galvanized aluminum cups etc.) These basins are used as recipients for preparing food and as table ware. This group of women decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their 5th solidarity loan (group loan). Their preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

The women intend to use this loan to buy 100 lengths of wax-type “pagne” and 500 pieces of table ware from the wholesalers at the big open-air market in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). They make their sales in the daily markets of the town of Fana and the weekly markets of surrounding localities such as Dioïla, Massigui, Beleko and N’golobougou to a clientele essentially made up of women and a few men. They mostly sell cash or sometimes on credit for trusted customers. They hope to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA each which will be used to help their spouses in supporting the family and to enlarge the size of their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and table ware

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Margarita, tiene el negocio en la zona San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia frente al una importante unidad educativa. Donde empezó vendiendo dulces de manera ambulante, su primer prestamo en EMPRENDER fué de Bs. 2000, para la comra de un punto de llamadas y  actualmete tiene tres puntos de llamadas. Es muy responsable y ayuda con los gastos de su hogar y a su vez mantiene a sus nietos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien le ayuda con los gastos familiares y en mejorar cada vez más su negocio. Aspira a acrecentar su negocio y poder comprar otro kiosko en la zona. Es una persona muy responsable, y buena cliente  de la institución. El crédito será invertido en la compra de targetas pre pago.
texts.en:
Margarita has a business in the San Pedro zone, La Paz, Bolivia in front of an important education building. She had been selling candies on the streets when she got her first loan from EMPRENDER bank of Bs. 2000 that she used to buy a pay phone and now she has three pay phones. She is very responsible, helps with the family household bills, and watches over her grandchildren with the support of her husband, who also helps with the household bills and in improving her business. She aspires to grow her business and buy another kiosk in her neighborhood. She is a very responsible person and a great client of the bank. This loan will be invested in the purchase of prepaid calling cards.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase prepaid calling cards

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba Baldé, 46 ans, mariée, 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de moutons et d’huile de palme. Les revenus  tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Coumba Baldé, 46, married and raising 8 children, has been a member of the village bank of Samba for 6 years. She wants to boost her business selling sheep and palm oil. The income from her businesss allows her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed after 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of sheep and palm oil

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Khadidiatou Baldé, 43 ans, mariée, 09 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle est couturière avec un atelier au marché et veut faire une opération Tabaski. Pour cela, il lui faut acheter des tissus (bazin, tissu soda mama, brodé coton, tissu rafetna, tissus hommes et des fournitures pour faire des draps de lit, des ensembles hommes et des ensembles de dames et vendre. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Khadidiatou Baldé, age 43, is married and has nine children in her care. She has been a member of the villlage loan group Samba 15 for six years. She is a seamstress in a shop at the marketplace and wants to do trade for Tabaski (a holiday festival). To do so, she needs to buy fabrics (damask, 'soda mama' cloth, embroidery, rafetna, fabrics for men) and supplies for making bed sheets and suits for men and for women to sell. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell clothing

loans.name: Romina Rocío

texts.es: La Señora Romina, tiene el negocio en el Mercado de comidas. La señora vive en la zona de Bajo Tacagua una zona muy pobre de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia,  vive en la casa familiar de sus padres, ya que no le alcanza el capital para poder tener una casa propia. El prestamo solicitado en EMPRENDER mediante Kiva, servirá para incrementar su capital de trabajo. En lo que respecta a su vida privada, ayuda con los gastos del hogar para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su papá quien tambien aporta a cubrir los gastos familiares y a su vez para mejorar cada vez más su negocio. Es una persona muy responsable, y tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus padres  y por quienes la conocen por la zona.
texts.en:
Romina has a business in the food market. She lives in the Bajo Tacagua neighborhood, a very poor area of La Paz, Bolivia. She lives with her parents because she has not had the money to have her own house. The loan she is requesting from Kiva’s field partner, EMPRENDER, will serve to increase her wages. In her personal life, it will help her and her father cover the household bills and grow her business. She is a very responsible person and has good references from her parents and others that know her from the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise capital

loans.name: Djita

texts.fr: Djita D., 46 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de thioub (tissus teintés). Ses revenus  lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Djita D., 46, married and raising 7 children, has been a member of the village bank of "Samba 15 ans 1" for 6 years. She wants to bolster her business selling thioub (hand-dyed cloth). Her income allows her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that wil be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of hand-dyed cloth

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile D., 44 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 3 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de produits alimentaires (miel, pâte d’arachide et pain de singe). Ses revenus  lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Odile D., age 44, is married and has been a member of the village loan group "Samba 15 ans 1" for three years. She wants to bolster her business selling food items (honey, peanut butter, and the fruit of the baobab known as monkey bread). Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell honey, peanut butter, and monkey bread

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.es:
Para comenzar describiendo al Comité Saldivar Poty debería decir que es un grupo muy organizado y activo, las integrantes cuentan con el apoyo incondicional de la Comisión.

Cuando una de las integrantes cuenta con problemas las compañeras se solidarizan realizando actividades u ofreciéndole víveres como demostración de afecto.

Todas las integrantes del grupo asisten responsablemente a las reuniones semanales ya que ellas consideran un motivo de distracción compartir una tarde realizando brindis o una simple merienda.

El grupo se destaca por el entusiasmo y la honestidad que demuestran una a otra.

Cuentan con cero días de atraso en sus pagos de créditos anteriores, desde el inicio. Se encuentran operando con la Fundación Paraguaya más de 2 años y han pasado al sexto ciclo.

Las actividades que desempeñan estas mujeres son:

1-María Esther S. – Venta de Productos de limpieza.

2-Justina L.– Venta de comidas.

3-Tomasa A. González – Venta de Comidas.

4-Rosalina Bordón S. – Venta de Ropas.

5-Gladys N. – Venta de Ropas.

6-Juana C. Peña – Venta de bijouterie

. 7-Marcelina Benítez – Confección de ropas.

8-Eutacia O. Portillo – Venta de verduras.

9-Miryan C. – Venta de comidas.

10-María Elisa Quiñónez de Cuevas – Venta de ropas.

11-Adriana A. García – Venta de panificados.

12-Nancy M. Mascareño – Venta de ropas.

13-Francisca Bordón S. – Venta de ropas.

14-Nilda U. - Peluquería.

15-Marlene B. A. – Venta de Cosméticos.

16-María Mabelin Leguizamón – Venta de ropas

17-Marcelina C. – Venta de Ropas.

El credito solicitado será invertido en la compra de verduras, compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, compra de cosméticos, compra de ropas, compra de bijouterie, compra de ingredientes para la fabricación de panificados.
texts.en:
To start describing the Saldivar Poty committee, we should say that it is a very organized and active group, and the members count on the unconditional support of the Commission.

When one of the members finds herself with problems, the partners stand together and offer support as a demonstration of affection.

All of the members of the group responsibly attend the weekly meetings now that the consider it a means of distraction to share an afternoon eating toast or a simple snack.

The group is built on the enthusiasm and the honesty which they demonstrate for one another.

They count zero days of delinquency on previous loans, from the start. They have found themselves operating with the Paraguayan Foundation for more than 2 years and have passed their sixth cycle.

The activities these women devote themselves to are:

1-María Esther S. – Selling cleaning products.

2-Justina L.– Selling food.

3-Tomasa A. González – Selling food.

4-Rosalina Bordón S. – Selling clothes.

5-Gladys N. – Selling clothes.

6-Juana C. Peña – Sale of bijouterie.

7-Marcelina Benítez – Making clothes.

8-Eutacia O. Portillo – Selling vegetables.

9-Miryan C. – Selling foods.

10-María Elisa Quiñónez de Cuevas – Selling clothes.

11-Adriana A. García – Selling baked goods.

12-Nancy M. Mascareño – Selling clothes.

13-Francisca Bordón S. – Venta de ropas.

14-Nilda U. -Salon.

15-Marlene B. A. – Selling cosmetics.

16-María Mabelin Leguizamón – Selling clothes.

17-Marcelina C. – Selling clothes.

The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables, purchasing ingredients to prepare food, buying cosmetics, buying clothes, buying bijouterie, and buying ingredients for baked goods.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various merchandise

loans.name: Rodrigo Jaime

texts.es: El Señor Rodrigo Jaime A. es propietario de un vehiculo automotor, el cual lo empezo a trabajar como Taxi, desde que se idenpendizo de sus padres, actualmente cuenta en su vehiculo con un radio transmisor que es de propiedad de la empresa en la que trabaja, el monto solicitado lo empleara para la compra de un nuevo radio transmisor y para el mantenimiento respectivo de la movilidad, ya que el señor trabaja con empresas hoteleras y realiza el servicio de transporte a las personas extranjeras que llegan a conocer nuestro país, para llevarlos a los lugares de destino turísticos de la ciudad de La paz, Bolivia entre ellos: mallasa, tiahuanaco, el lago titicaca, zongo, y muchos otros lugares. Es un padre responsable y un buen esposo.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Jaime A. is an automobile owner and has worked as a taxi driver since he left his parents’ house. Currently, he has a radio transmitter owned by the company he works for. With this loan, he will buy a new radio transmitter to maintain his mobility while he works with hotels offering transportation services to tourists visiting his country. He takes them to tourist destinations near La Paz, Bolivia including Mallasa, Tiahuanaco, Lake Titicaca, Zongo, and many more places. He is a responsible father and a good husband.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase radio equipment and maintain his car

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou K., 51 ans, mariée, 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba. Elle veut acheter et revendre des thioub (tissus teintés) et de l’huile de palme pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus  lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Astou K. is 51 years old, married and is responsible for 7 children. She is a member of the village bank Samba.

She wants to buy and resell thioub (hand-dyed cloth) and palm oil to strengthen her business. Her income allow her to help with the family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid at the end of six months in one single repayment. 

 Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of hand-dyed cloth, and palm oil.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna S., 52 ans, mariée avec 01 enfant et 01autre petit garçon à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente d’huile de palme, de poisson sec et  de poisson fumé. Maimouna participe aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna S., 52, married with one child and one other little boy for whom she is responsible, has been a member of the village bank of "Samba 15 ans 1" for 6 years. She wants to boost her business selling palm oil, dried fish, and smoked fish on a table in the street. Maimouna helps support the family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of palm oil, dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Mateo Acosta es de la Ciudad de San Estanislao, del Barrio San José, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. María de 29 años de edad, tienen casa propia, y 5 hijos, todos en edad escolar.

Trabaja como vendedor ambulante de artículos de mercerías y bijouterie, recorre por la ciudad y zonas aledañas, en una motocicleta para realizar su venta, tiene una clientela formada, buenos ingresos, buenas referencias comerciales y personales.

El cliente sueña en comprar una camioneta para el reparto de sus mercaderías por la zona. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías varias para la venta como sábanas, manteles, ropas, zapatos, etc.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Mateo Acosta is from the city of San Estanislao, from the neighborhood of San José. He is 42 years old and is married to Mrs. María, who is 29. They own their home and have 5 children, all of whom are school aged. He works as a traveling salesman selling haberdashery and boutique items. He travels the city through residential areas on a motorcycle to make his sales. He has an established clientele, good income, and good personal and business references.

This client wishes to purchase a truck to deliver his products throughout the area. This loan will be used to purchase various items to sell such as sheets, table cloths, clothing, shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheets, table cloths, clothing, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Marta Silvia

texts.es: La Señora Martha S. D. R., tiene el negocio en su domicilio, donD. empezó vendiendo pasteles a sus amistades y a sus familiares, actualmente tiene contratos con clientes desD. hace más D. tres años, cuando su primer prestamo con EMPRENDER,  D. Bs. 1000  fue utilizado en la compra D. insumos, posteriormente, y con su segundo crédito compró un horno industrial, con el que vio mejorar en gran medida su pequeño negocio, hasta hoy que utilizará el crédito para la compra D. un segundo horno industrial. En su familia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, quien refiere estar muy orgulloso D. ella. Su aspiración es hacer crecer su negocio y poder tener una pasteleria.
texts.en:
Martha S. D. R. has a business in her home selling pastries to her friends and family. Currently, she has contracts with customers that have lasted more than three years. With her first loan from EMPRENDER of Bs. 1,000, she bought supplies. With her second loan, she bought an industrial oven that grew her small business. She will use this loan to purchase a second industrial oven. In her family, she has the support of her husband who is very proud of her. Her goal is to grow her business and establish her own pastry store.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel Martínez Noguera es de Barrio San Pedro a 12 Km. de la ciudad de Guayaybi, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres.

Tiene su propio negocio de venta de repuestos, con clientela formada, lo que le genera buenos ingresos mensuales.

También tiene un taller de moto en su casa particular, con muchos clientes satisfechos por sus buenos servicios.

Le gustaría ampliar más adelante su local para poder trabajar y atender mejor a sus clientes. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos varios para vehículos.
texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Martinez Noguera is from the San Pedro neighborhood 12km form the city of Guayaybi, is 25 years old, is single and lives with his parents.

He has his own business selling parts, with an established clientele, which brings him a good monthly income.

He also has a small motorcycle workshop in his house, with many satisfied customers from his good services.

He would like to further grown his location to be able to work and better attend to his customers. The loan is to invest in buying spare parts for vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying parts for cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Grupo Delirio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Delirio, se formo hace 2 años en La ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, bajo la iniciativa emprendedora de padre e hijo, quienes querían ver crecer sus negocios, está formado por: 

El señor Juan H., es el hijo y  trabaja en la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, empezó trabajando como ayudante, de transportista, despues de poco tiempo se independizó y sacó su primer prestamo en EMPRENDER para el florecimiento de su negocio. Tiene 2 hijos estudiantes a quienes mantiene, asu vez cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien le ayuda con los gastos familiares al tener un pequeño negocio. Aspira a comprar un autimovil propio. Es una persona muy responsable, y buen cliente  de la institución. El crédito será invertido en la refacción de su domicilio.			

El señor Teofilo H., es el padre y a su vez lider del grupo, trabaja como transportista en un sindicato de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, empezó trabajando como chofer de taxi, le fue tan bien que posteriormente se compro un minibus. Tiene 2 hijos pequeños a quienes atinde con mucho cariño, su esposa se dedica a la venta de empanadas (llauchas), que vende con mucho éxito.  Por su parte él, aspira a comprar más autimóviles y así poder mejorar el negocio que le posibilitará construir una casa propia. Es una persona responsable, y buen cliente  de la institución. El crédito será invertido en la compra de llantas, para sus automoviles.
texts.en:
The group Delirio was formed two years ago in La Paz, Bolivia under a father-son enterprise initative. This group would to grow its businesses, it was formed for: Juan H., the son, works in La Paz, Bolivia. He started working as a transportation assistant after a short time on his own and after receiving his first loan from EMPRENDER for the growth of his business. He supports his two children that are students with the help of his wife, who also contributes to the family bills with her small business. He aspires to purchase his own car. He is a very responsible person and a good client of the bank. This loan will be invested in the remodel of his home. Teofilo H., the father, is the leader of the group and works as a transportation contractor for a union in La Paz, Bolivia. He started working as a taxi driver and has so much success that he later bought a minibus. He has two children that he cares for with much affection and his wife sells empanadas successfully. He aspires to buy more cars and improve his business to create the possibility to build his own house. He is a responsible person and a good client of the bank. This loan will be invested in the purchase of tires for his cars.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel home

loans.name: Unidos Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidos Por Siempre, fue conformado por tres señoras que tienen en común la venta de víveres en un popular mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia.
La Señoras se dedican a la venta  de víveres los cuales venden a crédito, desde su primer drédito demostraron responsabilidad, son un grupo antiguo y a la fecha se encuentran en su sexta secuencia crediticia. La señora Marilyn es madre soltera, por lo cual su negocio es el único sustento que tiene para mantener a sus hijos, es la lider del grupo al ser una persona muy responsable, refiere que en el negocio y gracias al microcrédito le va muy bien. Por su parte las señoras Vilma y M., tambien ayudan económicamente en sus hogares, por lo cual se sienten muy útiles en el mantenimiento del hogar, todo ello gracias a su trabajo. El crédito solicitado lo utilizaran en la compra de una mayor cantidad de viceres que venderán en ocasión del dia de los muertos, fecha en que las familias de clase humilde hacen repostería en sus hogares para celebrar este día.
texts.en:
The group “Forever United” was formed for three women who all sell supplies in a popular market in La Paz, Bolivia. The women sell supplies on credit. Since their first loan, they have demonstrated responsibility and are an experienced group who are requesting their sixth loan. Marilyn is a single mother. Her business is her only source of income to support her children. She is the leader of the group and is very responsible, thanks to her business and the micro loans that have been successful. Vilma and Magna also contribute financially to their homes, making them feel very useful and appreciative of their jobs. The loan they are requesting will be used to purchase supplies at wholesale that they will sell for the Day of the Dead holiday, a day when low class families make baked goods in their homes in order to celebrate.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: Jacqueline tiene 26 años de edad, habita en el barrio Los Martinez del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene tres hijos menores que están estudiando la primaria. Su esposo trabaja como enderezador y pintor de automóviles y está pendiente de las necesidades de su familia. Jacqueline trabaja en una empresa de zona franca como operaria de telas. Oficio en el que permanece casi todo el día y tiene que hacer doble esfuerzo para poder atender a su familia. Actualmente el techo de su vivienda está en mu mal estado, y el préstamo solicitado será para cambiar algunas partes del techo y así evitar un poco las dificultades que trae la lluvia. Espera poder seguir accediendo a estos créditos y así terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 26, lives in the Los Martinez neighborhood in Ticuantepe. She is married and has three young children who attend elementary school. Her husband does auto body repair and paint jobs, and he is always making sure that his family's needs are met. Jacqueline works in a free zone factory as a textile operator. Her job keeps her away from home the entire day, and she must double her efforts to also care of her family. The roof in Jacqueline's home is in very bad shape. The loan she is requesting will be used to replace portions of the roof, and fend off some of the difficulties that rains bring. Jacqueline hopes to finish building her home with the help of more loans in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing portions of the home's roof

loans.name: Banco Florecer Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal, esta conformado por 17 integrantes, pertenece al municipio D. la Guardia, con su punto D. reunion ubicadoen el Km 9, Barrio 23 D. diciembre, del municipio D. El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Este grupo tiene en común la producción D. D. alimentos y la venta D. comida. Y la mayoría son vecinas del barrio.
ZULEMA D., Es la líder del grupo, vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 D. diciembre del municipio del Torno, vive en la casa D. sus padres, con su esposo, tienen cuatro hijos. Su Actividad es la venta D. comida que realiza en forma ambulante, y el crédito que necesita será para invertir en el mismo negocio, aumentando su capital D. trabajo. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando en el banco comunal con el tiempo, quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
MIREYA RIOS, Es la secretaria del banco comunal, vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre en la misma zona. Ella venD. frutas en el mercado y también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos  vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos y desea tener una casa propia. 
MARIEL J., Es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma zona es decir en su negocio es la venta D. comidas.  Vive en la casa propia con sus dos hijos, el negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a tener su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is maD. up of 17 members. It belongs to the municipality of La Guardia, with a home base at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December in the El Torno municipality, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. This group produces, prepares, and sells food items. The majority are neighbors in the area. Zulema D. is the leader of the group. She lives with her parents, her husband and four children at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December, El Torno municipality. She sells food from door to door, and the loan she requires will be used to invest in this business to have more working capital. Over time, and with the income she makes with the help of the communal bank, she wishes to create a small store in her neighborhood. Mireya Rios is the secretary of the communal bank. She lives at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December in the same area. She sells fruits at the market and also sells cosmetics. She lives in a home that she rents with her two children and would like to own a home. Mariel J. is the treasurer of the communal bank. She lives in the same area and sells prepared foods. She lives in her own home with two children. Her business is performed from door to door and just like her partners, she would like to have a stationary business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 47 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Antonio Sur del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como albañil y junto a Doña Juana se encargan del cuido y manuetnción de su familia. La Sra. Juana trabaja en una casa particular como empleada doméstica, tiene seis años de dedicarse a este oficio, el cual inició en vista de las necesidades económicas de su familia, ya que su esposo obtenía pocos ingresos. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para mejoras de vivienda en la reparación del techo ya que lo tiene en mal estado, y las lluvias le están afectando las pertenecias de su vivienda. Espera poder contar siempre con un trabajo, ya que su sueño es poder convertir a sus hijos en profesionales
texts.en:
Juana, 47, lives in the San Antonio Sur neighborhood in Ticuantepe. She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 16. Her husband is a construction worker, and both provide for their family's needs. Juana has worked as a house maid for the last six years. She started working in this job to help her husband increase the household income. The loan Juana is requesting will be used to fix the roof, which is in bad shape. With the rain season looming ahead, Juana is concerned that her belongings will be damaged. Her hope is to always have a job, and her dream is to give her children a college education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof in her home.

loans.name: 23 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este banco esta conformado por 14 integrantes, pertenece al Municipio D. la Guardia, Km. 9, del departamento D. Santa Cruz, Bolivia, en esta comunidad la mayoría D. las integrantes se dedican al comercio.
Maria del Carmen, Es la líder del grupo, es dueña D. casa y hace,  25 años que resiD. en la zona, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos. Tiene la actividad D. venta D. cosméticos, y el crédito que necesita es para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital D. trabajo. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando  con el tiempo quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
Patricia León, es la secretaria del banco comunal, ella se dedica a la venta D. D. repuestos automovilisticos, la Sra. Patricia León vive en casa familiar con sus padres, tiene un hijo que vive con su esposo ya que son separados. ella aparte D. trabajar con el negocio  D. venta D. repuestos también estudia, tiene ganas D. superarse , con el tiempo  quiere llegar a tener su casa propia. 
Marlene  V. Rivera, es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma localidad, tiene el negocio D. la venta D. cosméticos. Vive en la casa familiar cuenta con sus dos hijos. El negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
This bank is maD. up of 14 members and pertains to the Municipality of La Guardia, Km. 9 in the district of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Most of the members of this community make a living as salespeople. Maria del Carmen is the leader of the group. She owns her home and lived in this area for 25 years. She lives with her husband and they have two children. She sells cosmetics, and the loan she needs will be used for this business to increase her work capital. With her savings, she would like to set up a shop in her neighborhood. Patricia León is the secretary of the communal bank and sells car replacement parts. Mrs. Patricia León lives in a family owned home with her parents. She has one son who lives with her husband, since they are separated. With time, she would like to own a house. Marlene V. Rivera is the treasurer of the communal bank. She lives in the same area and sells cosmetics. She lives in a family home and has two children. She sells her products from door to door and just like her partners, she would like to have a stationary business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Donilia

texts.es: Doña Donilia tiene 50 años de edad, habita en el barrio Bertha Díaz de la ciudad de Managua, es madre soltera de un niño de 12 años de edad, quién se encuentra cursando la educación primaria. Doña Donilia es comerciante, se dedica a la actividad de  transporte y tiene diez años de estar en este negocio, tiene buses de transporte urbano. Actualmente desea invertir en su actividad, necesita darle mantenimiento a la unidades de buses para que éstos no le presenten problemas y puedan seguir brindando un buen servicio. Espera en un futuro poder adquirir una nueva unidad de bus, para así ir creciendo en su negocio y asegurarle un buen patrimonio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ms. Donilia is 50 years old and lives in the Bertha Díaz neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is a single mother of a 12-year-old boy, who is currently attending elementary school. Ms. Donilia is an entrepreneur who is in the business of public transportation (buses). She has been in business for 10 years. She currently needs to invest in her business by giving maintenance to her buses so that they will not have any problems and that they can keep providing good service. She hopes to obtain another bus in the future, so that her business can keep growing and that she can assure a good patrimony to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bus maintenance

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
La señora Joaquina Espínola es de la ciudad de San Estanislao, tiene 29 años de edad, y está casada con el señor Mario Acosta de 31 años de edad.

Comenzó a montar su pequeña despensa hace 6 años, ya que anteriormente era vendedora ambulante, luego tuvo problemas de salud, y se dejó de ese trabajo.

Gracias a los créditos que recibió de la Fundación Paraguaya, la Sra. Joaquina, pudo comprar las mercaderías para su despensa.

Logrando así un mayor ingreso en sus ventas, por la creciente clientela. Ella comercializa todo tipo de comestibles y artículos de primera necesidad como: azúcar, leche, huevos, frutas, verduras, carne, pan, enlatados, harina, entre otros.

Desea adquirir este crédito para poder reforzar su stock de mercaderías, especialmente con bebidas ya que el calor en esta época hace que la demanda de gaseosas, cervezas, jugos entre otros aumente con mayor consideración.
texts.en:
Mrs. Joaquina E. is from the city of San Estanislao, is 29 years old, and is married with MR. Mario Acosta, who is 31.

She started to run her small business six years ago, since before that she was a traveling vendor and after having health problems, she stopped that work.

Thanks to the loans that she received from the Paraguayan Foundation, Mrs. Joaquina was able to buy the merchandise for her store.

She has achieved a better income because of her growing clientele. She sells all types of groceries and necessary goods, like: sugar, milk, eggs, fruit, vegetables, meat, bread, flour and others.

She hopes to acquire this loan to be able to reinforce her stock, especially with drinks now that the heat in this season makes the demand for soda, beer, juices and other drinks grow.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Las Amistosas (The Friendly Folks) Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por comerciantes, que trabajan en el municipio de El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia.
JORGE ESPINOSA, Es la líder del grupo,  vive en el torno tiene una venta de repuestos y actualmente vive en casa alquilada,  tiene tres hijos y es separado de su mujer desde hace unos años. El crédito que necesita será para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital. El desea tener su propio local y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando  con el tiempo quiere colocar una ferretería en su barrio.
ANGELICA RODRIGUES, vive en casa propia tiene tres hijos,  vive en la misma zona en el barrio naciones unidas de la misma localidad, se dedica a la venta de comida es ambulante. Como meta tiene la de llagar a contar con puesto fijo dentro del mercado, para poder seguir progresando.
ARMINDA ENCINAS, es la tesorera del Banco comunal, vive en la zona de la guardia, tiene cuatro hijos vive en la casa familiar. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos fuera del mercado, el negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y de la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo. El  esposo trabaja como ayudante de chofer, el sueño de ambos es llegar a contar con vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
A group made up of businesspeople who work in the city of El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. JORGE ESPINOSA is the leader of the group. He lives in El Torno and has a grocery store. At the moment he lives in a rented house. He has three children and has been separated from his wife for several years. The loan that he needs would be invested in this business to increase his capital. He wants to have his own location and with savings that he has accumulated over the time he wants to open a hardware store in his neighbourhood. ANGELICA RODRIGUES lives in her own home. She has three children. She lives in the same area in the neighbourhood Naciones Unidas, of the same area. She works selling food in the streets. She has a goal to achieve a fixed stall inside the market, in order to be able to continue progressing. ARMINDA ENCINAS is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the area La Guardia. She has four children and lives in a home with her family. She works selling cosmetics outside of the market. The business that she currently has is on foot and like the other members of the group, in time she wants to have a business in a fixed location. Her husband works as an assistant of a driver. The dream of this couple is to have their own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 4 hijos, tiene un copetín en su casa, donde atiende con sus hijos.

Comenzó a montar su pequeño copetín hace 4 años, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como vendedora ambulante.

Gracias a los créditos que recibió de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo aumentar sus ingresos, y ahora, tiene proyectado construir un salón más amplio para su negocio para lo cual esta juntando unos ahorros.

El destino que dará a este crédito que solicita será para la compra de mercaderías e ingredientes para preparar las ricas comidas que ella vende entre ellos pan, azúcar, sal, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, carne, chocho, arvejas, arroz, harina, huevos, etc.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana is from the city of Santani and she has 4 children whom she attends to at home. She also owns a vendor car that she started riding about 4-years ago; previously she had been working the cart on foot.

She is thankful to receive this loan from Fundacion Paraguaya which will increase her income and now she intends to build a bigger store with this pooled savings.

The goal of this loan is to be able to buy goods for ingredients to prepare tasty meals that she will sell. They include: bread, sugar, salt, vegetables, fruits, drinks, meat, chocho, peas, rise, flour, eggs and so on.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat, eggs, vegetables, fruits, drinks and etc...

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es: Santos Roberto P. M. tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en el sector conocido como Los Rios, es casado, junto a su esposa Maria Argentina Mercado tiene dos pequeños niños de 5 y 3 años de edad. Santos se dedica al oficio de albañil, su esposa tienen una pulpería pequeña  desde hace 6 meses, la cual con mucho esfuerzo pudieron montar, y la que han podido mantener a través de créditos. este crédito será usado para invertir en la pulpería, en la compra de granos básicos y demás utensilios del hogar, y así poder ir creciendo en inventario.
texts.en:
Santos Roberto P. M. is 27 years old. He lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the sector known as Los Rios. He is married, and together with his wife, Maria Argentina Mercado, he has two small children, one 3 and one 5 years old. Santos works as a bricklayer. His wife has had a small general store for the past 6 months, which with much effort she began, and they have been able to keep it through loans. This loan would be used to invest in the general store, in the purchase of basic grains and other household utensils, and so be able to grow the inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains and household utensils

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Grupo formado con la iniciativa D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo con microcréditos, esperando el desarrollo D. sus negocios.
NORAH Q..- Es la líder del grupo, ella vive en la guardia, Santa Cruz, Bolivia, ella vive en casa propia. Tiene la actividad D. venta D. cosmético ella es ambulante, y el crédito que necesita es para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando  con el tiempo quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
HERLINDA P., ella venD. ropa en el mercado en la misma localidad y también venD. refrescos  en la misma zona, vive en propia casa tiene tres hijos, los cuales son buenos estudiantes, y la aydan en su trabajo. 
ARMINDA E., es la tesorera del Banco comunal, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos ella  tiene cuatro hijos. Vive en la casa familiar y su esposo trabaja D. ayudante D. chofer y ella sueña con tener su propio taxi. El negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
A group formed with the goal of increasing working capital with microcredit, hoping for the success of their businesses. NORAH Q. is the leader of the group. She lives in La Guardia, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. She lives in her own home. She works selling cosmetics on foot, and this credit is needed to invest in her business to increase her capital. And with the savings that she has accumulated over time she wants to have a little store in her neighbourhood. HERLINDA P. sells clothes in the market in a fixed location and she also sells soft drinks in the same place. She lives in her own home and has three children, who are good students, and they help her with the work. ARMINDA E. is the treasurer of the community bank. She works selling cosmetics. She has four children. She lives in her family’s home and her husband works as an assistant of a driver. She dreams to have her own taxi. The business that she currently has is on foot and, similar to the other members of the group, with time she wants to have a fixed location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Walner Eliodoro

texts.es: Walner Eliodoro G. tiene la edad de 23 años habita en Veracruz, municipio de Managua, es casado,  su esposa Ana Barbera es ama de casa, tienen un hijo a su cargo de la edad de 2 años, Walner trabaja como Chofer de una Institución en Managua desde hace un año y medio; el pide el apoyo de AFODENIC ya que el techo de su vivienda esta muy deteriorado y las lluvias le están afectando, para lo cual necesita el crédito para comprar zinc y perlines e instalar un nuevo techo;  para ya no tener ese problema que le ha ocasionado mucha perdida materiales .
texts.en:
Walner Eliodoro Gutierrez, 23, lives in Veracruz, Managua. He is married; his wife Ana Barbara, is a stay-home mom who cares for their 2-year-old son. Walner has been working as a driver in a Managua agency for a year and a half. He is requesting a loan through AFODENIC to buy materials to replace his house roof. The roof is in very bad shape and the rains have caused great damage to his family's belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacing the roof in his home.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Centurión de Barrios es de la ciudad de Guayaibi, es viuda, tiene 61 años, con casa propia, y vive con sus hijas.

Es propietaria de una despensa que funciona hace 29 años, con excelente ubicación comercial, y clientela formada, gracias a su buen stock de mercaderías.

También tiene 2 salones que alquila, y le genera otros ingresos mensuales.

En su despensa vende artículos y comestibles varios como harina, carne, huevos, verduras, frutas, gaseosas, enlatados, etc. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá para surtir de mayor cantidad de variedad de marcas su despensa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia Centurión de Barrios is from the city of Guayaibi; she is a widow and is 61 years old. She owns her house and lives with her daughters.

She is the owner of a grocery store that has been operating for 29 years, at an excellent commercial location. She has established clientele thanks to her good stock of products.

She also has 2 shops that she rents out which generate monthly income.

In her grocery store, she sells various food items such as flour, meat, eggs, vegetables, fruit, sodas, canned goods, etc. The loan she asks for will be used to increase the quantity and variety of brands in her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, meat, eggs, vegetables, fruit, sodas, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.es:
Es un banco comunal compuesto D. 10 personas, el cual pertenece a la Localidad D. la Guardia, Bolivia, la mayoría D. los clientes se dedican al comercio D. ropa, cosméticos y frutas.
Carmen C..- es la líder del banco ella vive en la localidad D. la Guardia Barrio 3 D. Mayo hace 2 años,  vive en casa alquilada. Cuenta con tres hijos y su esposo el mismo que trabaja en la Alcaldía D. la Guardia, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa ambulando,  hace 2 años atrás que empezó con el negocio ahora quiere seguir trabajando con emprender para seguir ahorrando y D. esa manera llagar a reunir dinero para comprarse un puesto fijo.
Juana S..- es la secretaria del banco comunal, ella se dedica a la venta D. cosmético y también a la venta D. masitas, es ambulante y vive en casa  propia tiene cuatro hijos es una mujer talentosa y en la casa D. ella se hacen las reuniones ella sueña con tener un local propio.  
Lidia C..-  La Sra. es la Tesorera del banco comunal, vive en la localidad D. la Guardia, Km. 6. En casa alquilada, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos.
Es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos, dice que el crédito es muy importante ya que D. esa manera ella realiza su negocio y es la manera con la que logra mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
It is a community bank of 10 individuals that belongs to the locality of "la Guardia," Bolivia. The majority of the clients sell clothes, cosmetics and fruit for a living. Carmen C. is the leader of the bank, she has been living in the locality of "la Guardia Barrio 3 D. Mayo" for the past 2 years, she lives in a rented house. She has three children and her husband works at the Mayor's Office of "la Guardia; she is a street vendor selling clothes. She started her business 2 years ago and she wishes to continue working with enthusiasm in order to save enough money to buy a stand. Juana S. is the secretary of the community bank, she sells cosmetics as well as pastries as a street vendor, she lives in her own house, has four children, is a very talented lady and business meetings are held at her place and she dreams of having her own premises. Lidia C. is the treasurer of the community bank, she lives in the locality of "la Guardia, Km. 6". She sells cosmetics from a rented house. She is a single mother of two children, and the loan is very important to her as it makes it possible for her to make business and proviD. for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula S.  tiene la edad de 65 años habita en el sector de los cocos ubicado en la concepción, tiene una hija que habita con ella, su hija casada y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa; Paula hace tortillas y comida todos los días, ya que por el sector que ella habita hay una empresa y todos los trabajadores  le llegan a comprar el almuerzo.  Ella solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de comidas y así no desmejorar el servicio que ofrece
texts.en:
Paula Sanchez, 65, lives in Los Cocos, Concepcion. A married daughter lives with her, and helps with the household expenses. Paula makes tortillas and cooks dishes everyday, for workers of a close-by factory who come to her house to buy the food. Paula is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for more dishes, and improve the service she offers to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to prepare dishes

loans.name: Las Salvadoras Group

texts.es:
Banco comunal, formado en Santa Cruz, Bolivia, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y sus negocios mediante el microcrédito.
GIOVANNA LUCIA V..- Es la líder del grupo, ella vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre, es dueña de casa hace  25 años que reside en la zona, vive con su esposo tienen un hijos.
Tiene la actividad de venta de cosméticos y ropa, y el crédito que necesita es para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital..
PADY MARIELA.- es la secretaria del banco comunal, ella vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre en la misma zona ella se dedica a la venta de ropa , tiene un hijo y vive con su esposo, ella vive en casa alquilada aparte sueña con tener su propia tienda de ropa.
LETICIA V..- es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma localidad es decir en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre tiene el negocio de la venta de ropa. Vive en la casa familiar cuenta con un hijos 
El negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y de la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
A community bank, formed in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, with the goal of bettering the quality of life and their businesses through microcredit. GIOVANNA LUCIA V. is the leader of the group. She lives at Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre. She is the owner of her house and has lived in the area for the past 25 years. She lives with her husband and they have one son. She works selling cosmetics and clothing, and this loan is needed in order to invest in her business, increasing her capital. PADY MARIELA is the secretary of the community bank. She lives in Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre, in the same zone. She works selling clothing. She has one son and she lives with her husband. She lives in a rented, freestanding house. Her dream is to have her own clothing store. LETICIA V. is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the same location, or at Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre. She has a business selling clothing. She lives in her family’s home with her children. The business that she has at the moment is on foot and similar to the other group members with time she wants to have a fixed location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 43 años, vive con 2 de sus 6 hijos. Desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica a las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, desde muy joven ha disfrutado de vivir en el campo y respirar aire puro, por lo que decidió establecer su hogar y criar ahí a sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, hoy solo vive con los 2 menores que la ayudan también en cuidar sus tierras de cultivo, siembra papa y maíz, también alfalfa, la cual le servirá para venderla en el mercado y alimentar a sus animales, tiene dos terrenos, en uno de ellos siembra y el otro lo hace descansar por varios meses para que la tierra recupere sus nutrientes y de una buena producción cuando se vuelva a sembrar, es así que ella trabaja, y también con sus animales, principalmente con su vaca, la lleva  a zonas lejanas para pastearla a parte de la alfalfa que le da de comer.  Carmen trabaja para seguir manteniendo a sus 2 últimos hijos, que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Solicita este préstamo para su próxima campaña de siembra en la tierra de cultivo que se muestra en la fotografía, desea comprar sacos de abono, semilla y alquilar tractor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old. She lives with two of her 6 children. For more than 15 years now, she has made a living in agriculture and livestock. She has enjoyed living in the countryside and breathing clean air since she was very young. This is why she decided to make her home there and raise her six children. Today, she only lives with her two youngest who also help her take care of the farm. She plants potato, corn, and alfalfa which she sells at the market, and also uses to feed her livestock. She owns two properties; in one of them she plants while the other rests for several months so that the earth recovers its nutrients and can yield a good crop once it is cultivated again. This is how she works; she also works with her livestock, especially her cow, which she takes to far off pastures to feed in addition to the alfalfa she gives her to eat. Carmen works to continue to support her two youngest children, who are the reason for her great efforts. She asks for this loan for her next crop; she wishes to purchase fertilizer, seed and rent a tractor.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her next crop

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Ada tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Trabaja cada día y desde su niñez en las tareas de la ganadería, hoy que tiene su propia familia, es más ardua su labor, cría los animales y los vende en la feria ganadera cuando ya están grandes, sólo si son toros, cuando son vacas, aprovecha su leche para vender y alimentar a sus hijos, el becerro lo vende si es macho y si es hembra  la cría para  que sea una reproductora más. En algunas ocasiones selecciona un toro que será el reproductor y no lo vende por ese tiempo. Con esta actividad, ha mejorado su economía, por ello esta tranquila y satisfecha de su trabajo, que es además independiente.  Ada realiza esta tarea por la responsabilidad que tiene para con sus hijos y el amor que siente hacia ellos. Es por ello que uno de sus proyectos más cercanos es construir su casa. Solicita este préstamo con el que arrendará surcos de alfalfa, que le servirán para alimentar a sus animales, también comprará sacos de afrecho.
texts.en:
Ada is 29 years old, she lives with her husband and her 2 children. She has been working daily since her childhood in stockbreeding, nowadays when she has her own family the work is more ardouos, she breeds the animals and sells them, only the bulls, at the cattle market when grown, as she keeps the cows to sell the milk as well as feed her children. Male calves are sold and female calves are kept for breeding. Ocassionally a bull is selected for reproduction and not sold. With this activity she has improved her economy, and she feels calm and satisfied with her work, and she is also independent.
