Ada carries out her duties with responsibility because of the love she feels for her children. Therefore one of her most important projects is to build her house. She requests this loan to rent furrows of alfalfa to feed her animals as well as to purchase sacks of bran.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent furrows of alfalfa to feed animals.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 63 años, vive con su esposo y un D. sus hijos. Hace 6 años abrió una tienda en su propia casa, a fin D. tener una vida más tranquila, ella y su esposo se jubilaron, desean seguir trabajando, pero D. manera independiente, es así que Teodora es la encargada principal D. la atención D. su establecimiento, los días donD. recibe mayores entradas, es cuando son las fechas festivas D. su localidad como patronales, fiestas patrias, día D. los santos, etc. Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer, es por ello que siempre está al pendiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda para mantenerse activa. Teodora trabaja para sentirse bien con ella misma y disfrutar cada momento. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá adquirir mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Teodora, 63, lives with her husband and one of her children. Six years ago she opened a shop in her home. In order to have an easier life, she and her husband retired, they wanted to keep on working, but independently. Teodora bears the main burden for the shop. The busiest days are the local festivals such as labor holidays, national holidays, holy days, etc. Teodora doesn't waste any opportunity to grow, making sure to innovate and improve her shop to keep herself active. Teodora works for her own well-being and she enjoys every minute. She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise in her shop

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es: Honorata tiene 27 años, vive con su  esposo y su hija. Ella es una mujer que ha sabido levantarse a los malos tiempos, uno de ellos fue cuando tenía un negocio de cabinas de Internet, pero debido a un rayo que cayó en la antena que proporcionaba la línea al pueblo, y al no poderse reparar la antena, tuvo que vender sus computadoras y cerrar su negocio. Desde hace más de 2 años se dedica a ofrecer pequeños prestamos a personas conocidas con un interés bajo, de esa manera puede hacer crecer su dinero, esta opción es viable, porque necesita tiempo para su pequeña, la dificultad es cuando su hija se enferma, entonces que requiere de casi todo su tiempo para poder  cuidarla. Solicita este préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, ya que Honorata quiere darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Honorata is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter. She is a woman who has known bad times in her life, but has overcome them. One of these was when she provided an internet service. Unfortunately, a bolt of lightning hit the antenna which provided access to the internet for the village, and because she was not able to repair the antenna she had to sell her computers and close her business. For more than two years she has been offering small personal loans with low rates of interest to people she knows, and in this way has been able to increase her savings. This is a practical option for work as she needs free time to look after her young daughter, who is ill, and needs Honorata to spend almost all her time caring for her. Honorata is looking for this loan to improve the infrastructure of her home, as she would like to give her daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Keaveney, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Roselfina

texts.es: Roselfina tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Trabaja cada día al cuidado de sus hijos y también en las tareas del campo, es una emergente agricultora y ganadera, pues tiene vacas, las cuales todas las mañanas sin excepción está al cuidado de ellas, de su alimentación, para que en el día que las venda tenga una considerable  ganancia porque le han costando mucho esfuerzo, al día puede extraer de 10 a 12 litros de leche, que le sirve para venderla, también trabaja en el cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo, en esta ocasión, cuida de sus pastizales de alfalfa, ya que es lo indispensable para la alimentación de sus animales y también tiene una granja de cuyes que va en aumento.  Roselfina trabaja diariamente motivada por el bienestar de su familia a la que quiere tanto. Invertirá el dinero prestado para techar parte de su casa que servirá como establo para sus vacas, también para comprar galpones para su granja de cuyes y comprar cuyes machos reproductores para mejorar la raza.
texts.en:
Roselfina is 28-years old and lives with her husband and 3 children. She works each day to care for her children and also works the farmland. She is an emerging livestock and agricultural farmer. She has cows which every morning, without exception, she cares for and ensures they are fed. For what they can sell there is considerable profit, but it also requires an extensive amount of effort. A day can draw about 10 to 12 litres of milk that can be sold.

Roselfina also tends to the alfalfa pastures, which is indispensable as it provides feed for the livestock of the farm. In addition to this, she also raises guinea pigs. Roselfina works daily with the motivation for the welfare of her family.

These borrowed funds would be put towards building an extension of the roof for the house that would act as a stable for her cows. Also, she will purchase a shed for her guinea pigs as well as a stud guinea pig for breeding purposes.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the infrastructure of her stable and purchase guinea pigs for breding.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.es: Sabrina tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Siempre ha buscado las salidas para afrontar las carencias económicas en su hogar, es así que encontró una buena alternativa, la de la crianza de cuyes, desde hace 5 años, cada día  trabaja en su granja, alimentando y limpiando sus galpones, los fines de semana vende sus cuyes a una feria cercana a su localidad, para que de esa manera, le genere recursos económicos, también saca la alfalfa de sus propias tierras de cultivo, donde ha sembrado alfalfa, por ello sale todas las mañanas a recoger pasto. En la actualidad está superando un momento difícil en su granja, porque fue invadida por una enfermedad que le hizo perder gran cantidad de cuyes. Sabrina trabaja porque desea seguir siendo un sostén más en la economía de su hogar. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más cuyes reproductores y mejorar la infraestructura de su granja.
texts.en:
Sabrina is 29-years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. She always seeks ways to shore up the gaps in the family’s income and so she found a good alternative in raising guinea pigs. For the past 5-years, each day she works on the farm, feeding and cleaning the barns and during the weekend she sells the guinea pigs at the market in their village and in doing so she gains economic resources. Also, she collects alfalfa grown on her farm that she herself planted.

In actuality, she is overcoming a vert difficult time on the farm, because a disease had overtaken her large part of her live stock causing her to lose many guinea pigs. Sabrina works because she wants to remain the provider for her family. This loan request will allow her to buy more breeding guinea pigs and improve the infrastructure of her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy breeding guinea pigs and improve the sheds for breeding.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y 4 hijos. Es una persona que cada día se esfuerza para conseguir lo mejor para su familia y aprovecha la mejor oportunidad para hacerlo, paralelamente, ejerce su profesión de maestra, por la cual, hace más de 19 años formó su propia institución educativa en los niveles de primaria y secundaria, su dedicación diaria es de promocionar esta institución, lograr el aumento del alumnado, y lo está logrando, eso le alegra mucho. Maria se esfuerza  porque  sus hijos son la mejor razón para hacerlo y porque disfruta  ejercer su profesión. Invertirá este préstamo para mandar a elaborar los buzos deportivos y uniformes institucionales para el uso de los alumnos, además de elaborar afiches publicitarios.
texts.en:
Maria is 44-years old and lives with her husband and four children. She’s a person who works hard each day to achieve the best for her family and took the opportunity to do better. In parallel, she is a practicing school teacher for a school she started over 19-years ago. They teach children in primary and secondary school, and she is dedicated to promoting this institution, increasing student enrollment and it is happening and for this she is very happy. Maria works for the children and it is the best reason to do so because she enjoys her profession. This loan request is to send divers to develop sports and for student uniforms. In addition, these funds will also go towards developing posters for advertising.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop school sports and buy student uniforms for the little ones.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Rodolfo tiene 40años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa San Jacinto de Managua, es soltero y no todavía no tiene hijos. Don Rodolfo tiene 18 años de dedicarse a la actividad de panificador, empezó trabajando en una panadería pero poco después pudo poner su propio negocio. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan, y así poder abstecer la demanda de sus clientes que cada día es más grande.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 40, lives in the Villa Jacinto neighborhood of Managua. He is single and has no children. Rodolfo has been working as a bread baker for 18 years. He started working as an employee in a bakery, but soon he was able to open his own business. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase ingredients to bake more bread, and to be able to satisfy his customers' growing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 44 años, vive con una de sus 3 hijas. Siendo consumidora, la invitaron a vender cosméticos, e inició esa actividad para solventar las necesidades económicas que estaba pasando, 6 años después ve los resultados de su perseverancia, ahora tiene mayor capacidad de ventas, además ha formado su grupo de vendedoras de estos productos de belleza, las cuales, al mes, venden buena cantidad de productos, de esa manera la línea de productos que vende la ha premiado con incentivos por ser una de las vendedoras estrella. Su trabajo es caminar diariamente para obtener clientes,  sus habilidades para las ventas le permiten poder llegar a sus metas. Esta mujer se esfuerza porque desea seguir apoyando los estudios universitarios de una de sus hijas, además, el mismo trabajo la motiva a seguir adelante. Con el préstamo que obtenga, invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, también en mejorar la infraestructura de su casa construyendo cuartos y posteriormente darlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and lives with one of her three daughteres. Being a consumer, she was invited to sell cosmetics and she started these activities in order to help settle some financial needs that she was experiencing. Six years later, she sees the results of her perserverance, and she now has a greater capacity to make sales. In addition, she has formed her group of saleswomen for these beauty products which she sells a great deal of on a monthly basis. For this reason, the line of cosmetics that she sells has rewarded her with incentives for being a stellar salesperson. Her work involves walking every day to build her customer base, and her ability for sales has helped her achieve her goals. This woman works very hard because she wants to continue supporting the university studies of one of her daughters and, in addition, the work itself motivates her to forge ahead. With the loan she obtains, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products and also in making improvements to the infrastructure of her home by building additional rooms to later offer for rent.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of beauty products that she sells and to add some rooms to her house to rent out.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 49 años, y vive solo con su esposa. En plena juventud y con las ganas de emprender un negocio, desde hace 33 años trabaja en su propia tienda abastecedora de telas, fuente de ingresos que en todo este tiempo le a servido para sostener a sus hijos que hoy ya son personas adultas y responsables, por lo cual Leoncio sigue trabajando en la atención de su tienda de telas, que también es una fuente de trabajo para dos jóvenes que ha contratado para que le ayudan en la atención. Cada cierto tiempo viaja a la ciudad de Lima para comprar grandes fardos al por mayor, sus clientes por lo general son  confeccionistas de prendas de ropa.  Leoncio trabaja porque disfruta realizar esta actividad y además porque desea seguir mejorando y ampliando las posibilidades de dar trabajo a otros jóvenes. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más telas, para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 49-years old and lives with his wife. In his early days, with a desire to launch his own business, for the past 33-years, he has been working in his own shop selling fabric. As a source of income for that time, he served to provide for his children who now are older and responsible for themselves. Leoncio continues to work at his fabric store and also provides work for two children whom he has hired to help out at the store.

Every so often he travels to the city of Lima to buy large bales at the wholesale level, where his customers are generally the buyers of the clothing. Leoncio works because he enjoys the activity; moreover, he wants to continue improving and expanding the possibilities of giving work to other children. He requests this loan to be able to purchase more fabric so as to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his stock of fabric to sell in his store.

loans.name: Neyza

texts.es: Neyza tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. DesD. hace 10 años tiene un salón D. belleza, trabaja realizando todo tipo D. cortes D. cabello, tites, ondulaciones, etc. al gusto D. su clientela, en un inicio y desD. entonces es el brazo derecho D. una D. sus primas, que tiene su salón D. belleza en una zona céntrica D. la ciudad, es así que tuvo la oportunidad D. recibir capacitaciones D. lo último en tendencias D. la moda D. cortes D. cabellos y demás tratamientos D. belleza, entonces abre paralelamente su salón D. belleza, sus vecinos que son su principal clientela son los que acuden a solicitarle  sus servicios, esto la anima trabajar por lo cual sigue capacitándose. Además D. ello, también tiene su pequeña granja D. cuyes, que son un ingreso más para su economía.  Neyza solicita este préstamo con el que invertirá en la compra D. productos D. arreglo personal, como ganchos, peines, entre otros, que serán mercadería D. venta en su salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
Neyza is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children. For the past 10 years, she has had a beauty salon, working to cater to all types of hair cuts, styles, etc. to satisfy her customers' preferences. For a long time, she has been the right hand woman of her cousin who has a beauty salon in downtown. As a result, she had the opportunity to learn the latest trends for hair cuts and beauty experimentations. Later, she opened a partner beauty salon. Her neighbors are the main customers that request her services and they encourage her to continue her career. Moreover, she has a guinea pig farm that is another source of income. Neyza requests this loan to invest in personal beauty products, such as pins and brushes, among others, that will be merchandise for sale in her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase personal beauty products to sell in her beauty shop

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor de nombre Sebastián M. G. con la edad de 56 años, su estado civil es casado, quien tiene 4 hijos en total de los cuales 3 están casados, y no dependen de el solo su hija menor que cursa recientemente  el  4 año de derecho, su compañera de vida no trabaja por lo que es ama de casa, uno de los propósitos que Don Sebastián tiene  es seguirle ayudando a su hija en sus estudios y así podrá  sentirse satisfecho al lograr que su  hija corone su carrera, otros de sus deseos es de tener un taller de sastrería con un poco mas de condiciones para generar empleos a personas que realmente lo necesitan  ya que en determinado momento de su vida el paso por situaciones  muy difíciles y esta seria una manera de ayudar a estas personas, otros de sus propósitos es sacar adelante a su familia debido a que esta a sido una de las ideas que mas a querido realizar y que el mantiene en su mente para lograr sus propósito.

Don Sebastián tiene la actividad económica de sastrería  que se basa en la realización de trajes, pantalones para mujeres y varones, el tiempo que tiene  el negocio es de 30 años Don Sebastián da inicio a su negocio por sus padres normalmente solía acudir a sus clases en un colegio cercano por lo que en la tarde  asistía  a un taller de sastrería,  debido a la situación económica que sus padres presentaron tuvo que descontinuar sus estudios pero  continuo  en el taller de costura con el propósito de el mismo pagarse sus estudios y de esta manera Don Sebastián logra trabajar en la sastrería y tener su propio negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, el propósito de  este  financiamiento es para invertir poco a poco en su taller y aumentar su producción en las diferentes hechuras de sus trajes, otra de las cosas que necesita es comprar una maquina industrial para proporcionarle al cliente un tipo de trabajo mas fino y el pueda tener mas afluencia de clientes por su excelente trabajo.
texts.en:
Sebastián M. G. is 56 years old, is married, and has 4 children, 3 of whom are married and living independently. His youngest daughter is in her 4th year studying law. His life companion is a homemaker and does not work outside the home. Don Sebastián’s intention is to continue helping his daughter with her studies and to have the satisfaction of seeing her attain her career. Other desires of his are to have a tailoring workshop with enough business to hire people who really need the work and who are determined in this moment of their lives to work through difficult situations. His workshop would be a way to help these people. He wants to move forward for his family, an idea he most wants to realize and which he keeps in mind to help him succeed.

Don Sebastián works as a tailor making suits and pants for men and women. He has worked in this business for 30 years. When he was young he attended classes in a nearby school and in the afternoon would go to work in a tailoring shop. Because of his parents’ economic situation, he had to discontinue his studies. But he continued in the sewing workshop with the idea that he could pay for his studies that way. And so he became a tailor and set up his own business in his house. With the financing he will invest in his workshop, little by little, and increase his production of different styles of suits. Another thing he needs to do is to buy an industrial sewing machine that produces work of a higher quality that would in turn bring in more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mario Aurelio

texts.es:
El Joven Mario Aurelio P. de edad de 33 años, su estado civil es  acompañado quien tiene 3 hijas con edades de 10 años  quien esta cursando recientemente el 4 grado de primaria, su otra hija tiene 17 años y cursa el quinto año de secundaria y su ultima hija  tiene 3 años de edad que todavía no estudia,  su compañera de vida es ama de casa quien a la vez desempeña el papel de administradora del negocio que tienen, uno de los propósitos que tiene es mantener activo  ambos negocios, otros de sus propósitos es de darle mejoras a sus vivienda ya que esta no posee las condiciones necesarias y así darle a sus hijas un futuro lleno de oportunidades y de estudios.

La actividad económica de Don Mario es una pulpería que expande los productos como: golosinas, galletas, arroz, azúcar,  pollo, gaseosa, detergentes entre otros productos. El tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 1 año, el inicio su negocio con una pequeña canasta que contenía golosinas y al ver que esta tuvo afluencia de clientes fue que decidió invertir un poco mas en su negocio y así logra establecer su negocio en su casa logrando  mas  estabilidad, su otra actividad es la venta de queso y crema que también lleva cabo en su casa de habitación; el motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para tener mas crecimiento en su pulpería  y dar  satisfacción a sus clientes por consiguiente satisfacer su  demanda, e invertirá mas en su negocio y de poder comprar sus productos en un lugar mas favorable a fin que le genere un margen de ganancia mas alto, ya que al comprar por mayor el costo de compra es mas bajo.
texts.en:
Mario Aurelio P., 33, has three daughters: a 10-year-old who is in the 4th grade, a 17-year-old who is in high school, and a 3-year-old. His common-law wife is a stay-home mom, and also manages the businesses they run out of their home. One of Mario Aurelio's objectives is to keep his two business growing, and the second is to make necessary improvements to his house so that his daughters have a future filled with opportunities. Mario Aurelio runs a small corner store in which he sells, among other items, candy, cookies, rice, sugar, sodas, and detergents. He opened this store one year ago. He started with a small stand of candy, and when he saw that sales were good, he invested more in the business until it became the small store that they run out of their home. The other business they have is the sale of cheese and cream. Marco Aurelio is requesting a loan for work capital to expand the corner store and meet his customers' growing demands. He will purchase products at wholesale prices to increase his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: worok capital

loans.name: Elizabeth Karina

texts.es:
La señora  Elizabeth  Karina Portocarreo  González  con la edad de 25 años,  y siendo su estado civil  soltera, Doña Elizabeth tiene una hija con la edad de dos años quien recientemente no estudia  su compañero de vida es albañil, uno de los propósitos que Doña Elizabeth tiene es de salir adelante en esta vida por la situación   que tenemos en  nuestro país que encuentra inestable es  por eso que decide  conseguir mas ingresos para su familia y proporcionar mejoras tanto para su negocio como para su vida misma, otros de los factores por lo cual ella decidió tomar este tipo de negocio fue por ser una actividad digna de trabajo lo cual para ella representa ciertas responsabilidades como lo es el mantener a su hijo y brindarle una forma segura un futuro para sus estudios.

Doña Elizabeth tiene la actividad económica de  mercadería en general como: ropa interior, cosméticos y calzado que esta ubicado en león ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante en el mercado de la estación, ella tiene de poseer el negocio alrededor de 5 años, sus inicios fueron por la necesidad de obtener otros ingresos a su hogar, en su debido momento tuvo el apoyo de su tía y de su madre pero ella logro independizarse para tener un buen control de su negocio y fue así como  llego a instituirse por su propia cuenta logrando ser capaz de sacar adelante a su familia, el financiamiento lo desea para capital de trabajo como es la compra de sus productos ya que esta compra será realizada  en Guatemala  debido a que  ella obtiene mayor ventaja en lo que puede comprar diferentes productos encargados por sus clientes, otros de sus propósitos es pagar las deudas contraídas con la fundación león 2000 para  mantener abierta  su  línea de crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Elizabeth Karina Portocarreo González a 25-year-old unmarried mother of a 2-year-old daughter. Her domestic partner is a bricklayer. One of Ms. Elizabeth’s goals is to get ahead in life because of the situation we are experiencing in our country, which is unstable. For this reason, she decided to obtain additional income for her family and improve both her business and her life. Another factor for which she decided to start her own business was that it is a respectable occupation, which presents to her certain responsibilities, such as supporting her child and assuring her future studies.

Ms. Elizabeth sells merchandise such as: undergarments, cosmetics and footwear. She sells her products as a street vendor in the station market in León. She has owned her business for around 5 years. She started out of the necessity to earn extra household income. At the right moment, she received support from her aunt and mother, but she later became independent so that she could have better control of her business. Thus, she was able to start her own business and help her family move forward. She needs funds for work capital so that she can purchase products in Guatemala because it is more beneficial for to purchase the different goods that her customers order. Another one of her goals is to pay off any debts she has with Fundación León 2000 so that she can keep her credit line open.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Esperanza Demetria

texts.es:
La joven Esperanza Demetria H. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es  acompañada,  la joven  esperanza  tiene 2 hijos con las edades comprendidas entre los 19 años en su nivel de escolaridad  el varón  cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria y la niña de 7 años que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora en una compañía de electricidad, uno de los propósitos que ella tiene es de tener un restaurante en el cual pueda ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad de comida, y así poder realizar unas  mejoras a su vivienda y proporcionarle  a sus hijos un techo digno producto del esfuerzo de su trabajo, así mismo poder darle estudios para que el día de mañana se puedan defender por sus propios medios.

Son 15 años los que tiene de tener el negocio, la actividad  económica es la venta de refrescos y pan con mantequilla, su negocio esta ubicado en un tramo del mercado Santos Bárcenas o mejor conocido como la estación en león, Doña Esperanza  inicia en esta actividad por medio de una suegra que le brindo ayuda en la venta de refrescos y con esto logra adquirir experiencia en el negocio razón que la  impulsa a decidir a  tener su propio negocio de refrescos  y esto lo hace realidad por medio de una amiga quien le ofreció un establecimiento en el mercado y mas tarde consigue la venta del establecimiento   que ahora es propiedad de ella,  el motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para darles mejores condiciones a su establecimiento ya que de esta forma lograra permanecer en el mercado y mantendrá activo su negocio y lograr que sus clientes estén cómodos en su negocio y disfruten de su estancia.
texts.en:
The young Esperanza Demetria H. R. is 36 years old, her living status is a relationship. Esperanza has two children, her son who is 19 and just finished his fifth year of secondary scool and her seven year old daughter who is in the fourth year of primary school, her life partner works at an electric companies. One of the goals she has is to have a restaurant in which she can offer her customers a variety of food, and so realize some improvements in her life and give her children the sign of the dignity of her work, also giving them an education so that tomorrow they can survive on their own.

She has had the business for 10 years, the activiy is selling drinks and bread and butter. Her business is located in a stand in the Santos Barcenas market better known as the Station in Leon. Ms. Esperanza started her in this activity because a godmother gave her help selling drinks and with this achievement she acquired the exeperiene in business which pushed her to decide to have her own drink business which she realized by means of a friend who offered her a space in the market, which she later continued to buy. The motive of her loan is for capital to give better conditions in her space now that she has achieved a permanent place in the market and to maintain her activity to ensure that her customers are comfortable in her business and enjoy.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, principalmente cultiva papa y maíz, para que después de 6 meses pueda obtener las ganancias, la ventaja es que en sus tierras de cultivo existe canales de regadío todo el año, lo cual le permite reducir al máximo el riesgo a fracasar, por lo cual Sonia sigue  persistiendo en esta actividad, pero sabe que la dificultad mayor es sostenerse económicamente mientras se espera 6 meses a la cosecha,  por lo cual  optó por invertir en un negocio de farmacia, administrado por uno de sus familiares en la ciudad de Lima, así puede afrontar la economía junto a su esposo, que también ha optado por trabajar por su cuenta, mientras esperan la cosecha. Lo que motiva a Sonia a trabajar es ofrecer lo mejor a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicita este préstamo para su campaña de siembra, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, alquilará toros para el arado y parte de ello será también para seguir invirtiendo en la farmacia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. Since childhood, she has made a living in agricultural work, mostly in potatoes and corn, which take about 6 months to harvest and receive profits. The advantage is that her farm land is irrigated through canals throughout the year, which reduces the risk of crop failure. Sonia continues in this activity, but knows that the major difficulty is to remain financially stable during the 6 months before harvesting. Consequently, she has chosen to invest in her pharmacy run by one of her relatives in Lima. In this way, she can face the economy together with her husband, who has also decided to work while they wait to harvest the crops. Sonia's motivation to work is to offer the best to her children. This loan opportunity will be invested in to purchase fertilizer, rent bulls for plowing, and continue investing in their pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and rent bulls for plowing the land.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos. Anteriormente trabajaba ofertando su fuerza de trabajo en las duras tareas de una fábrica de ladrillos, pero decidió emprender su propia fuente de ingresos, que le permitiera disponer de su propio tiempo para también poder atender a sus hijos, es así que hace medio año  compró un torete, lo ha engordado y lo ha vendido, de esa manera pudo obtener una ganancia considerable con la que pudo adquirir cerdos, para luego venderlos a un precio más elevado a parte de ello, ha comprado cuyes, y ahora está aumentando su población. Estos progresos la animan a seguir trabajando de esta forma, por la cual va todas las mañanas a cortar el pasto necesario para alimentar a sus animales. Vicenta trabaja de esta manera porque desea que sus hijos se superen a través del estudio.  Solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más toretes para venderlos luego.
texts.en:
Vicenta is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 6 children. Until recently, she worked offering her efforts to the hard work of a brick factory, but she decided to start her own busines so that she could arrange her own schedule and attend to her children. About 6 months ago, she bought a cow that she raised and then sold to obtain funds to purchase pigs that she could sell at a higher price. Additionally, she has bought guinea pigs and is now increasing the size of the litter. These advancements encourage her to continue working this way and to get up every morning to cut the grass to feed her animals. Vicenta works because she wants her children to have a good education. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more cattle to subsequently resell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle to raise and subsequently resell

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 62 años, en la actualidad vive con dos de sus hijas. Ella siempre ha tenido muy buena sazón, lo que le ha permitido desempeñarse con éxito en la venta de comida, cuyos platos de fondo son los típicos de su región, regularmente vende estos platos en la ciudad de Lima, donde pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo, su trabajo consiste en levantarse de madrugada para preparar los platos y a las 6 de la mañana empezar a vender,  también a medio día ofrece almuerzos. En las tardes se dedica a planificar la venta del día siguiente y a lavar los platos sucios. Esta madre trabaja para apoyar a sus 2 hijas menores  en sus estudios superiores. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá invertir en comprar abarrotes, ingredientes esenciales para la preparación de sus comidas y también mercadería de dulces, porque desea  implementar su negocio de comidas con la venta de dulces. La meta de Aydee es poder tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Aydee is 62 years old and at the present she is living with two of her daughters. She has always had a good seasoning and therefore she has been successful in selling food, the typical dishes of the region. Regularly she sells these dishes in the city of Lima where she spends most of her time. Her work consists of getting up very early to prepare the dishes and at 6 o'clock in the morning she starts selling. She also offers lunches at noon. In the afternoons she plans the next day´s sale and wash the dirty dishes. This mother works to support her 2 young daughters in their secondary studies. She requests this loan to invest in buying groceries and the essential ingredients for her dishes and also candy as she wishes to add candy to her sales. Aydee´s goal is to own a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and raw material to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 22 años, en la actualidad vive con su esposo y su bebe de 3 meses.  Trabaja en la venta de cosméticos desde hace 9 meses, por medio de la invitación de una de sus amigas, la cual le ha favorecido bastante porque ahora puede tener un ingreso adicional al de su esposo, ella ofrece sus productos a sus amistades por medio del catalogo y de esa manera  muestra las novedades en sus productos, durante este tiempo de trabajo ha podido ahorrar, lo que le ha servido para afrontar los gastos en su hogar.  Ruth se esfuerza por su pequeña hija, que es su razón máxima, desea darle lo mejor.  Solicita este préstamo para incrementar la cantidad de cosméticos y también para implementar algunas necesidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Ruth is 22 years old and currently lives with her husband and 3 month old baby. She has worked in cosmetics sales for the past 9 months after she received an invitation from one of her friends. This activity has suited her well because she is able to have an income apart from her husband. She offers products to her friends through a catalog and in this way, shows them the newest products available. During this time, she has been able to save money in order to pay the household bills. Ruth works hard for her little daughter who is her main motivation because Ruth wants her to have the best. She requests this loan to increase her amount of cosmetics and to install some necessities in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Simeon

texts.es: Simeón tiene 54 años, vive al lado de su esposa y su hija. El trabaja en la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace mas de 5 años, diariamente está al cuidando de sus animales para sostener a su familia, también cultiva papa y maíz para luego venderlos. Su labor diaria consiste en realizar el cuidado de los animales que tiene, para ello corta el pasto por las mañanas, y cuida de sus tierras de cultivo para ver si están regadas las plantaciones, de esta manera garantiza los ingresos para su familia. Don Simeón se asegura tener ingresos económicos con la ganadería, porque muchas veces en la agricultura existen perdidas por los cambios climáticos severos.  Este padre y esposo, lucha para su familia progrese. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar más animales para poder vender.
texts.en:
Simeón is 54 years old and lives with his wife and daughter. He has worked in agriculture and livestock for more than 5 years, taking daily care of his animals in order to support his family. He also farms potatoes and corn that he sells retail. His daily work consists of taking care of the animals and cutting the grass for them each morning. He takes care of his farm land and makes sure the fields are irrigated. In this way, he earns income for his family. Simeón ensures that he has income from the livestock because often times, his crops fail due to the severe climate. As a father and husband, he works to improve conditions for his family. He requests this loan to purchase more animals that he can resell.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of livestock

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 12 y de 15 años. Trabaja cada día saliendo al campo a distancias considerables, horas de camino para pastear a sus animales, como ovejas, cerdos, acompañado de su burro, por ello sale temprano de su casa, deja listo el desayuno y almuerzo para sus hijos y regresa casi al anochecer, después de haber cumplido la tarea de  pastear a sus animales, luego de varios meses vende sus animales en la feria ganadera de Jauja, muchas veces el clima  lluvioso obstaculiza su trabajo. Lo que la motiva día a día a Irma son sus hijos. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de ovejas e incrementar así la cantidad de animales que pueda vender.
texts.en:
Irma is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children of ages 12 and 15. She works each day going far out into the fields, walking for hours, in order to take care of her animals, which include sheep, pigs, and a donkey. She leaves the house early in the morning, always leaving breakfast and lunch ready for her children, and returns home at dusk. After having completed her work of raising the animals, she sells them during various months in the livestock market in Jauja. Many times the rainy weather obstructs her work. Irma's day to day motivation is her children. She requests this loan to purchase sheep and to increase the amount of animals she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a larger amount of sheep

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid tiene 25 años, en la actualidad vive con su pequeño hijo de 4 años. Trabaja en la agricultura, como herencia que le dejaron sus padres, cultiva papa que después vende, su madre es su gran apoyo en todo lo que realiza y está para apoyarle siempre, es por ello que se aboca a las tareas del campo, en la época de siembra y también de cosecha para lo cual su madre está siempre presente para su ayuda. Mientras espera que la cosecha se de tiene un negocio adicional, que es la venta de ropa usada en la ciudad de Tacna, regresa periódicamente para velar por sus cultivos. Para Ingrid  esta actividad es la más factible, ya que al ser independiente, puede atender a su pequeño hijo, aunque a veces el viaje largo es muy pesado. Esta abnegada madre, solicita este préstamo con el invertirá en la siembra, es decir, para la preparación de la tierra con sacos de abono, arado y limpieza de la mala hierba.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 25 years old. Nowadays she lives with her small 4 year old son. She works in agriculture, as passed on to her by her parents. She grows potatoes and then sells them. Her mother is a big support in all that she does and is always there to help her. It's because of this that she is able to work in the fields. During planting season and also during harvesting her mother is always there to help. While she waits for the harvest, she has another business, which is selling used clothing in the city of Tacna. She returns periodically to watch over her crops. For Ingrid, this activity is the most feasible, since being independent enables her to care for her small son, although at times the long trip is very hard. This selfless mother requests this loan. With it she will invest in her crops, that is to say, to prepare the land with sacks of fertilizer, to plow and clear out weeds.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to prepare her land for planting

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long P. was born in 1955 and now she lives in Damnak Trayoeng village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Kong Nang, is a teacher in the local school. They are parents of three children who are enrolled in the school.

Even though, Mrs. Long P.’s family members have different jobs they still do not earn much money to live on. Thus, Mrs. Long P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise to add to her businesses. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cow to raise to add to her businesses

loans.name: Ne

texts.en: Mrs. Ne S. is a villager in Prey Preal village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She and her husband, Mr. Im Sam Art, are farmers. They do not earn much money to live on. Thus, Mrs. Ne S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fish to sell to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. She is 50 years old and she does not have any children. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam K. is a villager in Prey Preal village in Takeo Province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She and her husband, Mr. Bun Man, are farmers. With their businesses, they still do not earn enough money to live on. Thus, Mrs. Sam K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions. She is 50 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cow to raise to add to her business

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Ms. Leng K., 45, is a fried-banana seller in Kampong Thom province. She has sold fried bananas and potatoes on the street since 2000. Her husband, Mr. Sopheap Morn, is 46 years old. He has been a farmer and motor-taxi driver since 1995. He currently earns US$ 3 a day.

They have 6 children, all single. Two of them are employed as construction workers in Phnom Penh City and earn US$ 3.30 a day each.

Ms. Leng is now requesting US$ 500 to buy a generator and a trailer. The generator is for family's daily use and the trailer connects to her husband's motorcycle as a motor taxi. She estimates it would help her family's income and living conditions. She hopes to expand her husband's business to purchase a trailer and then open a big fried-banana store and build a new house in the future. Also she wants her children have higher education and get skills for a good job.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a trailer

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Ms. Sinoun K., 43 years old, is a housewife in Banteay Meanchey Province and currently has plans to start a pig-raising business. Her husband, Mr. Sat Chhorn, is a 49-year-old farmer who also works in a rice mill, earning in total $6 a day. The couple has two children, a daughter employed in a super market and a son who is a goldsmith in a local market.

Sinoun is now requesting a loan of $1,000 to complete the construction of the family house. She believes the loan will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To complete the construction of her house.

loans.name: Out

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Out S. has asked for a loan in order to improve her living conditions. She lives in Kour Chen Laeng Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sao Vuth, are farmers. They live in poor conditions because they have only one business. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Out S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business. She hopes to increase her income with this new loan. Mrs. Out S. is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en: Mr. Nem H. is a villager in Saraong Village in Takeo Province. He owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he now faces a small problem because of infertile soil. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support his field to make a better crop. His wife, Mrs. Nget Sy, assists him on the plantation. Mr. Nem H. is 34 years old and the father of two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his field to make a better crop.

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Mrs. Uth N. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Sen Born Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chin Tach, have a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the remaining three are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Uth N.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Uth N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her household to live in. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her household to live in.

loans.name: Khnar

texts.en: Mrs. Khnar T. is a villager in Ta Saom Village in Takeo Province. She owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Aside from this, she is a pig and cow breeder. Since these businesses are going well, she wants to expand them so she decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets and a cow for breeding. Mrs. Khnar T. is a 60-year-old widow with a child who helps her on her current businesses.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen D. is a farmer in Sen Born Village in Takeo Province while her husband, Mr. Nguon Ngoan, is a chicken breeder. They have four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school.

Their house lacks a protective fence, so Pen is requesting a loan to purchase cement and pay the construction costs. She hopes that she and her family will live in greater safety as a result of this loan. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and pay fthe construction costs of a protective fence.

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Mrs. Try B. lives in Preak Talai Village in Kadal Province where she and her husband, Mr. Phy Sarin, are vegetable sellers. Since the business is doing well, they want to expand, so Try is requesting a loan to buy more vegetable to resell to her customers.

Mrs. Try B. is 36 years old and the mother of three children. two of whom are attending the local school while the third, at the age of five, is yet too young to attend.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly P. is a farmer in Tonle Village in Takeo Province. In her plantation, she now faces an obstacle because of infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Ly P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Ses Sarin, helps out with his wife's plantation.

Mrs. Ly P. is 51 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch S. E. was born in 1973 and she now lives in Tonle Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a problE. because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To deal with this problE., Mrs. Ouch S. E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Long Sokong, is a soldier who can make a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Ouch S. E. has two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Ying

texts.en:
Mrs. Ying M. owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living while her husband, Mr. Loem Phorn, is a rice wine maker and pig breeder. Since the second business is doing well, Loem wants to expand it, so Ying is requesting a loan to buy seven more piglets and food to feed them. This will be her second loan; the first one was repaid on time.

Ying is 44 years old and the mother of a child employed in a garment factory. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy seven more piglets and food to feed them.

loans.name: Mrs. Noy La Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Noy L., 25 years old and the mother of a two-year-old child, is the group leader of five who all live in Slab Ta Aon Village in Kandal Province. Noy is a vegetable seller in the local village, and since this business is going well, she is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of vegetables to meet customer demand. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver making a small income that helps to support the family.

One member of this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Mrs. Men Sorphorn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Men S., the 31-year-old mother of a three-year-old, is a group leader of five, all living in the Reussei Srok Village in Kandal Province and all planning to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Men S. owns a small shop that sells coffee to villagers in the local village, and since the business is doing well, she is requesting a loan to expand by purchasing more coffee and ingredients for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Soam Thon, is a soya bean seller making a small income that helps support the family.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more coffee and ingredients to make for her customers.

loans.name: Mrs. Kong Sarim's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 12 people living in Damnak Trayueng Village in Takeo Province and is led by Mrs. Kong S., who owns 0.5-hectare upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Since this field is currently infertile, Kong is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to revitalize the land. Her husband, Mr. Tuon Sokha, is a motorbike taxi driver with a small income that helps support the family.

Mrs. Kong S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. Mrs. Horng L. is presented in the picture, substituting for her husband.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her rice field more productive.

loans.name: Mrs. Sin Ann's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people in Trapeang Lean Village in Takeo Province comprise this village bank loan, led by Mrs. Sin A., the 22-year-old mother of two children who are yet too young to attend school. Sin and her husband, Mr. C. Pros, are farmers who own 0.3-hectare of land upon which to cultivate rice. Unfortunately, their field is currently infertile, so Sin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to revitalize it.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mr. Morn Chek Group

texts.en:
Mr. Morn C., the 26-year-old father of two childR. aged one and four years, is the group leader of four people who live in Niel Village in Takeo Province. Morn is an ice-cream seller who makes a small income that helps support his family while his wife, Mrs. Eim Ry, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. However, due to the infertility of the soil, Morn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to revitalize it.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his wife's rice field.

loans.name: Mrs. Chek Phally Group

texts.en:
Five people who live in Chamka Tamao Village Kampong Chhnang Province comprise the group loan and they plan to use it for different purposes. Mrs. Chek P., the owner of a small grocery store in the local market, is the group leader. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Chan Boeurn, helps her in the business.

Mrs. Chek P. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while three are attending the local school and the youngest is yet too young to begin formal education.

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Murdani

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Murdani sudah menyelesaikan pinjamannya tahap pertama. Pada pinjaman pertama Ni Wayan Murdani memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan yang dipelihara selama 5 bulan. Hasil penjualan 4 ekor babi adalah 4 * Rp. 1.300.000.- = Rp. 5.200.000.- Pakan yang dihabiskan oleh 4 ekor babi selama 5 bulan adalah  4 * Rp. 750.000.- = Rp. 3.000.000.- Harga anak babi saat beli Rp. 250.000.- * 4 = Rp. 1.000.000.- Jadi selama 5 bulan pemeliharaan, Ni Wayan Murdani memperoleh keuntungan Rp. 1.000.000.-
Untuk pinjaman kedua difokuskan untuk pembelian pakan karena harga pakan babi saat ini sangat tinggi. Dengan induk yang dimilikinya saat ini, Ni wayan Murdani tidak khawatir dalam pengadaan anak babi.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Murdani is a debtor of DINARI Foundation, and has paid her first loan. With the first loan, she was able to raise 4 piglets, and within 5 months, she could sell them for Rp 1,300,000 each, and earned a total of Rp 5,200,000. She bought the piglets for Rp 250,000 each. To raise the piglets, she spent Rp 750,000 a month to purchase fodder, and spent Rp 3,000,000 in total. So in 5 months, Ni Wayan Murdani was able to earn Rp 1,000,000 income. The next loan will be used to purchase fodder which is now getting more expensive. For Ni Wayan Murdani has had a pig mother, she does not have to worry about how to get piglets.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Memelihara penggemukan

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try A., the 43-year-old mother of a child attending the local school, lives in Chambork Village in Takeo Province.  She owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice, but because her soil has become infertile, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers. Try’s husband, Mr. Ang Doeu, shown on the left in the photo, is a construction worker who makes only a small income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice field.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mr. Hong R. is a villager in Klaong Thvear village in Takeo Province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Pen Sokhoen, is a farmer. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they do not earn much money for good living conditions. Thus, Mr. Hong R. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to add to his business. He hopes to increase income and improve his living conditions with this loan. He is 25-years-old and the father of one child, who is too young to work or study. His wife is on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to his business.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sunantri

texts.id:
Pada pinjaman pertama, Ni Wayan Sunantri menggunakan pinjaman tersebut untuk membeli anak babi, pakan dan memperbaiki kandang. Hasil yang didapatkannya cukup lumayan karena Ni Wayan Sunantri selalu mendapat pendampingan dari staf dan dokter hewan dari Yayasan Dinari. Walupun sempat terserang penyakit, namun berkat ketekunan dan semangat yang dimilikinya, usaha yang dijalani bisa berlanjut dan mampu menambah penghasilan keluarga. Karena penghasilan keluarga maningkat, Ni Wayan Sunantri mampu membeli makanan yang lebih baik sehingga kesehatan keluarganya meningkat. Dengan bergabungnya dia dengan program Dinari, pengetahuannya pun bertambah.
Untuk pinjaman kedua ini akan dipergunakan untuk membeli anak babi untuk dipelihara selama 3 bulan untuk babi guling. Hal itu dilakukannya karena perputaran dananya cukup cepat.
texts.en:
Ni Wayan Sunantri used first loan from DINARI to purchase piglets, fodder, and to do some renovation on pigs cage. She earned good income for she runs the business with assistance from veterinarian provided by DINARI. Even though Ni Wayan Sunantri has ever been sick during doing the business, she always keep her strong willingness and keen on running her business for the income earned from the business could be used for fulfilling their family's daily needs. The more the income, the higher nutrition quality she could give, and the healthier her family members will be. Other benefit Ni Wayan Sunantri earns by joining DINARI is that she could broaden her knowledge. The second loan proposed will be used to purchase more piglets that will be raised for 3 months and sold as roasted pig material. She plans so because the capital turnover on her business is quite short.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha M. has been selling underwear and perfume in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She works from 10:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $70 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can further increase her inventory.

Asha is 27 years old, married, and has two children: a 2-year-old and a 4-month-old.

loans.use: To buy more underwear and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam H. prepares and sells food in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 6:00am to 4:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 70 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more of the ingredients that she uses in the foods that she prepares and sells.

Mariam is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to use to cook and sell food

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia H. sells fish in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 9:00am to 4:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $85 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish to sell and increase her sales and profit.

Rukia is 22 years old, married, and has one 2-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu S. has been selling fish in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $45 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish to sell and increase her sales and profit.

Mwanaulu is 30 years old, divorced, and has three children, aged 3, 5, and 7.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena R. has been selling juices and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $85 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can further increase her inventory.

Zuwena is 38 years old, married, and has four children, aged 4, 8, 14, and 15.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and juices to sell

loans.name: Tijara

texts.en:
Tijara A. has been a tailor and firewood-seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her tailoring busines and increase her inventory of firewood to sell.

Tijara is 23 years old, single, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mwanabaraka

texts.en:
Mwanabaraka P. has been a tailor in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Mwanabaraka is 20 years old, married, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mr. N. Ny, a villager in Kouk Trob Village in Kadal Province, is an ice-cream seller who now wants to sells his product door-to-door. He is therefore requesting a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike for that purpose. His wife, Mrs. Nheab Na, owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mr. N. Ny is 26 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the youngest is only two years old. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice-cream door-to-door.

loans.name: Nadhariu

texts.en:
Nadhariu M. has been selling homemade food items in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. She works for ten hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients for the local foods that she prepares and sell. If this loan helps her to increase her profit, she intends to put the extra money towards school fees for her children and food for her family.

Nadhariu is 30 years old, married, and has five children, aged 13, 12, 10, and 6 years, and one 2-month-old.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods she prepares.

loans.name: Chansorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chansorn S. lives in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Soem Chhouern, are farmers who have one hectare for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they now face a small problem because their field is infertile, which affects their crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Chansorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Chansorn S. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma M. has been selling clothing in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works for eight hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell and increase her profit. If her business expands, she hopes to use the additional money to buy more food for her family, save money, and reinvest in her business.

Salma is 23 years old, divorced, and has one, 1-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam K. sells charcoal and firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day and earns a profit of approximately $15 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood and charcoal to sell for a profit.  

Maryam is 22 years old, divorced, and has no children.

loans.use: To buy  more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha S. sells kangas in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. Kanga is a common local fabric designed with bright colors and any of a large variety of patterns. It is commonly used in Tanzania for clothing, baby slings, table cloths, and other household uses. Asha works from 7:00am to 6:00pm every day. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more kangas at bulk rates to resell in her shop.

Asha is 41 years old, divorced, and has four children, aged 5, 8, 12, and 13.

loans.use: To buy more kangas for her shop.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa H. V. has owned a small restaurant in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four months.  To date, she has been earning a profit of approximately $20 each month.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can increase the variety of foods sold in her restaurant.  

Mayasa is 23 years old, married, and has no children. She takes care of two dependents and one elderly parent.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her restaurant.

loans.name: Samoth Kong Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 13 people located in Trapang Chambok Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, led by Mr. Samoth K.. He and his wife, Mrs. Sor Malai, are farmers who own 1.5-hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice. Due to soil infertility, Samoth is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers.

Mr. Samoth K. is 38 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young at the age of three and four to begin formal education.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Twelve members have end-of-term loans and one has a monthly payment loan. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because the are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his wife's rice field.

loans.name: Cuiza

texts.en:
Cuiza M. sells homemade food in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 6:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients to enable her to increase her food output.

Cuiza is 40 years old, married, and has three children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha J. has been baking and selling bread in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works for six hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients and produce more bread. If she is able to increase her profit, she intends to use the additional money to pay her children's school fees, begin saving money, and reinvest in her business.

Asha is 31 years old, married, and has two children, aged 5 and 9.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the bread that she bakes.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou S. habite au quartier ndayane de Diourbel pres du lycéée.Il fait de l'embouche ovine depuis 17 ans. il est marié et a des enfants a charge.
texts.en:
Abdou S. lives in the Ndayane neighborhood of Diourbel close to Lycéée (Technical College). He has been raising sheep for seventeen years. He is married and is bringing up children.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising sheep

loans.name: Mrekwa

texts.en:
Mrekwa is 30 years old, married, and has one child who is one-and-a-half years old.

Mrekwa M. has been selling shoes, handbags, and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She works 10 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $70 each month. She is requesting her first loan ($175.00) from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop. If she succeeds in increasing her profit, she intends to save the extra money and re-invest in her business.

loans.use: Buy more shoes, handbags, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr:
SOKHNA S. EST COMMERCANTE DE TISSUS THIOUB PRETS A PORTER , SACS ,CHAUSSURES,... DEPUIS 03 ANS.
AVEC LE PRET ,IL COMPTE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES. ELLE EST MARIEE ET HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE DE DIOURBEL.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. has been selling "thioub" (hand-dyed cloth), as well as ready-to-wear, handbags, and shoes for 3 years.

With this loan, she hopes to boost her business. She is married and lives in the Champ de Course neighborhood of Diourbel.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: re-selling cloth, etc.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas S. is a friendly 31-year old married father of three girls and one boy aged 5 - 13, and he is also the caretaker of his deceased bother’s two young children. He supports his family working long days driving a boda boda (motorbike taxi) throughout Kampala. His days usually begin at dawn and stretch well into the evening. Thomas owns four motorbikes. He drives one of them and rents the other three for a fixed daily rate. In Kampala’s highly competitive market with thousands of boda bodas, Thomas enjoys a steady business and has regular clients. He attributes this to keeping his vehicles clean and well-maintained, using drivers who are licensed, safe, polite and trustworthy and his requirement that they wear helmets. Thomas has been a boda boda driver for ten years.

Thomas used his savings and a small loan from Pearl Microfinance to purchase his first motorbike four years ago. He has been using loans regularly since to expand his fleet and pay for routine maintenance and repair costs. Now, Thomas plans to sell his oldest bike, using the proceeds coupled with this loan to purchase a new one. He figures this will increase his daily revenue from 7,000 UXG to 10,000 UGX.

Thomas depends upon his business profits to pay for his children’s school fees and provide basic meals and clothing for his family. He hopes to keep expanding his boda boda business until he has enough money saved to purchase a pickup truck for commercial hauling. He says this market has much less competition and will enable him to earn more profit.

loans.use: Thomas would like to purchase a new motorbike for his small fleet of motorbike taxis.

loans.name: Pema

texts.en:
Pema U. F. has owned a small shop in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory for her shop.

Pema is 36 years old, married, and has five children, aged 5, 7, 12, 19, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
BABACAR S. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. IL EXCERCE COMME ACTIVITE LE COMMERCE DE ¨RODUITS COSMETIQUES DEPUIS 15 ANS. 
AVEC LE PRET IL COMPTE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES. IL EST MARIE.
texts.en:
Babacar S. lives in the Ndayane district of Diourbel. He has been selling cosmetics for 15 years.

With the loan, he intends to bolster his business. He is married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Karleta's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Karleta V.. She is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Karleta is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. She has 2 children and they go to school. Each week, Karleta makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Karleta is joined in her small group by R. Akongo, Judita I., Dudu J., and Ihiju P.. R. Akongo has a business selling bed sheets at the market and wants to expand her business. Judita I. is currently operating a business selling bread and wants a loan to expand her business. Dudu J. operates a business selling simsim and wants to expand the business. Ihiju P. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expanding their small businesses

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en:
Semeni K. has been selling perfumes and kangas in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years. Kanga is a local fabric decorated with bright colors and any of a variety of elaborate patterns. It is used for clothing, baby slings, curtains, and many other household needs. Semeni works from 8:0am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her perfume and kanga shop.

Semeni is 26 years old, married, and has three children, aged 2, 7, and 10.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes and kangas for her business.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
MODOU N. EST UN MENUISIER EBENISTE DEPUIS 17 ANS.IL HABITE AU QUARTIER GRAND DIOURBEL.
AVEC LE PRET , IL COMPTE ACHETER DU MATERILE TEL QUE LE BOIS, POUR LA CONFECTION DE MEUMBLES.
texts.en:
MODOU N. has been a cabinet-maker specializing in ebony for seventeen years. He lives in the GRAND DIOURBEL district. With this loan, he intends to buy some material, such as wood, for making furniture.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Chausiku

texts.en:
Chausiku M. sells charcoal and firewood in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 6:00am to 7:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $50 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

Chausiku is 48 years old, married, and has five children, aged 10, 16, 22, 25, and 30.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam B. has been selling pots in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for ten years. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately US$ 25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more pots to sell.

Mariam is 28 years old, married, and has two children, aged 4 and 9.
