loans.use: To buy more pots to sell for her business

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace P.. She is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Grace is 60 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. She has 2 children, aged 15 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Grace is joined in her small group by Grace D., Celementina I., Edward B., and Vitorina I.. Grace D. has a business selling local brew and wants to expand her business. Celementina I. is currently operating a business selling fruit such as guavas, oranges, etc. and wants a loan to expand her business. Edward B. operates a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Vitorina I. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand their small businesses

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili O. has been selling juice and clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $200 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan from so that she can buy more inventory for her shop.

Pili is 32 years old, married, and has one 1-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more juices and clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Sunday's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sunday L.. She is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Sunday is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant. Each week, Sunday makes approximately 150 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Sunday is joined in her small group by Grace IL., Bibiana I., Santina I., and Martha T.. Grace IL. has a business selling sweets and wants to expand her business. Bibiana I. is currently operating a business selling local brew and wants a loan to expand her business. Santina I. operates a business selling clothes and wants to expand the business. Martha T. is currently in the business of selling beans and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand their small businesses

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam A. is 35 years old, married, and has four children, ages 8, 13, 15, and 17. Maryam has been preparing and selling maandazi in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. Maandazi is a small fried dough product that is slightly less sweet than a donut. It is commonly eaten in Tanzania for breakfast or as a snack during the day.  

Maryam works from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. every day and earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She has previously taken out one loan through BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more ingredients for the maandazi that she cooks.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the maandazi that she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: SATOU N. EST VEND  DES CEREALES DEPUIS 07 ANS AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. AVEC LE PRET , ELLE COMPTE RENFORCER SES ACTIVITES.ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
SATOU N. has been selling grain for seven years in the NDAYANE district of DIOURBEL. With the loan, she intends to bolster her business. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in grain

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti J. has been selling firewood and coconuts in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She works from 8:00am to 8:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She has previously taken out one loan through BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory.

Siti is 30 years old, married, and has seven children.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr: SAYE DIOP EST COMMERCANTE ETABLI AU QUARTIER MEDINATOUL DE DIOURBEL DEPUIS DES ANNEES.AVEC LE PRET ELLE COMPTE ACHETER DES TISSUS, FAIRE DE LA TEINTURE POUR LES REVENDRE A SES  CLIENTS.
texts.en:
Saye Diop is a salesperson who has been working in the Medinatoul neighborhood of Diourbel for years. With this loan she intends to buy cloth and dye it for re-sale to her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of cloth and cosmetics

loans.name: Gpt Satou Toure Group

texts.fr:
LES MEMEBRES DE CE GROUPEMENT EVOLUE DANS LE COMMERCE DE TISSUS PENDANT TRES LONGTEMPS AU QUARTIER MEDINATOUL DE DIOURBEL.
AVEC LE PRET, ELLES COMPTENT RENFORCER LEUR ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
The members of this group have been working in cloth sales for a very long time in the Medinatoul district of Diourbel.

With this loan, they are expecting to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering their working capital

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.en: Muminjon rents a small barber shop in the center of the town. He just got married and doesn’t have any kids yet. He spends a lot of time serving his regular clients. Being very polite by nature and being professional at his job, he gathered a lot of clients. But serving many many clients has caused his equipment to wear out. So he needs to buy equipment of newer technology, like in developed countries. With the loan he plans to buy equipment for washing and drying client’s hair thus offer a better service.

loans.use: Purchasing inventory, equipment for his barber shop.

loans.name: Sugdibek

texts.en: Sugdibek has his own business selling stationery. He isn’t married yet. He lives with his parents and this way he helps them to support the family. He goes to 2-3 different cities to purchase stationery for cheaper prices. He already owns a little store. He wants to take a loan to repair his little store and equip it in a modern style.

loans.use: Repairing and refurbishing the store he owns

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Sharofat is the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a simple worker and doesn’t earn much. So to help her husband she started cooking cakes and selling them at the markets. Her cakes were so tasty that clients started to order cakes right in her house. Now since she has many regular clients she wants to buy good cooking equipment and thus produce more cakes.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking equipment.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina B. has been selling fish and octopus in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She works from 6:00pm to 10:00pm every day so that she can sell that day's catch to neighbors for dinner. She earns a profit of approximately $190 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish and octopus to sell.

Amina is 40 years old, married, and has four children, aged 18, 20, 22, and 23.

loans.use: To buy more fish and octopus to sell.

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima and her husband have their own business of perfumery products sale. They have 3 children. She goes to different cities which are far from her house to purchase goods for cheaper prices. She owns a little store at the market but it is a very old store. She wants to take a loan to repair her little store, equip it and purchase more goods.

loans.use: Repairing her store

loans.name: Hujamurod

texts.en:
Hujamurod rents a little store where he sells foodstuff. He buys his goods in another city which is away from his town about 100 miles. He goes for goods every week. His family members help him at the store. His products are popular in his town for being cheap and fresh. That’s why he has many regular clients.

He wants to take a loan for purchasing more goods and have more profit. And with bigger profit he plans to pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 44 years old, married, and has four children, aged 14, 16, 18, and 20.

Mtumwa K. has been selling kangas and pots in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. Kanga is a common local fabric used for dress, household needs, and baby slings. It is brightly colored and usually contains an elaborate pattern and a Swahili adage on the bottom.

Mtumwa works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every day and earns a profit of approximately $70 each month. She previously took out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan ($250.00) so that she can buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: Buy more kangas and pots to sell

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.en:
Shohruh rents a little store where he sells construction materials and paints. He buys his goods from different cities, wherever they are cheaper, and sells them. He purchases goods every week. He has a big family – 6 kids. His family members also help him at the store. He has many regular clients.

He wants to take a loan for purchasing more goods and make more profit. And with bigger profit he plans to purchase his own small store someday.

loans.use: To purchase a small store

loans.name: Amonjon

texts.en: Amonjon rents a heavy truck and he buys consumer and grocery products from one city and sells them in another city wholesale. But the main way he earns money is by transporting goods for clients. He isn’t married yet and lives with his parents. and so he supports his family. He wants to take loan to buy more goods for sale and with more profit he wishes to purchase his own truck.

loans.use: To expand his business and purchase a truck.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is not married yet and lives with her parents. She has a small cattle ranch. She raises cattle and then sells them at the market, and at the same time she provides her family with milk products. Her father also helps her out because it is hard work to look after them. Mavzuna buys cattle almost every week. After fattening them for a month, she sells them.

With the help of loan, she plans to increase her livestock and construct a comfortable winter cow-shed for her cattle.

loans.use: Increase livestock and construct a winter cow-shed

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha S. sells food in the Kikwajuni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She earns a profit of approximately $125 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes and oil to sell in her shop. If she succeeds in increasing her profit, she intends to use it to reinvest in her business so that it will continue to grow.

Aisha is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 20.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and oil.

loans.name: Yokub

texts.en: Yokub is a married man and has a small business of his own in order to feed his family. He buys construction materials from other cities and sells them. But as he doesn’t have a place at the market he sells them from his house. Now that he has so many clients he wants to build a small store at the marketplace. So he wants to take a loan to earn more profit and, by saving his money, have enough to build a store.

loans.use: To build a small store

loans.name: Bisalima

texts.en: Bisalima is a mother of 3 children. She has her own business selling fruits and vegetables. She buys her goods from big wholesale stores and sells them at the small market by her house. She wants to take a loan for repairing her small place at the market from which she sells her goods and also increase her inventory.

loans.use: Repair her stall and buy stock

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura’s business is selling women’s and kids’ clothes. She has done it for several years and by now she knows this business very well. She knows what to buy and when to sell. She has 1 kid. Her husband is a simple worker. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods to sell and thus make more profit. With that profit she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more goods

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira has sold fabrics for women’s clothing at the market for many years. Her fabrics are some of the best at the market. By now she has many clients. She knows her business very well. She has 3 kids. Her husband works as a carpenter. She wants to borrow money for purchasing more goods to sell and thus have more profit. And with that profit she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more goods and expanding her business

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en: Maksudjon has a small store where he sells confectionery goods. He isn’t married yet. He lives with his parents and this way he helps them to support the family. He buys his goods from other cities for much cheaper prices. He wants to take a loan for repairing his little store and equipping it in a modern style.

loans.use: Repairing his store

loans.name: Anzurat

texts.en: Anzurat has a small business – cooking all kinds of cakes and selling them at the market. Her husband is a simple worker and doesn’t earn that much. So to help her husband she started cooking cakes and selling them at the markets. But her cakes were so tasty that clients started to order cakes right in her house. She wants to take a loan for purchasing good cooking equipment and thus produce more cakes.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment for cooking.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma S. sells food in the Kikwajuni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $125 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory for her food shop.

Fatma is 32 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 1 and 14.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Sheroz

texts.en: Sheroz has his own business of raising cattle and selling their meat. He isn’t married yet. He lives with his parents and this way he helps them to support the family. He buys cattle at the markets and after fattening them sells their meat. He has a small place at the market where he sells it. His dream is to build his own butcher shop. He wants to take a loan for building a store and equipping it.

loans.use: Purchasing forage for cattle.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha A. O. has been selling tea and chapati from her home in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar since 2004. Every morning, neighbors come over to buy the tea and fried pancakes that she prepares. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more ingredients for the breakfasts that she prepares.

Asha is 32 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 1 and 14, including one set of twins.

loans.use: To buy more tea and ingredients for chapati.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila’s business is selling kids’ clothes. She has done it for several years; by now, she knows this business very well. She has many clients. Her husband is a simple worker. She wants to borrow money to purchase more goods for selling and thus have more profit. With that profit, she can provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more goods

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Tum U. has owned a beauty salon in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar since 2005. She begins work at 7:00 AM every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $165 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more of the goods necessary for her beauty salon.

Tum is 27 years old, widowed, and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy more items to use in her beauty salon

loans.name: Furkatjon

texts.en: Furkatjon got married not long ago. His wife doesn’t have a job but helps her husband in his business. Furkatjon rents a small grocery store in the center of the town where he lives. He has many clients because his grocery products are cheaper. He has a wish to build his own store but needs a lot of money for it. So he wants to borrow money and use it in his business to make more profit. He will start saving money from his profits for a store and hopes that soon he will be able to start building his own store.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment for his store.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en: Hosiyat, a mother of 3 kids, has an old small store where she sells consumer products and foodstuffs. She buys her goods in another city which is far from her town. She goes for goods every week. Her family members also help her at the store. Her products are popular in her town for being cheap. That’s why she has many constant clients. She wants to take a loan for repairing her old store and purchasing more goods to have more profit.

loans.use: For repairing her old store and purchasing more goods

loans.name: Rahma's Group

texts.en:
Rahma K. A. has been selling vegetables, coconut, and small snacks in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar since 2004. She begins work at 8:00am every morning and is able to earn a profit of approximately $25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more vegetables and coconuts to sell in her shop.

Rahma is 30 years old, married, and has five children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mwatima's Group

texts.en:
Mwatima M. has been selling food in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She begins preparing the foods at 10:00am and sells them throughout the day. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. Mwatima is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice, firewood, charcoal and fish so that she can prepare foods and sell them.

Mwatima is 30 years old, divorced, and has four children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods that she prepares and sells.

loans.name: Tukolere Wamu Women's Group

texts.en:
Robinah N. is the chairperson of Tukolere Wamu women’s group in Masajja. She has had a business for the past 4 years of selling fresh green bananas from a stall not far away from where she stays with her family. She sells both bunches of matooke and ones that she has picked so that all her customers are catered to.

Robinah is a married woman with 4 kids, all in school, while she helps out her parents in the village time and again. Her husband is a farmer keeping animals and poultry at home, as well as being a contractor building people's houses, and together they work so hard for their well-being and that of their children.

Robinah needs a loan to enable her to buy more matooke for sale from trucks, but she also has a plan of starting to sell firewood from the same stall plus keeping goats in December. She is surely grateful for her loans.

loans.use: Robinah needs a loan to enable her to buy more matooke for sale.

loans.name: Saada's Group

texts.en:
Saada H. S. has been selling kangas and other fabrics in her shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. Kanga is a local material used for clothing and household needs. It is often brightly colored and contains an elaborate pattern. Saada works from 7:00am to 8:00pm every day and she is able to earn a profit of approximately $85 each month She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more kangas for her shop.

Saada is 29 years old, married, and has four children, aged 8, 5, 3, and 2-and-a-half.

loans.use: To buy more kangas and other fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en:
Nurali is a divorced man with 4 kids. He and his kids live with his parents. He has been in agrobusiness for many years. He grows wheat and grapes and sells these products at the market. He wants to take a loan for purchasing fertilizers and wheat seeds for the coming season while they are still cheap.

Unfortunately he had gone to the field and so we took a picture of his son selling raisins and brooms at the market.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, wheat seeds for planting

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida A. M. sells charcoal and coconuts in the Melinna neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more charcoal and coconut to sell.

Hamida is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children: a 13-year-old and 8-year-old twins. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya and Khadija, who also own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Umarali

texts.en: Umarali is a father of 4 grown children. He has a small business raising cattle. He raises cattle and then sells them at the market. His kids also help him out in his business. He buys cattle for a cheaper price from the markets and, after fattening them for a month, he sells them. He also has a small business of repairing used furniture. He plans to increase the number of his livestock but doesn’t have a bigger cow-shed. With the help of loan, he wants to construct a comfortable cow-shed for his cattle.

loans.use: Increase the number of livestock and construct a cow-shed

loans.name: Mwesigwa Jalia's Group

texts.en:
Jalia M. is a client of Pearl Microfinance in Massajja. She is a business woman selling green bananas (‘matooke’) and tap water from her home since 2001. She has been in her lending group for one year and so far, the situation is not bad. She is married with six children and she cares for two orphans including paying their school fees and up-keep, and providing clothing for them. With her matooke selling business, she sells both bunches and banana fingers plucked and this has enabled her to sell more, since not everyone can afford a bunch.

Jalia needs a loan to help with buying more produce for sale from the trucks that usually bring to her place; though, at times, she waits for the trucks by the road side. She also has a dream of starting up a retail shop with a hope that it will bring in more profits; hence, a much better life for her family.

loans.use: To help with buying more produce for sale from the carriage trucks

loans.name: Nachia's Group

texts.en:
Nachia A. has been selling firewood in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She begins working at 7:00am every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $60 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood to sell.

Nachia is 28 years old, divorced, and has 3 children, aged 12 years, 10 years, and 6 months. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Magulata and Hamida, who also own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mwanate's Group

texts.en:
Mwanate KH. has been selling charcoal and small snacks in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar since 2007. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $85 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and flour to help her prepare more snacks.

Mwanate is 30 years old, married, and has five children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mashavu, who sells clothing in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and flour for her business.

loans.name: Mwajuma's Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma Z. sells charcoal in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works from 7:00am to 9:00pm every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She has previously received one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more charcoal to sell for a profit.

Mwajuma is 26 years old, married, and has one 3-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sada, who sells clothing in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Etienne Leopold

texts.fr:
ETIENNNE LEOPOLD N. COMMERCIALISE DU BOISSON ALCOOLISE DEPUIS 08 ANS AU QUARTIER RANDOULENE NORD DE THIES.
AVEC LE PRET , IL COMPTE RENFORCER SON STOCK DE MARCHANDISE.
texts.en:
Etienne Leopold N. has been selling alcoholic beverages for 8 years in the Randoulene North neighborhood of Thies.

With the loan, he is counting on bolstering his stock of beverages.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering his stock of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Sinatambo's Group

texts.en:
Sinajambo N. D. cooks and sells soup and bread in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She is able to earn a profit of approximately $40 each month. She has previously taken out one loan through BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more charcoal and flour to use as she prepares the foods that she sells.

Sinajambo is 47 years old, married, and has four children, aged 13, 11, 10, and 4. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mwashamba, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and flour to use for the foods she cooks and sells.

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es: Isolina tiene 50 años, está casada con Flavio, quien es profesor y sus hijos son Marlene de 24, Maribel de 21 y José Luis de 15. Hace 5 años Isolina se viene dedicando a la venta de artículos de cristalería, ollas a presión, viandas, vasos de vidrio, etc. con lo que ha podido ayudar al aporte familiar, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos de vestido y educación de sus hijos. Es así que realiza la venta de su mercadería en algunos de los mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca de forma ambulatoria, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, gustándole su trabajo, ya que le gusta sentirse útil ayudando a la economía familiar. Isolina quiere que sus hijos prosperen y se dediquen a lo que más les guste para que sean felices con su profesión. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más ollas, vasos, etc., para incrementar sus ventas y hacer en el futuro un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Isolina is 50 years old. She is married to Flavio, who is a professor, and their children are 24 year old Marlene, 21 year old Maribel, and 15 year old Luis. Since 5 years ago, Isolina has worked selling glassware, pressure cookers, food, glasses, etc. with which she has been able to help support the family, since the salary of her husband is not able to cover the costs of the clothes and education of their children. It is in this way that she carries out the sale of her merchandise in some of the city of Juliaca markets through traveling sales. From 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon, she enjoys her work, since she likes to feel useful helping with the family finances. Isolina wants her children to prosper and work in what they like the most so that they are happy with their professions. With the money from the loan she will buy more pans, glasses, etc., to increase her sales and make her business more profitable in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: Lino tiene 23 años, vive solo en un cuarto que alquila cerca de su trabajo. El es un joven muy trabajador y empeñoso, se ha venido dedicando, desde hace ya 3 años, al negocio que con mucho esfuerzo inicio, su taller de carpintería. Este taller está creciendo, Lino ya cuenta con un ayudante que lo apoya, trabajando juntos duro y parejo, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de noche elaborando diversidad de muebles. A Lino le grada su trabajo, ya que le gusta crear, muchas veces inventa los modelos de las camas, sillas, mesas, etc. Lo único difícil es la adquisición del material para la elaboración de estos muebles, los cuales van subiendo de precio. Lino quiere ser un joven empresario con un futuro prometedor. Es así que con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá material para elaborar muchos más muebles, para consolidar su negocio y que sea mucho más amplio.
texts.en:
Lino is 23 years old. He lives alone in a room that he rents near his work. He is a hardworking young man. He has been working, since 3 years ago already, in his carpentry business, which he started up with much effort. This workshop is growing. Lino already has an assistant who helps him, working hard and equally together from 8 in the mornting until 7 a night making a variety of furniture. Lino appreciates his work, as he likes to create. He often invents the models for the beds, chairs, tables, etc. The only difficult thing is to acquire the materials for making this furniture, as their prices are rising. Lino wants to be a young businessman with a promising future. Accordingly, with the money from the loan he will purchase material to make a lot more furniture in order to strengthen his business and make it much bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the materials necessary for making furniture

loans.name: Katerin

texts.es: Katerin tiene 20 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, es soltera y vive en casa de unos familiares. Desde que termino la secundaria y no teniendo posibilidades para seguir estudios superiores, decidió dedicarse al comercio, es así que desde hace 4 años puso una librería, donde ofrece, cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc. El negocio va bien, justamente por la dedicación que le pone Katerin, abriendo desde las 8 de la mañana y quedándose hasta las 9 o 10 de la noche, para poder alcanzar las ganancias deseadas. Lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día atendiendo su negocio, ya que tiene que dejar de lado otro tipo de actividades, pero pasando este pequeño inconveniente, a ella le agrada su trabajo porque es tranquilo y le permite ganar lo suficiente para su manutención. Katerin quiere ser una mujer independiente que no necesite de nadie para ser feliz y logrará todos sus objetivos. Con el dinero del préstamo implementará mejor su librería, y así abarcar la preferencia de los clientes, para en un futuro hacer que su librería sea las más grande y la que satisfaga las necesidades de todos.
texts.en:
Katerin is 20 years old. She is a native of the city of Juliaca. She is single and lives in the house of some relatives. Since she finished high school and did not have opportunities to continue with higher education, she decided to work. Therefore, four years ago she set up a book store, where she offers folders, pens, books, etc. The business is going well, precisely because of the dedication Katerin gives it, opening from 8 in the morning and staying until 9 or 10 in the evening to be able to earn the income she wants. The hardest part for her is to have to spend all day tending to her business, since she has to put off other activities. But in spite of this small inconvenience, she likes her work because it is laid-back and allows her to earn enough for her basic needs. Katerin wants to be an independent woman who does not need anyone to be happy and achieve all of her goals. With the money from the loan, she will stock her book store, and therefore meet the preferences of the clients, so that in the future she can make her store the biggest and satisfy the needs of everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her bookstore to meet the needs of her clients

loans.name: Yudi

texts.es: Yudi tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en casa de unos familiares. Se dedica a la venta de carne en el mercado Cerro Colorado de la ciudad de Juliaca, desde hace 6 años. Realiza la venta desde las 8 o 9 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 5 o 6 de la tarde, gustándole su trabajo, ya que el tiempo de experiencia que tiene ha hecho que se le haga sencillo realizarlo y no encontrarle ninguna dificultad, mas bien todo lo contrario a tenerle mucho cariño, ya que gracias a él, puede mantenerse y forjarse un mañana prometedor. Yudi quiere un futuro mejor, con una familia e hijos a quienes poder ofrecer las mejores comodidades. Con el dinero del préstamo hará el mantenimiento de su máquina de cortar carne, y comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en carne para aumentar sus ingresos y en el futuro tener un emporio.
texts.en:
Yudi is 19 years old. She is single and lives in the house of some relatives. She sells meat in the Cerro Colorado market in the city of Juliaca since 6 years ago. She sells from 8 or 9 in the morning until about 5 or 6 in the afternoon. She enjoys her work, since the experience she has gotten makes it easy to do her work and she doesn't have any problems. In fact, just the opposite, since thanks to her business she can support herself and establish a more promising tomorrow. Yudi wants a better future, with a family and children to whom she can offer the best comforts. With the money from the loan, she will do the maintenance on her meat cutting machine and will buy large quantities of meat to increase her income and in the future have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her meat cutting machine, and to increase the quantity of her products
